Three of these exist in total—one held by Marina, one given to Luca's mother, and one set up as a prize at the casino in order to lure in the other owners.

In reality, these items contain research left behind by Zegra—crystallized information about a means of transcending humanity.

The casino of Paradise Isle, whose motto is to provide opportunities for the ambitious who seize the moment.

At the back of the building, there is a massive slot machine called the Money Muncher that is the shining symbol of the casino.

A hidden treasure rumored to have been left behind by the great pirate captain Zegra.

Pirates and salvagers have searched everywhere for it, hoping for great fortune. In reality, the treasure was not in the form of gold or silver, but rather research information from the captain and Adala regarding the power to alter mortal life.
2: Though Zegra's ambitions were put to an end, his son received an unwelcome gift from his research—awakening to powers much like the people of Shibuya did. Along with this, he claims to now hear a voice coming from the deep, but whether or not this is related to his powers remains to be seen.

1:
A product of Zegra's research, this monster was created by crossing Zegra's mutated DNA with a dragon.

Alk and the others encountered this creature during their casino heist. It seemed to be under some level of control.

A Star Augur and researcher. She conducted research alongside the diseased Zegra to transcend humanity. She attempted to use Luca, who inherited his father's DNA, to bolster her research. Likely due to Luca's other genes, however, her experiment failed, and in the end she disappeared at the hands of an enraged Belsidia.
エレメントグレネード
A weapon that houses elemental energy. Removing the pin causes a violent elemental reaction, resulting in a bright flash of light.

A shadowy organization with a presence on many worlds. Like Alk and the others, they seem to have a means of hopping between worlds.

Their basic philosophy is focused entirely on transcending humanity. As such, the members of this organization will commit any atrocity necessary to reach their goals.
2:
The priests who were in charge of the small citadel in the misty mountains where Phiria and Cecilia once lived called themselves the Star Augurs. They gathered up children and attempted to cultivate powers within them. Phiria gained her powers in such a way.

Arum was treated similarly, which was proof enough that the Star Augurs cared little for both humans and fiends.
3:
The first time Phiria and Cecilia left the citadel, it was to ascend the battlefield in the Home of the Champions. It was then that they first learned of the existence of elves, beastfolk, fiends and daemons.

Despite the investigations that Lilith conducted, the citadel that these two called home has yet to be found.
4:
揺らぎの迷宮生誕50周年の式典で起きた
襲撃事件の裏にも、プロキオと名乗る
星詠みの男の暗躍があった。

秘宝アンチオブザーバーを奪い
廃竜を揺らぎの迷宮に引き入れて
その罪を全て共謀者のオーガス・エイトラン
ひいてはエイトラン家に着せるという
思惑があった模様だが、冒険者達の活躍により
事件は収束した。
プロキオの真の目的がなんだったのかは
未だ判明していない。
5:
ファーランドにおいて再発した
魔物災害事件にも星詠みの関与が判明した。

エイトラン領に研究所を構え
秘密裏に資金と設備の提供を受けていた彼らは
災害の元凶と思わしき『触手を有する』魔物の
研究を進めていたようである。

これにはエイトラン家のみならず、その宗家
フォーラーも関与しており、フォーラーは
その主たる責はエイトランにあると主張するが
イーセリア暗殺事件からフォーラーを追う
ヴェロンは、両者の関係がその当時から
続いている事を確信しているようだ。

1: The Yokai Encyclopedia: The Art of Change
ヨウカイズカンヘンサンキ
Suizen asked Alk and co. to join Kugui in her quest to edit the second volume of the Yokai Encyclopedia.
2:
Alk and co. were dragged into the competition that Gramp Zigza set up between Kugui and Ryouki. Though Kugui was initially hesitant because she couldn't control her powers, Ryouki gave her the encouragement she needed, and a battle between artists of the East and West began.

Everyone aided Kugui in defeating the shikigami that had been haunting her. With all said and done, Kugui and Ryouki started to work on the encyclopedia in earnest.

1:
A reference guide filled with pictures that Inaho and Gramp Zigza created together. It is meant to give humans an introduction to all manner of yokai.

Distributed during the holidays, it was an instant hit with both humans and yokai.
2:
With Gramp Zigza's portrayal of yokai being too close to reality, a curse sprung forth, twisting yokai's natures from the fears of the readers. The popularity of the encyclopedia only exacerbated the issue.

In an effort to prevent further problems, Suizen bade Kugui to edit the next volume, but her efforts only increased the quality and popularity of the encyclopedia.

1: ガキョウロウジンジグザ

A famous artist from Yamato. He has devoted his life to art and will draw anything he is interested in. On the other hand, he is extremely stubborn and refuses to draw anything that hasn't caught his eye.

He is the artist of the manga Koizora☆Azuki Style: An Illustrated Tale of Forbidden Romance, or KoiAzu for short.

The shortened name of the manga Koizora☆Azuki Style: An Illustrated Tale of Forbidden Romance.

The story inside portrays love and heart-rending partings and is packed with comedy, tragedy, and action. Extremely popular, all its fans anxiously await each new chapter, which only comes when its author Gramp Zigza finally decides to update on a whim.

One of the heroines of KoiAzu. After Inaho came crashing into his life and demanding a KoiAzu update, Gramp Zigza had a flash of inspiration and introduced Princess Inaba into the story. She's currently one of the most popular characters of the series.
The main character of KoiAzu. A wanderer with good looks, he is extremely popular with the fans.

Her full name is Ryouki Kochi. She was born in the East and now studies under Gramp Zigza as his disciple after angrily tracking him down to demand he update KoiAzu.

Her artistic abilities are so advanced that most people would never guess that she only began to paint three months ago.

When Kugui was unable to bring herself to paint, Ryouki was there to cheer her up through friendship and a healthy dose of rivalry.

The familiars, yokai, spirits, and paper servants that diviners employ. The same type of shikigami can take vastly different forms, depending on its diviner's techniques and powers. Sometimes a shikigami can even run rampant on its own.
The Descension: A Requiem for You
コウリントウバツキミニトドケルチンコンカ

Even Palpebra celebrates Halloween with pumpkins and costumes.

While Dia enjoyed her new body, Corinna played with the children, and Renoir watched on with a smile, a flustered Falsche arrived with some bad news.

It appeared that the real undead had come to join the festivities.
2:
Thanks to Dia's song and everyone else's help, they were able to purify the jack-o'-lantern. At the end of the day, Falsche also received a treat of her own.

However, while the sprites were finished causing mayhem, a certain mad scientist was ready to keep the tricks going.

1: A festival held in Palpebra during the autumn season. As part of the celebrations, people dress up in costumes and walk around town. Children will walk up to adults and say, "trick or treat"—demanding that adults either give them candy or be tricked.
2:
異なる文化を持った都市が融合した事で
それぞれのハロウィンに変化が生まれた。
お祭り要素の強いハロウィンが
渋谷からパルペブラへと広がり
逆に身近な人を失った渋谷の人々の中には
死者の弔いをする者の姿もあった。

クリスマスやマギフェスを経て
パルペブラと渋谷の友好が深まった事で
文化も自然に融合してきたようである。

1: The remnants of strong emotions left behind in a place. They sometimes serve to form spirits of the dead. However, these beings have no soul and are closer to moving energy, which will one day dissipate if left on its own.
2:
特段に強い残留思念は、感情だけに留まらず
『思考』すらも残す場合があり
それはしばしば対話可能な人の姿を取る。

一説によれば、これは残留思念に感化された
その人物当人の内的世界において描かれる
ある種の夢のようなものとされているが
この真偽がどうあれ、残留思念が生者に対して
非常なる影響を与える事は間違いない。

遺された思念に囚われ、意志を奪われる様は
まさに『呪われた』と言うに相応しいが
それを己の力と意志にする事ができるのならば
『願い』と言う事も、できるのかもしれない。
3:
とある魔法理論の識者曰く
『残留思念もまた現実を塗り替える力を持つ』
とするならば、魔族の使う『呪い』の力や
ゴースト達が起こす心霊現象にも
説明がつくようになるという。

『死者は歪めた現実にも自己を見失わない。
そもそも現実に生きていないから。
だから、それは一方的なんだ。』

1: Driven by Hope, Guided by Light
ネガエヒカリノツグビトタチヨ

As Palpebra celebrated the fiftieth anniversary of the Kaleidoscope, the people also prepared for the ceremony finalizing Palpebra's partnership treaty with the Farlands.

With everyone else ready to move forward with their lives, Phiria herself resolved to do the same.
2:
The masterminds behind the attack on the ceremony were a Star Augur and a member of the Oxtan family, one of the Farlands' Nine Noble Houses.

Through the combined efforts of the Starview crew, the Farlands' knights, and Palpebra's adventurers, the Star Augur Procheon's plans were foiled, and the celebrations resumed.

1:
A particular concern of Stella's whenever people in Starview recommend clothes and swimsuits.

"Why does everyone prefer clothes that do not cover a sufficient amount of surface area?"
ユラギノメイキュウセイタンゴジュウシュウネン

Palpebra celebrated fifty years of the Kaleidoscope bringing the surrounding area great economic and technological benefits. With the Farlands' already in town for the partnership ceremony, Palpebra was livelier than ever with entertainers and performers filling its streets.

A Star Augur. In an attempt to transcend, he used Orgus Oxtan to obtain the Anti-Observer, a sacred relic. When Alk and company drove him into a corner, he used the relic's power to transform himself and take a final stand.

The oldest son of the House of Swes, one of the Farlands' Nine Noble Houses, and Libram's older brother.

"In trade, all parties must stand to gain." With his family motto in mind, he did all he could to make sure the partnership treaty between the Farlands and Palpebra was successful.

Sitting atop the throne of Nihil, the House of Nialas leads the Nine Noble Houses of the Farlands. Razelt belongs to this house and is fourteenth in line to the throne.

Succession is often the cause of fighting in the Farlands, as each of the Nine Houses has their own goals and agendas.
2: Thirty years prior, Etheria Nialas, thirteenth in line to the throne, was assassinated. The Farlands and Palpebra blamed each other for the incident, which soured relations between them.
3: The Fourth Noble House, the House of Kweter, was responsible for Etheria Nialas' death. This knowledge is known only to a select few, as it was deemed politically inconvenient for the information to be shared.
4:
再来した魔物災害を経て
次代の王位争奪戦の有力候補である
王子達の勢力図にも大きな変化があり
一般市民達からの関心も強まっている。

尚、継承権十四位の王子については
完全に蚊帳の外に置かれている模様。

1:
The First House of the Nine Noble Houses of the Farlands. Highly skilled, they are responsible for the royal family's security. Some of their members also attend to those in line for the throne.

In the house of Oinas, only those who can defeat their opponents in one strike are considered true warriors.

The Second House of the Nine Noble Houses of the Farlands. Responsible for the kingdom's finances, they hold a lot of sway over the other houses, including the royal line. They also keep in close contact with several people in the line of succession, as well as distant relatives of the royal family.

The Third House of the Nine Nobles Houses of the Farlands. They are responsible for international military matters. As such, the knights of their house boast pride in their swordsmanship.

In recent times, their most skilled swordsman in the past 100 years ended up being a young girl, which caused a great stir.
2:
魔物災害にあたり、順当な理由もなしに
他家の領分を犯してはならないと
不動を貫いていたサーディアだったが
ユーウェル・ナインズからの申し出により
名目を得た際には当主自らが兵を率いて
参戦し、魔物災害へ立ち向かった。

軍事力の当事者として、政治への積極的関与を
避ける傾向のあったサーディアだったが
事件後、現当主のシエル・サーディアが
王位継承者の擁立に動いたという
噂がまことしやかに囁かれているようである。

1:
The Fourth House of the Nine Noble Houses of the Farlands. They are the eyes and ears of the kingdom, dealing in espionage and intelligence.

Most people, including the other houses, tend to keep far away from the House of Kwetur, due to their shadowy activities and many spies.
2: The Kweturs have been trying to assassinate Vyron for a while now, as the man knows they are responsible for the murder of Etheria Nialas.
3:
再発した魔物災害事件にあたって
フォーラーはエイトランと共に
ヘクシズ提案のパルペブラの支援要請を
頑なに拒否していた。

後にエイトラン領から発見された
隠蔽された魔物研究所の活動にフォーラーも
関わっていた事が判明すると
フォーラーはこれを魔物事件の解決に
功を焦った一部の者と、エイトランの暴走で
あると釈明している。

事件調査後、この供述を更に疑うだけの
証拠は見つからなかったが、他家からの
不信は強まっており、国内における
フォーラーの影響力は低下する事となった。

1:
The Sixth House of the Nine Noble Houses of the Farlands. They deal in commerce, industry, and foreign affairs for the kingdom.

Their house motto is, "In trade, all parties must stand to gain." Many of their members seek to strengthen ties with Palpebra because of its rapid development.
2: Swes' eldest son Azrail did his utmost to ensure the Farlands' partnership treaty with Palpebra succeeded. As one of Etheria Nialas' staunchest supporters thirty years ago, his efforts were for himself as much as they were for her.

1: The Seventh House of the Nine Noble Houses of the Farlands. In charge of the kingdom's Bureau of Magic, many of its members are passionate about magic and have little interest in politics. As they share good relations with Voluntas Arcane Arts Academy, they are amicable toward Palpebrans.
2: Voluntas Arcane Arts Academy's propensity to revolutionize magical theory proved very valuable for House Sextan—so much so that they even chose to send Luciada, a girl from their house, to Palpebra as an exchange student. Though their intent was clearly to foster good relations with the foreign nation, some wonder whether she could also have been sent as a spy.

1:
The Eighth House of the Nine Noble Houses of the Farlands. Their devout members are in charge of organizing festivals and events for the kingdom.

Originally a branch family of the Kweturs, they were split to diffuse some of their political power, but they still share strong ties with their former brethren even now.
2:
『揺らぎの迷宮生誕50周年』式典を
襲撃し、ドラゴンを招き入れた首謀者は
オーガスというエイトラン家の男だった。

オーガスは取り調べに対し
プロキオと名乗る星詠みの男と
その背景に宗家フォーラーの関与を示したが
取り調べ最中にも関わらずオーガスの身柄は
ファーランドの要請で本国に引き揚げられた。

オーガスの関与と供述内容は公式には記されず
ファーランド国内においても秘匿された模様で
オーガス自身も長い軟禁状態にあるという。
3:
再発した魔物災害事件にあたって
フォーラーと共にパルペブラへの
支援要請案を拒否していたエイトランだったが
事件の最中、エイトラン領において
記録にない魔物研究所の存在が暴かれた。

これは、星詠みを名乗るカルト組織への資金と
施設の提供を目的に行われた隠蔽だった。
目的はあくまでも魔物事件解決のためであり
本家もこの隠蔽を感知していなかったと
釈明しているが、他家からの厳しい追及が
現在も続いているようだ。

フォーラーとの関係悪化もあり
彼らの立ち位置は失墜したと言えるだろう。

1:
The Ninth House of the Nine Noble Houses of the Farlands. They are in charge of guarding the kingdom's borders.

Originally a family that shares its roots with the combat-focused House of Tris, they seem to be constantly outdone by their former brethren.
2:
治安維持を担う九騎士家として
魔物災害発生当初から単家で
対応を続けていたナインズだったが
災害の規模が増大していくにつれて
徐々に対応が後手に回り始めていた。

政治的なしがらみから、サーディアからの
協力を許容できないナインズだったが
行方不明であった筈のユーウェルが
帰還した事で、事態は好転し始め
ナインズは魔物災害終息の功労者として
国や民からの信頼を得る事となった。

1:
His full name is Cieldeau Tris. Lord of the House of Tris, the Third House of the Farlands. He is a formidable swordsman as well as a responsible leader.

After losing to his sister Celtie once, he learned another style of swordsmanship, but even his new techniques were not enough to defeat her in their rematch.

A knight of the House of Oxtan, the Eighth House of the Farlands. He led the group that stole the sacred relic Anti-Observer and Kaleidoscope research reports during the Kaleidoscope's Fiftieth Anniversary. His goal was to sabotage relations between Palpebra and the Farlands.
2:
His original intention was to only frighten civilians and keep casualties to a minimum, but his co-conspirator Procheon changed their plans to inflict as much destruction as possible.

Just when Orgus was about to be permanently silenced by Procheon, Arum stepped in and saved him.

1: ヒエンジユウキシダン

A recently formed order of knights that banded together to protect the Farlands from monster attacks.

However, without the financial support of the state nor its nobles, the Swallow Knights were forced to make ends meet in the Kaleidoscope. They nearly disbanded after losing their leader there.

A knight of Oinas, the First House of the Farlands. He introduced himself as Vyron to Alk and the others.

Thirty years ago, he was responsible for guarding the princess Etheria Nialas when she was assassinated. He has been hunted ever since by assassins, although his desire for vengeance would have put him in their crosshairs regardless.
トモニチカウレイメイ

In the Kingdom of Sand, the kingdom's tyranny over the borderlands continued unabated. Rashid, leader of the Golden Dawn, sought to free the borderlands alongside the human weapon Sotieth.

Their futures would be forever changed after meeting Alk and friends.
2:
A Titan—a god created to free humanity from the control of the stars—was awakened, but unfortunately, its role that day was not to aid humanity. Luckily, Alk and the others were able to put a stop to the destruction, although not without some sacrifices.

As two friends watched the sun rise over the horizon, they made an oath to bring about the new dawn. Perhaps one day, the dawn that they sought will come to pass.

1:
A rebel organization seeking freedom for the borderlands, led by Rashid. Originally, Rashid and Haridal created the Golden Dawn together, but Haridal left. With the organization growing far too big to control alone, Rashid was unable to stop some vengeance-seeking members from activating a Titan.

After the Titan incident, the Golden Dawn dissolved.

The leader of the Golden Dawn, a group of rebels that worked to free the borderlands from the kingdom. A skilled warrior and an idealist who always followed his heart, he was never one to ignore someone in need. However, he couldn't bring himself to resort to bloodshed to free the borderlands.
ホシクダキノキョシン

A being spoken of in the legends of the Kingdom of Sand.

It is said that all the weapons that lie sleeping in ruins, like golems, were once servants of the Titan. This is why the kingdom's royal family claims they have the divine right to rule, as they can control the golems themselves.

Some members of the Golden Dawn schemed to activate the Titan they found in an ancient ruin in order to exact vengeance on the royal family.
2:
The Titan is a man-made creation, meant to overthrow the Goddess of the Stars and serve as a new divinity in her stead.

However, in order to activate it, a living organism possessing psychic abilities must serve as its core. Once again, people are used as stepping stones to power.
3: The Titan that the Golden Dawn discovered was half destroyed, peppered with the remnants of meteorites. It's likely that this god did not win its battle against the stars.

1:
Mysterious objects that are seemingly modeled after eyes.

Nephtim and Sotieth rested in ruins alongside these relics. In their hands, the Alter Devices can float, transform, and attack.

They do not appear to be powered by chanting spells or any other form of magic.

A type of ancient weapon residing in ruins. Though their true names are unknown, they are referred to as guardians since they protect ruins from intruders.

Very rarely some golems will leave their ruins and wander outside, attacking random passersby.

The bloodline of the royal family is able to control golems, which allows them to rule uncontested.

Triangular earrings that Rashid wore on both his ears. One was bestowed upon Sotieth alongside words of hope, while the other went to Haridal alongside a request as Rashid slowly faded from his grievous wounds.

After the troubleshooter Bulleta shot a hole through the sky, she started being louted as a hero.

Knowing of his connection to the legendary Bulleta, King Johnson asked Alk for help training the newest hero on the scene, Nate. Together, they worked to find out what it means to be a hero.
2:
After Regis recklessly introduced android technology to Qualia City, the machines began to riot out of control.

Despite all the trials and tribulations she went through, Nate declared she would be a hero and overcame the raging machines.

King Johnson's financial loss from the incident were nothing to sneeze at, but he will surely recover with time.

1: ピービーシーヒーローガジェットナンバーヒャクロクジュウキュウ
A self-driving robocyle given to Alk so he could keep up with the bionic Nate. It seems to be modeled after the bike in Metal Maniac Paradigm.
ソウコウキシンパラダイム
An old superhero comic. One of the classics, according to Nate.

A legendary troubleshooter for Noxel Group, said to have been the strongest out there. He had a strong sense of justice and worked for close to fifty years, but was killed by a punk that took advantage of his kind heart. His apprentice carries on his name and will. One of Nate's favorite heroes.

A young troubleshooter following in the footsteps of her master, the first Themis. Contracted with the Lunus Civil Police Force and popular among the people as a hero. Despite working to stomp out evil, she secretly held a great deal of resentment in her heart. She wasn't a fan of Nate at first, but has since become one of her greatest supporters.
Flying automated machines dispatched by the Unification AI to apprehend criminals. Imported to Qualia City from the Android Planet.
Disks that hold video footage are a popular form of collector's items in Qualia City.

Independent publications created and printed by a group of people sharing the same interests. In Qualia City, superhero fan comics are common.

It seems fan-made publications have also started to appear in worlds with strong entertainment cultures, like Palpebra, the Endless Blue, and Yamato.
ジョウネツノラブドリフターズ
In order to cheer her friends up, Inaho invited Alk and the others on a summer vacation to Paradise Isle. Upon arrival, Shywe was determined to finally make Alk her hazubando.
2: The island Alk and Shywe found themselves stranded on turned out to be the lab of a mad alchemist, determined to sacrifice everything to the Devourer of Stars in exchange for his loved one's return. Shywe was presented with a choice: power, or the budding feelings in her heart. She chose her heart, and the sprites responded to her passion. Together, she and Alk destroyed the alchemist, only to find themselves before a beautiful ocean view.

1:
Many cultures across multiple worlds believe in these strange beings, although their interpretations vary.

This is especially true in Palpebra, where talk of the sprites can easily spark a never-ending debate among scholars.
2: The mages of Palpebra believe the sprites to be no different from the elements. As such, they see the sprites as energy divided into the six elements that can be manipulated to produce various effects.
3: Sprite users, on the other hand, believe sprites to be supernatural beings with a will of their own. These sprite users converse with the sprites to produce their magic. On a fundamental level, though, their magic works the same way the mages' does.
4: According to the self-proclaimed magic theorist Nellie, both interpretations are simultaneously possible, with their discrepancies merely a result of a differing approach to answering the same questions regarding the wide scope of reality manipulation. However, Voluntas Academy does not place much value on this hypothesis and eagerly awaits the day more intellectual progress is made.

1: For cultures that believe in sprites, messages received from these beings are referred to as prophecies. Only select individuals are able to hear the sprites, and the sprites' words are highly regarded in their society.

An alchemist who was researching the Devourer of Stars on the drifting island in order to revive his dead son.

Despite his research into topics considered taboo, he was unable to reclaim the joy he once felt with his family, so he fell into madness. Even after surpassing humanity, his newfound power was only able to create mere husks, incapable of thought or speech.

The son of Deophrastus who passed away. When Deophrastus attempted to revive him with the power he gained from the Devourer of Stars, all that appeared before him was an empty shell in the appearance of his child.

Shywe's people have their own dialect, which she will occasionally mix in to her speech.

Hazubando refers to "husband."
Wyfu refers to "wife."
Fuudo refers to "food."
Beddo refers to "bed."
Meido refers to "maid."
2:
Fooru refers to "fool."
Trashu refers to "trash."

1: A mysterious island that floats along like a boat. The island houses a Gaean government lab that is researching a living sample of the Devourer of Stars.
A research project by the Gaean government aiming to use samples of the Devourer of Stars to tap into its power with the goal of reaching the next stage of evolution.
ヒャクジュウノオウカン

Peace finally settled in Fang Canyon, thanks to the efforts of Claudius and Albert. However, it was no secret that such peace was built on an unstable foundation, ready to crumble at a moment's notice.

One stormy night, the young lionfolk boy Teo ran from malicious pursuers. Just when things took a turn for the worst, the dogfolk warrior Helga came to his rescue.
2:
The Crown of the Beast King did not grant Magnos' wish. In the aftermath, Teo wondered if his feelings ever reached the lionfolk man.

Instead of dwelling on what had passed, Teo took Helga's hand and joined Claw and the others to change the world for the better.

1: Magnos Mane—one of the last surviving members of the lionfolk. In an effort to change the world that had persecuted his people, he stole the Royal Key from Teo and attempted to activate the Crown of the Beast King.

Though its primary purpose is to activate the Crown of the Beast King, the key itself holds the mysterious power of strengthening nearby warriors.

Once upon a time, the Whitetails hid away the Royal Key and the Crown of the Beast King, but the lionfolk people stole the key and were banished for it. Teo received the key from his mother while she was still alive.

A long time ago, the lionfolk attempted to steal the Crown of the Beast King from the Whitetails and were banished for their crime. Now, Teo and Magnos are the only known survivors of their people.

The lionfolk are unique in that they can unleash a hidden power from within, sending themselves into a violent frenzy.
ヒャクジュウノオウカンアイテム

A sacred relic from the Goddess of the Stars, meant to pass on power and knowledge. When the goddess ceased her oracles, a war over this relic broke out between the Whitetails and the lionfolk.

While it has the ability to adjust the qualities of a race, it does not contain the ability to change the world.

The long war between the dogfolk and catfolk greatly disrupted the lives of the people, leaving many in destitute states. Some turned to robbery, while others struggled greatly to turn their lives around.

Albert and Claw are currently searching for a way to aid the war refugees.
ドラゴンハザードチョウサタイ
A team put together by the Guild to track and predict the movements of the dragon-like beasts attacking the world. The serpents of the Kaleidoscope are their biggest target.

A tentacled monster said to live in the depths of the Endless Blue's northern seas. Some call it a god, others their lord, and still others Leviathan. Many say it appeared when the world's oceans first devoured the land, and the merfolk believe that, should it awaken, all the world's life will be devoured as well.
2: There have been witness reports of a tentacled monster attacking floats and the Gaean Navy, but some claim these monsters are merely followers of the true Devourer.
3:
Many alchemists have investigated this mysterious existence, but to no avail.

An equally enigmatic group, the Star Augurs, seeks to control the power of the Devourer of Stars for its own purposes.
4:
The alchemist Deophrastus spent a very long time doing research on the Devourer of Stars. He came to the conclusion that the terrifying entity is not bound by the laws of this world, and that it is a fundamentally supernatural being that transcends reason itself. 

Using a special terminal to interface with the Devourer, he is able to obtain a portion of its otherworldly power. Unfortunately for him, things go awry, as—likely due to his incomplete understanding of the supernatural powers he was dealing with—his deepest wish is not realized directly, but instead in a twisted, warped form.

1: A land to the far west of Palpebra, recognized as the most influential region in this world. This kingdom is governed by the royal family and the Nine Noble Houses, each of whom hold great power in their own right. A group called the Land Walkers make up most of the population.
2:
ファーランドの国力を支えたものは
肥沃な大地と大河に恵まれた国土である。
豊富な食糧は人口の増大と、それに伴う
技術躍進を引き起こした。

しかし、遠い地パルペブラにおいて
エレメントを活用した肥料が開発され
農業改革が実現された事で
その絶対優位性は覆る事となった。
3:
潜在的な優位性を失ったファーランドは
パルペブラを仮想敵国と見做すようになった。
そして30年前のイーセリア暗殺事件を機に
その関係は最悪の状態にまで至ったのである。

この改善に努めたのがヘクシズ家を中心とした
融和派であり、彼らの30年間の努力は
『揺らぎの迷宮生誕50周年』式典での
友好条約の締結という形で実ったが
式典中に起きた妨害事件の数々は
ファーランドの中には未だ対立過激派が
潜んでいる事を物語っている。

1: Prayers of the Church of Farlana
ホシノミチビキガアリマスヨウニ

"May the Stars ever guide you down the righteous path."

A prayer from the Church of Farlana that wishes for the recipient's joy and well-being. It is based on the founding legend of the Farlands, where the king led his people to their new home by following the Stars.

The name given to the dragon-like beasts that regularly attack Palpebra. Their form and powers differ for each serpent, but all are a force to be reckoned with. It appears they have a connection to the ancient dragons.

The serpents all try to head to the depths of the Kaleidoscope, but the reason is unknown.
2:
The serpent sample at the school should have been completely dormant, and yet it activated. After studying its remains and conducting more research, the cause was revealed to be the awakened people of Shibuya resonating strongly with the sample.

One magic researcher hypothesizes that the sample served as a medium to the realm of some higher being and connected people and dragon in that moment. However, there is not enough proof to substantiate this as fact.
3:
迷宮の魔術師、グラム曰く
廃竜とは、龍の力を得るための触媒として
『多くの手を持つ者』によって歪められた
ドラゴンの成れの果てなのだという。

廃竜が迷宮を目指すのは
龍への接触を試みるためと推測されており
それは上位者が恐れた事態の
最たるものだと言えるだろう。

1: A popular publication found in Palpebra. Covers everything from lifestyle tips for adventurers to sweet shop recommendations and the latest gossip. They will also occasionally feature articles on much more risky topics, like corruption in the Guild.

The dominant religion of Palpebra's world. Their most well-known prayer is "May the Stars ever guide you down the righteous path."

The size of the church has unfortunately lead to corruption among its ranks, especially with regard to monetary donations.
メイキュウノマジュツシ

A grim mage who haunts the midways and depths of the Kaleidoscope. Some say he guards the mysteries of the Kaleidoscope, while others claim he controls it. Master of the dark arts, he can sometimes be seen trying to convert adventurers to his cause. He has, however, shown signs of strain when facing more experienced adventurers.
2:
その名は、グラム・ウォルンタス。

かつてファーランドにて
師弟の関係であったニルヤーナと共に
魔導の根源を追い求めていた
魔導研究者であり
魔法局とも繋がりの深い人物だった。

当時、ニルヤーナとは夫婦関係にあったが
禁術研究の傾倒により道を誤り
ニルヤーナを含めた周囲の関係全てと
袂を別ち、姿を消した
――とされている。
3:
一方、ニルヤーナから言わせればこれは
片腹痛くてヘソで茶が沸いちまいますねェ！
な説明であるらしく
事実、禁術はニルヤーナの方がえげつない
研究をしていたという証言もある事から
姿を消した理由としては弱いようである。
4:
その後ファーランドを去ったグラムは
『龍』を追い求め、大地に大穴を穿つ
迷宮魔法の術式を完成させた。

これは単純な構造生成を繰り返す事で
超巨大構造物を生成する大魔法であったが
始原の龍と、その眼に触れた事から
術式は暴走。
異世界へと繋がる『揺らぎの迷宮』が
誕生してしまう事となった。

己の力をもって事態の収拾を付けようとした
グラムだったが、50年の結果を見れば
それは失敗に終わったと言えるだろう。

1:
Manifestations of the unknown and mysteries incarnate that range from natural forces to intelligent beings.

Originally existed only in the Yamato of the West, but when the East and West combined, yokai began to appear in both locations.

Refers to those who practice alchemy, which seeks to understand and alter the characteristics and composition of the various matter forming the world. In the Endless Blue, alchemists work by formulating theories and deciphering the laws of the universe, blurring the line between alchemy and science.
2: The exact same conditions will yield the exact same results. This immutable law is the basis for every alchemist's theory in the Endless Blue, but as of late, even this law seems to be changing. Most researchers find this development frustrating, but others find it fascinating.

1: A civil peace-keeping force run by the Guild in Palpebra. While they are not considered a military force, their powerful members, spies, and artillery provided by Voluntas Academy draws the attention of groups in and outside of Palpebra.
2:
新戦力として
ベスタ族や渋谷の能力者達まで
編入するようになった、ギルドナイツ。

一連の拡張路線を歓迎する者も
逆に危険視する者もいるが
多様な『外野の声』に耳を傾けつつ
関係者の慎重な対応と努力によって
均衡が保たれている状態だ。

1: A facility run by the church that cares for the children who have lost their guardians. The large number of adventurers that never return from the Kaleidoscope has resulted in an increase in orphans, leaving the orphanage with a heavy burden and low funds, despite the large number of donations they receive. The Guild is currently discussing ways to provide them with more resources.
ウォルンタスマホウガクイン

A magic school founded by the mages that arrived in Palpebra due to its development and the presence of the Kaleidoscope. What began as a simple research institution for adults has since grown into a school where even the young can foster their magical talents.
2: While the school does charge tuition, talented individuals can receive financial aid, and the Guild provides any necessary operating funds when needed. In exchange, Voluntas Academy shares its research and mages with the Guild.
3:
Although Voluntas opens its doors to a wide and diverse array of people possessed of all sorts of talents, there are still cases where certain people are refused entry—despite meeting the qualifications.

One often-cited reason for this is the fundamentally conservative worldview of the staff that comprises the academy. Notably, many among them refuse to acknowledge or endorse any magic which deviates from the traditional techniques and understanding of the field—namely that the primordial origins of the world can be divided and classified into 6 primary elements, which then require incantation to be manifested into magic. However, it is simultaneously also rumored that the headmistress of the school herself entirely rejects incantation-based magic. The truth as to these allegations remains unclear.
4:
Furthermore, individuals thought to have powers have begun to be employed as instructors within the academy. The winds of change are blowing strong, and it seems that the overall attitude of the academy has shifted decisively since the appearance of Shibuya next door.

The Magia Fest is a great symbol of this change. It's likely that the academy's headmistress, Nihilyana Voluntas, had a significant role to play as well.

1: A small kingdom situated between Palpebra and the Farlands. Since Palpebra's founding, its population has gradually decreased due to emigration.
2:
On Holidays, the royal family holds special events, such as barbeques, camping, swimming competitions, and mountain climbing. Citizens who are unable to attend these festivities are personally sent a gift by the royal family.

"Mirea is an amazing country! Everyone's friends, and there's only kind people everywhere! Wh-why don't I live there, you ask? Well, I mean, it's really wonderful, but... frankly, I'm fine with going back once a year."
- Excerpt from a Special Entry on Mirea in the Oculus

1: An event regularly held in Palpebra featuring particularly passionate creators.

Name used to describe Alk's change in demeanor when managing talented performers.

When producing, the lighthearted Alk turns into the ultimate professional, skilled in organization and negotiation. It's like he's a completely different person.

Stands for Battle Royale: All Star Smash. A competition between twelve states where diplomacy is conducted through song and dance battles—idol warfare to prevent idle warfare. It also acts as an opportunity for states to show off their prowess.
2: BRASS came to a close with Chateaubrilliand Duo's victory, after which Beaucy sealed all the Cosmic Beasts. However, Noenne and the others were able to remind Beaucy of her love for idols, and she released the beasts. Thus began BRASS: the Sequel, Otherwise known as BRASSS.

1:
A machine capable of scanning two androids' information in order to make a new android. While this machine can combine information from two individuals regardless of species or sex, it was originally intended to revitalize the human population. As such, limitations were placed on it to only work with specific combinations.

Recently, Regis was able to retrieve this device's blueprint and redistributed it throughout the land.
ビショクノボウケンシャ

Three young girls and a knight suddenly appeared in the Kaleidoscope—pursued by a dangerous Arch Guardian. This group, all members of the "Gourmet Guild," joined forces with Alk and co. to take down this new menace.
2: The combined power of the two parties was enough to defeat the Arch Guardian. Realizing that this wasn't a dream, the members of the Gourmet Guild resolved to continue their adventure by setting up a new chapter of their guild in Palpebra, all with the final goal of finding a way back home to Landosol.

1: While in the Kaleidoscope to investigate abnormal shifts, Alk and friends ran into two women fighting something they called a primal beast.
2: With the help of Alk and friends, Zeta and Beatrix were able to force the primal beasts back home during a shift. Intending to finish the job, they also returned home, promising to one day come back and see Alk and co. again.

1: A group of teenagers with powers, led by Tohru Sengaku. Their rather simple creed of "the strong should crush the weak" puts them in direct conflict with the Starsayers.
2:
After Shibuya and Palpebra merged, the Guild Knights and Shibuya's mayor worked to take the former members of Aegis into their care. However, some took to banditry and raiding the surrounding area.

Since Tohru Sengaku disappeared from the public eye, much infighting has occurred among the former members. Their relationship with the Palpebrans is shaky at best.
3: When Shibuya first became enclosed, it was the already existing unsavory sorts that immediately took to ravaging its streets. Aegis was the group to purge them, but there were rumors that Kazuya Sengaku, Aegis's founder, was not exactly free of sin either. Investigations into those rumors ceased once Kazuya passed away.
4: Rumors say that Tohru watched his brother die right in front of his eyes. The rage he felt within awakened his thunderous powers, birthing a new leader and inspiring the loyalty of his new followers.

1: Three months prior, when Shibuya was hit by a massive earthquake, many people claimed to see the Dragon's Iris in their dreams. Following this, these people began to develop seemingly supernatural powers.
2: Many people who gazed upon the Dragon's Iris hovering above Shibuya awakened to their powers as the city began to melt away. Only those with the strength to withstand the loss of their reality were able to resist disappearing along with it.
3:
According to Nova, these sorts of powers existed even before the Overlords controlled the worlds.

These powers defy traditional logic and restrictions. They are able to produce results, even without the prerequisite materials or incantations, and change reality. Magical theorists believe that mages, sprite users, combat artists—anyone who has the ability to change their world—are exercising a similar power.
4:
The following is an excerpt from the writings of a magic theorist:

Mages draw their power from established systems. Sprite users from their faith. We act according to the accepted laws of the world. On the other hand, the people who are awakened to their powers seem to be able to ignore established laws, as if changing reality or perhaps even drawing from an entirely different one.

However, if the awakened are subjected to drastic changes in their perceived reality, their basis for existence becomes threatened. Without a basis for existence, these people begin to fade from reality.

Due to the dangers of this phenomena, I highly recommend more research is devoted to the study of this subject.
5:
The following is an excerpt from the ravings of a magic theorist:

Why don't you understand?! We were connected to some higher plane of existence in that moment! The power to change reality was within our grasp! How else would you explain how that enormous golem was able to move?!

We must have been connected to the world from which all worlds originated from! It was why our cries for a hero in that moment were answered—we willed one into existence!

Ah! If only we could recreate the phenomena! Gah... I think my blood sugar is low...

1:
An organization following a new religion. In the aftermath of Shibuya's destruction, the Starsayers were the ones who provided housing and protection to all those stranded.

The fanatical followers never questioned their leader's methods. As such, they were not afraid to take extreme measures, such as putting all those with powers in a comatose state and hiding them in the water drainage area.
2:
A deceitful organization that provided superficial hope to the troubled masses, singing of miracles and otherworldly guidance. The previous iteration of the organization was similar, but somewhere along the way, they acquired the power to provide true miracles.

They took Mikoto Hoshino—a miracle child that had the ability see into the future and people's hearts—into their care. Using his powers, they provided miracles and convinced scientists and politicians to become fanatical believers.
3:
News and social media outlets had a field day when it was revealed that the Starsayers had funded the creation of the parallel universe observation device.

A salvaged gossip article claimed that the Starsayers' miracle child had somehow driven a wedge between the device's scientist and the Starsayers' founder.
4:
Mikoto Hoshino, the Starsayers' founder, and the observation device's scientist vanished when Shibuya become enclosed.

Completely lost without the driving forces of their organization, the Starsayers' immediately clung to Sakuya once they discovered she had the same power as Mikoto. They began to worship her as their savior.

1:
An eye of a dragon that people saw in their dreams before awakening to their powers.

The eye that the Antipode Lance called down from the sky gazed upon the world with an iris eerily similar to Stella and the others'.
2:
Three months have passed since Shibuya and Palpebra fused together. Even now, during the Magia Fest celebration, many more people are starting to see the Dragon's Iris in their dreams.

That is to say, of course, that more people are awakening to newfound powers—and at a rising rate.

1: ヘイコウセカイカンソクソウチ

A smaller version of a particle observation device placed in the center of the Starsayers' headquarters. An occult-loving scientist claimed it was a parallel universe observation device and was ridiculed for it.

A hole remains where it once stood, as if the very earth had been gouged out.
Driven by Dreams, Guided by Darkness
アユメヤミノユメビトタチヨ

Couette meets Rooma, her newest friend, in a dream. To restore him, Couette and the gang go on a journey through worlds to collect Curse Crystals. What they don't know is that Rooma dreams of falling stars and a sword that purges all creation...
2:
After learning his true identity, Rooma decides to be reborn as a dragon. In the process of rebirth, he catches a glimpse of the past.

Facing the pain of parting and believing in Rooma's promise to one day meet again, Couette walks her own path forward.

1:
A legendary holy man wrapped in red who brings happiness to all children once a year, riding a sled pulled by horned animals. Some people believe he is an ancestor of the Sheephirds.

Thanks to the spreading of his legend, adults in Palpebra began to dress in his likeness and give gifts to children during the holy night.
2:
According to records unknown to the general public, the man who served as inspiration for the Santa legend truly existed in the past. Kind and generous, he was the Guide who brought the first people to the bountiful land of the Farlands.

Whether or not these records can be believed, the legend of Santa is kept alive by all who share in his spirit of kindness and generosity.

1: A Champion who rose to fame during King Edea's youth, defeating the Lord of Shadow and repelling the fiends' invasion. However, tragedy struck during the process. Princess Luceltia, meant to be the Champion's guiding hand by oracle's decree, never made it home. In penance for this failure, Luce's name was struck from history thereafter.

A certain personality type that Alk accused Belsidia of being, much to her chagrin. According to Light, a Regis-like person tends to sow chaos and destruction, resulting in a general distaste for their character. Despite this, they grow lonely quite easily and crave attention from the people they trouble.

Reylas Oraclus' younger brother. Unlike Reylas, Altair was not born with the strongest magical eye in history. The resulting inferiority complex allowed the Dark Mage of the Kaleidoscope to manipulate him into attacking his brother—a fight which he lost and was condemned to an icy prison for.
2: Despite Reylas' best efforts, Altair remains frozen in ice. Only by reclaiming his magical eye from the Dark Mage will Reylas have a chance at freeing his brother.

1: A table that features a heater underneath and a futon wrapped around the sides, keeping the heat trapped inside. Useful for enjoying feasts and drinks in the winter, the kotatsu is immensely popular in Starview Village. Its comforts are so alluring that many find it difficult to escape once they have settled in—especially catfolk people.

Short for Cosmic Idol Police Department. Responsible for policing idol activities within the Twelve Heavenly Realms, the CIPD handles everything from Cosmic parking violations and idol traffic control to investigating bootleg idol goods.

All CIPD officers are universally referred to as investigators, regardless of rank.

Representatives from the Twelve Heavenly Realms who participate in the Battle Royale: All Star Smash (BRASS). Unlike regular idols, Cosmic ones are partnered with their country's Cosmic Beast to form an idol unit. Their bond allows them to draw out their Cosmic energy, unlocking a well of limitless potential.
2: Each Cosmic Idol's performances are unique to their chosen genre. For example, gravure style idols are proficient in close-quarters combat. Part of the BRASS's allure is seeing what kind of performance each Cosmic Idol decides to put on.

1: A ghost who is a member of Hard Rock Magic, Littleton's idol group. She was twenty four years old when she died. Though responsible for providing the group's backing vocals and keyboard part, her main shortcoming is that she can't press her keyboard's pedals.
2:
Originally from Kitton, a country that once formed part of the Thirteen Heavenly Realms—now the Twelve Heavenly Realms after Kitton was tricked by Littleton and reduced to a minor power.

As Kitton's last and final idol, Catherine bore her country's grudge against Noenne, Littleton's current Cosmic Idol. However, her friendship with Noenne saved her from succumbing to hatred.

1: One of the Twelve Heavenly Cosmic Beasts and a member of Hard Rock Magic, Littleton's idol group. He's in charge of the drums, but uses his front teeth instead of sticks to drop the beat.
2: The scars on his body prove he's a capybara who's made it through countless battle royales. If asked about the scar on his eye, he'll proudly explain he earned it while headbanging during a concert and bashing his head against some equipment. On his days off, he enjoys going to hot springs.

1: An index used to indicate an idol's strength. Generally, the higher the score, the more idol potential someone possesses, but this is not always the case. The idol industry is complicated, so many factors determine who ends up reigning at the top. Incidentally, those who have a high idol power level tend to lose control over themselves.
Due to unforeseen circumstances, Mia was forced to roleplay as a mother for someone older than her.
タビゲイニンノイチザ
There's a certain traveling troupe in the Kingdom of Sand that offers dance shows and duels, among other things, as entertainment. Sonia, Elise, Jalil, and Nimbus were once a part of it.
2: As the troupe performs throughout the borderlands, its members secretly act as messengers for the rebels working against the kingdom. In recent years, they have come under suspicion by the kingdom, severely hindering their movements.

1: In the Kingdom of Sand, there exists pockets of resistance that work against the kingdom, especially in the borderlands where the kingdom's control is unstable. However, their methods mostly amount to guerrilla warfare, leaving them mostly incapable of fending off kingdom soldiers in direct conflict.

In the Kingdom of Sand, a world devoid of mages, magical objects grant their wielders unfathomable power compared to their fellow man. They are primarily relics of an ancient civilization, unearthed in ruins by hunters and slaves.
2: As the seat of centralized power, the kingdom wishes to gain control over every magical object in the world. Regardless, hunters in the borderlands continue their illegal excavations, leading to many magical objects being sold on the black market.

1: These sand-covered ruins in the Kingdom of Sand often house magical objects of an ancient civilization. As a result, the kingdom tries to claim ownership of these ruins, but past calamities and a decline in their authority has led to many of these ruins slipping from their control. Most of them remain covered in sand, undiscovered and undisturbed.
2: Built at different times, ruins on the surface were undisturbed for hundreds of years, while those buried below remained untouched for closer to a thousand. The kingdom once sought to use these ruins as temples, but their decline in power has led to these temples becoming lost with time.
3: Oftentimes, these ruins contain magic guardians that eliminate intruders. This is the reason why many hunters lose their lives on excavations.

1: Hunters in the Kingdom of Sand hunt both monsters and relics. Many of the magical objects floating around black markets were illegally excavated by hunters.
2: The kingdom spends great effort keeping people outside of ruins, as they might contain powerful weapons that could be used against them. As a result, most hunters explore ruins in the borderlands to avoid running into kingdom soldiers.

1: キンセツマホウカクトウジュツ

A new form of martial art combining melee and magic, devised by Taiga. In the Endless Blue where magic isn't commonly understood, its creation is revolutionary. However, as a man of instinct and not logic, Taiga has a difficult time teaching the art to others.
2: Magic supersedes reality, whereas martial arts exist in the realm of physical cause and effect. However, when someone can use their fists to break steel, can that still be considered within the bounds of reality? Though his body is made of flesh and bone, Taiga wonders if his thunderous fists transcend humanity.
3: Through endless training and experience, one man achieves the impossible with one punch. A certain diviner believes Nimbus was only able to keep his body and mental state intact because his world had been shattered once before. Regardless, everyone in Starview is careful to keep him from killing himself in his efforts.

1: A woman that once traveled with Sonia and Elise as part of a traveling troupe in the Kingdom of Sand. She knew Nimbus as someone named Thanab, and considered him a source of comfort before she was swallowed up by a shift one day and vanished. Now she has a new group of people to call family in the Endless Blue, but never has she forgotten her feelings for Nimbus—a man who always looked out for her, even though he pretended not to care.
Under the pretense of obeying the kingdom and local lords, raiders regularly murder and enslave the people of the borderlands.

A member of the Stratos royal family, she was King Edea's older sister, known for her genius and love of stargazing and books. Due to the oracle they received, she departed on a journey with the Champion Luce, tragically losing her life during it.
2:
However, the truth was struck from history. Devoted to a Champion's duty, Luce sought to murder every last fiend, but Luceltia opposed this extreme measure. This resulted in one final confrontation, in which Luceltia was pierced by the Champion's sword and sent into the Abyss. When Luce returned home, the world only knew that Luceltia had perished fighting fiends.

Not long after, the mysterious Belsidia, Wicked Witch of the Rift, made her first appearance in history.

1: The area outside the main heart of the kingdom is known as the borderlands. Many anti-kingdom rebels reside here, and hunters freely excavate old ruins, as the kingdom has yet to bring the borderlands under its full control. Between the harsh environment and brutality of kingdom soldiers, life out in the borderlands is difficult, to say the least.
2: The kingdom treats the borderlands people harshly, wishing to stamp out the dissidents, but this treatment only breeds more anti-kingdom rebels. The rebels, on the other hand, are unable to gain the upper hand no matter how many join their ranks, as the kingdom's automated soldiers boast significant military prowess. They must also deal with the many bandits and raiders that infest the area—victims of poverty and violence that in turn create more victims.

1: One of the Twelve Heavenly Cosmic Beasts and a member of Chateaubrilliand Duo, Oxton's idol group. Often serves as Beaucy's advisor.
2: Used to compete and win countless contests as a gravure cow. Though now retired, Cacow keeps a healthy diet to maintain peak physical form.

1: One of the Twelve Heavenly Cosmic Beasts and a member of Retryger, Tigerton's idol group. He understands Torietta better than anyone else and firmly believes in her potential as an idol.
2: Though he dresses in CIPD-like clothes, Gaiger is not actually a member of the CIPD. In order to better support Torietta, he's been looking for the opportunity to jump from cosplayer to CIPD's official mascot.

1: Inside Palpebra's grand cathedral, secret scriptures are hidden away, never to be brought to light. They contain descriptions of a man who guided the first people to the Farlands—which is a figure that doesn't exist in the widely accepted beliefs of the Church of Farlana.

The legendary figure who led the first people to the Farlands, taking them from a barren wasteland to a fertile paradise under the guidance of the stars. He was also the Farlands' founding king. His long journey led to those of taller stature to be known as Land Walkers among the Sheephirds.
2: According to the Sheephirds who call the lands around Palpebra home, this legendary figure was originally a Sheephird, and the land of Palpebra was actually the site of humanity's origin. As this calls into question the Farlands' version of their founding, this information is kept exclusively within Sheephird circles.
3:
The secret document that Dul Kugala revealed was actually the Guide's very own personal journal. In it, he describes how during the day that the world ended, he was guided by a voice and fell in love with a goddess who resided in a town up in the heavens.

It can be inferred that the Guide was the Archon of his world before it was purged. Yet this calls into question... Why did the goddess save him and his people, then?

"Go somewhere far, away from my gaze and my commands."

1: オクビョウピュアエール

Mary and Wilfred are childhood friends in love with each other. Even amid the lovey-dovey atmosphere of Valentine's Fest, the two are unable to confess their feelings.

But with the power of love, friendship, and courage, the two might finally take a step forward.
2: Mary and Wilfred's cowardly feelings are exposed by the black sheep golems running amok. Driven by a fervent desire to remain together despite their circumstances, they finally confess their feelings to each other. Though their cowardly inclinations remain, the two finally become lovers against all odds.

1: Cipher's younger twin sister. Afflicted by an incurable illness, she was frozen in ice by Cipher's magic to prevent the illness from progressing. Despite her rather dire circumstances, Rei remains cheerful, communicating telepathically with others from inside her icy confines and getting into trivial sibling spats with Cipher.
2: After attempting to secretly support Cipher at her job as temporary professor at Voluntas Academy and being discovered, Rei herself is also given a position as temporary professor. Through meeting countless friends, she now has a new dream—to become a proper, full-fledged professor one day.

1:
Tips and tricks to attract the attention of thirsty passersby. Published in the Oculus, a popular Palpebran magazine, these life hacks are presented as age-old snippets of wisdom, despite being fishy in nature and written haphazardly.

Ever desperate for popularity, Inaho has recently started contributing to the life hacks column, furthering the dubious nature of the advice.

Reformists that emerged after the death of the Administrator, wishing to change society.

Though the unite under one name, there is very little unity among the different factions within the Updaters. Some wish for peaceful change, while others take violent measures against the conservative Defaulters.
2:
The Updaters wish to expand the bounds of their human-like existence—which goes against the wishes of the late Administrator. Many of them modify their bodies to have extra limbs, or upgrade their sight and senses beyond human limits. 

It should go without saying that Rec Register has connections with these people.

1: Conservatives that arose to prominence after the death of the Administrator, inheriting her ideals and wishing to preserve society as is. Having the advantage of sheer numbers, they tend to throw member after member at their Updater foes whenever conflict arises.
2:
Carrying on the Administrator's will, the Defaulters seek to keep their functions within the bounds of human limits and vehemently oppose the Updaters, who wish for the opposite.

However, even the Defaulters are not unanimous in their opinions. Some factions within feel that gradual change is necessary for their society.

1: Golems in the shape of white sheep. They're about the perfect size to sit on top of a person's head. Endlessly spawning from a magical artifact discovered in the Kaleidoscope, these sheep run around reading people's emotions and saying them out loud.
2: Sheep golems turn black after absorbing negative emotions. In this form, the black sheep purposely absorb the emotions that people wish to keep hidden and speak them aloud. When many black sleep gather together, they are able to combine into one big black sheep golem.
3: Wilfred made some adjustments to the sheep golem after the trouble they caused. Now, they serve as the official mascot for Valentine's Fest, running around town and cheering on people's romantic endeavors.

1: オサナナジミコウリャクサクセンカイギ

The name of the operation that Nate, Reticia, and Stella came up with to help Mary get together with Wilfred. Though her friends relentlessly teased her for being a pain in the butt, Mary was eventually able to gain the courage to move past the cowardice hindering her confession.

Though this operation ended successfully, this group of friends might need to start another for someone else... and soon.

A research student at Voluntas Arcane Arts Academy. His full name is Wilfred Mishti.

As a huge nerd into research and development, he gets good grades and is well-liked by teachers. However, his fellow students find him to be an oddball and keep their distance, leaving him with almost no friends.

He spends most of his time developing strange devices, often holing up in his research lab for days on end.
2:
A Mary PR bot once said:

"If I had to be more specific, I love her eyes, her soft hair, her curly horns, her kind smile... She's the embodiment of cuteness. The sweets she makes are the best in the world, and when she's filled with joy and smiles, it's almost blinding. Even when she's sad, she makes sure to be kind to others. I admire her so much, that I... H-hey, Alk? Are you still listening to me? Alk!"

1: A Palpebran festival established relatively recently. A month after Valentine's Fest, those who received Valentine's sweets give something in return to their gift giver.
2: Just as Valentine's Fest has become a huge business opportunity, so too has White Fest. The restaurants of Palpebra offer limited-time menus and hire good-looking staff during this period to boost their sales through the roof.

1:
Constructs that the Overlords unleashed in order to eliminate those who would defy their laws and travel between worlds.

They possess no cognitive abilities and are very weak when faced individually. One could say they are more akin to an immune system than anything else.
2: Oddly enough, Nova claims that the Antibodies that were supposed to observe Shibuya had begun to eat away at it. That function in and of itself should have been impossible for the Antibodies to possess.
3: In the depths of the Kaleidoscope, powerful, mysterious constructs accompany Antibodies. They are able to move through space and transport themselves to other worlds—a power that should only be available to ancient dragons and the World Flippers, at least according to Nova.

1:
An event traditionally held every spring in Floretta's hometown in the Endless Blue. People gift homemade sweets to their loved ones during it.

Though it resembles Valentine's Fest, it has its own versions in different places in the Endless Blue.

Mary's successful, public confession inspired many others in Palpebra to confess their feelings. This also caused a rumor to spread that Reticia and her friends' presences would guarantee that the object of your affection reciprocates your feelings. Thanks to that, Reticia and co. are now chased around day and night to be cupids for all sorts of people.
ピービーシーヒーローガジェットナンバーニヒャクジュウヨン
The Wayward Heart—a powerful new frame that Regis helped acquire for Nate. Its cute Valentine's design makes it perfect for being sold as a figurine and other various goods.
チョウテイシャフェルダー

A noble house in the Endless Blue comprised of bounty hunters that side with neither the government nor the free citizens of the sea. Instead, they serve as powerful arbiters whose sole duty is to maintain balance.

Originally wary of Alk and friends because of their association with the Crimson Blades, House Felder now allies itself with Starview Village, thanks to the relationship heir Reticia shares with the crew.
2: The incident that resulted in the disappearance of the great pirate Zegra impacted House Felder greatly. Both head Felders perished, and the eldest daughter Lucretia was crippled from her injuries. With no one else left to lead, the title of heir fell to Reticia, the youngest daughter.

1:
Valentine's Fest was originally an event that focused on enjoying good sweets, but exploded in popularity once it became a romance-focused affair. However, thanks to Ellya, an additional layer was added—giving thanks to platonic partners in the form of friendship chocolate.

The original basis for the idea came from similar gift-giving customs in Yamato.
2: Whether it be alienation from not receiving any chocolate, or feeling forced to participate and fit in, many people were grateful to gift chocolate as a show of appreciation instead of romantic interest. Unfortunately, Ellya failed to predict the merchants who leapt upon this opportunity to offer different grades of chocolate for people to show "the appropriate amount of appreciation for the more important people in their lives."
3: Given the revelation that he was once Ayumu Nagihara, one could say that Alk only offered the idea of friendship chocolate because he possessed lingering memories from his old self.

1:
Remnith's younger sister. She served as a guardian of dragons alongside her brother, by the shores of a lake far from Palpebra.

One day, the dragons they guarded lost their minds, forcing Remnith to kill them all. For reasons unknown, Enith was turned into a dragon afterward.

When Alk and the others stumbled upon this truth, Enith was enveloped in a cloud of fog and vanished into thin air.
2: According to Anbach, Enith became a dragon of her own accord. She was furious at the fate that destiny brought and sought a way to save the dragons driven to ruin.

1:
Acting leader of House Felder and Reticia's older sister. A genius in both politics and martial prowess, she was once expected to lead House Felder to new heights, but the grievous injuries she sustained during the battle before Zegra's disappearance forced her to retire from the frontlines.

Nowadays, she utilizes her intellect to support her younger sister.
モテナイボクタチヲナグサメアウカイ

A rather pathetic group of people who found themselves left out of the romantic side of Valentine's Fest. As a form of petty revenge, they planned to buy up all the chocolate in town and hoard it, but Ellya put a stop to them. The scolding she gave after seemed to reform their hearts, but in reality they only listened because of their newfound infatuation for her.

A pub in Palpebra that is attended to by maids. The parlor also dispatches maids to help any paying lord that wishes for their services, which range from cooking and cleaning to protection and adventuring aide.
2:
Once Shibuya merged with Palpebra, many maids from Shibuya began working in Palpebran maid bars. One reason for this seems to be the slow recovery of such businesses in Shibuya.

Naturally, the number of Shibuyan patrons of these establishments is also increasing to some degree.

1: ヒーロークオリアシティ

A way of referring to a certain subset of Troubleshooters who—acting entirely independently—endeavor to protect Qualia City and keep the peace.

To the citizens, they truly live up to their moniker: they are paragons of justice who act out of pure desire to aid those in need. Naturally, certain corporations saw the popularity of heroes as a profit-making opportunity, and—by funding heroes directly—are in a frenzied rush to commercialize the concept.

A new section King Johnson established within his own company after seeing how popular heroes were with the populace. The division's primary objective is to promote the growth of heroes in Qualia City. 

They supported an up-and-coming new hero named Nate and outfitted her body frame with a special PBC logo to ensure that anywhere she goes, she'd be promoting the company brand.
2:
When PBC was forced to take responsibility for the incident with the rampaging AI, they chose to dissolve all other departments except this one.

Afterward, PBC chose to continue business operating entirely as a Hero Development and Promotion company.

1:
King Johnson, enlisting the help of Regis, managed to smuggle AI and other automation technology into Qualia City from the world of the androids. Unsurprisingly, this technology spread rapidly.

The Lunar Civil Police Force acted fast upon catching wind of this and implemented the AI in its peacekeeping efforts—and also within the programming of a hero named Themis.

However, this artificial intelligence—over the course of its continued learning from newfound stimuli—transformed into something called the Unification AI, a system specializing in the full-blown monitoring and control of all activity (and institutions) in the city.
2:
Over the course of its rigorous observation, the Unification AI determined that humanity only served to introduce an undue element of chaos to all around it, rendering the maintenance of order untenable. The AI then began to malfunction and go haywire, leading to its eventual utter destruction.

One part of it remained, however: a core component called a Manabrain, which effectively contained the essence (some would say "soul") of the Unification AI.

1:
Marianne's coworker at the Maids' Parlor.

When Marianne had no else to turn to, it was Taffy who found her collapsed in the street, took her in, helped her become a maid, and gave her the name Marianne.
シュルトノイケニエタチ

Lucia, Aileen, and Mertina were born on the outskirts of Palpebra. When they were young, they were offered as sacrifices to Schult and, as such, stayed with him when they were not able to return home after.

Now they live in Starview Village, happily earning money in Palpebra to support Schult and their own livelihoods.
2:
Lucia is a calm, collected person. Aileen is confident and capable, while Mertina is quiet and considerate. Lucia is the most stubborn, but the three of them will stand their ground when the occasion calls for it.

This is how Schult would fondly describe them if asked.

1:
Generally, a person who receives money for free from another, without giving anything of value in return. For some people, this type of person is a pest, but for others, providing for another is a joy in and of itself.

A certain dragon once wished to leave his leech status behind and pay back the support he was given, but the three ladies funding him are more than happy to do it.

A cafe found in one of Palpebra's shopping streets. Previously a declining business, a fortuitous intervention by Suizen turned the place into a bustling hot spot. Now young women flock to the cafe in droves to see its waiters dressed up for White Fest.

For a limited time during the year, a certain butler cafe in Palpebra turns into a prince-themed bar in the evening. The waiters dress and act like princes, often showing a completely different personality from the subservient attitude they adopt while waiting during the day. This gap in personality is one of many reasons why patrons visit both the bar and the cafe—at least according to a certain expert.
2:
The butler cafe and prince bar that Suizen manages secretly competes with the maid bar that Soushiro was called to work at.

Customers, however, are free to visit whichever business they choose. The more fanatical ones expend both wallet and soul to visit both.

1: シロクマサンクッキー

Cookies in the shape of polar bears, from a certain Palpebran bakery. Immensely popular with people of all ages, these cute and delicious treats are given out as free samples.

A quiet, beastfolk man who appears from the shadows is known to be the one handing out these cookies, coldly offering them before disappearing to the next person.

A swordsman that departed from her home to search for the katana wielder that murdered her father. Upon learning that Zekhel had already disposed of the killer some time ago, she fell into a state of despair that Murakumo rescued her from. She now lives in Starview as Murakumo's disciple.

Though Murakumo treats her as a father would their child, it appears that she might not see their relationship the same way. Murakumo, being a blade and not a person in the first place, does not seem particularly bothered by this detail.
ギョクトミンカンケイサツ

A police organization in Qualia City which belongs to the Noxel group. They've held a contract with both the current and former generations of the hero Themis.

In an attempt to turn over control of law enforcement from the hands of people to the calculating grip of AI, Lunus attempted to enact a plan to eradicate all heroes. When the Unification AI they employed went haywire, however, their plan ended in spectacular failure, significantly lowering their company's stock value.

Biotechnology, cybernetics, and machine-enhanced augmentation. Those are the name of the game in this city of neon and chrome which finds itself at the center of a hyper-futuristic world. There you can find the likes of Bionics, humans who have enhanced their bodies with technology, and Synthetics, androids who merely take the appearance of humans.

The "sky"—a great dome that envelops the city—is branded with endless company logos. Tightly packed skyscrapers mingle with ostentatious holograms, forming the city's nigh-endless, garish skyline.
2:
In this world of consumerism and excess, it's no longer the state that oversees the economy and public order—it's corporations themselves. Noxel Group and AltMeme stand out as the two biggest conglomerates in the city.

In place of a functioning government, these firms oversee legislation, administration, and policing. Citizens are afforded the choice of a social system which best fits their needs.

But of course, to realize such a system, it's necessary for citizens to become consumers, and purchase the special "services" of these corporations themselves.
3:
Whether it be drinking water and air, or even neural sensations and the very memory of experiences—everything is for sale in Qualia City. The more capital in your pocket, the more comfortable a life you'll lead.

The obverse, however, is also true—it can be hard to make ends meet in Qualia if you're not a business mogul or venture capitalist. Some of those who aren't well off choose to augment their body with technology and walk the path of a troubleshooter—as it tends to have relatively good returns.
4:
The people need diversion, and the myriad forms of entertainment available in Qualia provide that in abundance—martial arts, races, e-sports, you name it.

Competition between the two primary enterprises has grown so fierce that fans often choose a side and take it upon themselves to feverishly fight for their favorite company—a veritable proxy war. 

Though it has been more common for specially-outfitted Bionics to enter into competitions, recently more and more individuals who are mistaken for androids seem to be making an appearance.

1: シューターザバレット

An action-packed, feature-length film retelling the fabled story of a certain troubleshooter who cracked Qualia City's dome. Production and advertising were handled by none other than PBC.

Due to some extenuating personal circumstances on the part of leading lady Bulleta Noche, the film was unexpectedly canceled mid-production—all despite its projected sky-high popularity ratings.

A security company (and subsidiary of Noxel) which has its headquarters in Qualia City.

The firm prides itself on—and gets its name from—its supremely fast response time, promising to arrive to the scene of a crime in 3 minutes or less. On the surface, the company is replete with funds, and offers its employees excellent benefits, but it also has a darker underbelly. Some among the company are known to pay hush money to key individuals and cover up otherwise scandalous incidents. It's therefore difficult to say that everything they do is on the up and up.
オルトエクストリームシャ

A famous subsidiary of AltMeme that manages several pro extremeboarders.

In reality, they mostly occupy themselves with match fixing and staged events. For them, sports is merely another side of show business. The extreme boarders under their management are merely puppets to be raised up and milked for a profit.
トクベツギジュツタイオウカ

A special department within 3MM Security, a company under the Noxel umbrella. Tink currently acts as the department's chief.

Located in the back of a warehouse, this special force is comprised of the chief and her three subordinates. The nature of their work is rather messy, but their results are top-class, and their performance is highly praised.

The department is currently on a long-term, extended vacation.
2:
The following are the members of the special force. Real names have been withheld to protect their identities.

Alias: "Clever Old Man"
A middle-aged male (the alias being mostly an in-joke). Cunning and crafty, he specializes in collecting information.

Alias: "Crafty Old Man"
An older male, renowned as a skilled engineer. Specializes in hacking.

Alias: "Sharp-Eyed Old Woman"
A middle-aged female. Extremely knowledgeable about all things Noxel. Has plentiful legal experience.

1:
A special chip implanted in Tink's body, which grants her enhanced combat capabilities. 

When its limiter function is disabled, it allows for overclocking of the base frame, leading to even more enhanced power output.

Unfortunately, it has proven difficult to use, and further research is at a standstill. Generally speaking, the use of this chip is forbidden, due to the associated risks.
クオリアシティジケンログゼロニーエックスエックス

Date: 02/XX/XXX

The following is an excerpt from a news article:

200 Presumed Dead after Fighting in Industrial District

At 1 am this morning, a large explosion rocked a Noxel-owned industrial area after armed forces engaged in combat. Plants from various corporations were affected, resulting in the spread of large fires.
2: According to police reports, the target of the attack was a [REDACTED]-owned plant producing synthetic parts. The company is affiliated with the Humanoid Realists and has been under scrutiny by the Agender Synthetics League for their attempts to secure a license to develop synthetic parts containing biological material.
3:
The Agender Synthetics League strongly believes that conforming to current gender ideologies is equivalent to turning a blind eye to gender-based discrimination.

The Humanoid Realists uphold their stance that a fair society is not created by abandoning the features that make people unique. The ones at fault for true discrimination are those who would attack others based on their individuality.

1: ファニークオリアプレスドットネット

A Noxel Group company that produces articles for Qualia City. No one is completely sure what FQ stands for, but most people have their own colorful ideas about the abbreviation. "Humor's the supplement that keeps this world running" is their motto, and their main focus is on getting as many views as possible. Because of their reputation for pushing out nothing but gossip, they tend to have a difficult time securing information.

As a matter of fact, pretty much all of their articles either incite drama or provide enough reason for others to start the drama themselves.
カイハツコードジーンソルジャー

Living weapons that the Star Augurs, a secret organization operating throughout various worlds, utilize for their own schemes. They have been spotted in the Endless Blue, as well as other worlds.

Other shady organizations utilize these beings as well, as the blueprints have been shared among their ilk.
2: Special chocolate mutant versions are regularly seen in Quality City during the Valentine's Day season.

1:
Though Lilith, Estariel, and Adjudicus officially established a peace treaty, the ill will between humans and fiends runs deep. To avoid potential altercations from sharing the same land, Adjudicus searches for a new world which the fiends can call home.

Due to the rapid fusing of worlds, Pandemonium and the Abyss have begun to engulf the Home of the Champions. Soon, it will not only be Adjudicus' people that need to search for a new home.
2: With the eroding of Pandemonium and expansion of the Abyss, more Purgers will inevitably come knocking. This fact, along with the inevitable incoming relocation, will surely incite panic among the people. Though Lilith agonizes over whether or not to share this information, she also realizes that candid cooperation is necessary for successful migration.
3:
In the ever rising waters of the Endless Blue exists the artificial island Paradise Isle. Originally a large rocky mountain, human tenacity and desire transformed it into the beauty it is today.

Recognizing the efforts that went into building the place, Lilith feels more than ever before that she will need to work alongside her people if they are to hope for a new future.
4:
リリスは民衆の新たな定住先を
『森の世界』と定め、その世界の守り人
レシタールとの確約を取りつけた。

さらにはドゥ・ククスとの交渉の末
銀の森の連合を対粛清者用の戦力として
提供する代わりに、新天地での開墾に
必要となる策源地をパルペブラと渋谷に
据える事も取り決めた。

こうした状況の進展もあり
勇者の世界に敷かれた情報統制は
近く解除される見込みであるという。

1:
Quazer's beloved fashion brand, which is extremely popular with the teenagers of the Endless Blue.
