The lineup of clothes strikes an ideal balance between cute and mature, which is perfect for the growing girls that make up the customer base.

A secret organization that works under the Adventurer's Guild, patrolling Palpebra's surrounding forests and quietly removing foreign elements from their soil. From the shadows, they take on unsavory jobs and use any measures necessary to finish them.

Rangers report directly to the heads of the Guild, which keeps their existence secret even from other Guild members.

A place for basic education, teaching children how to read and write. Originally run by Soushiro in Yamato, another one was opened in Starview Village.

This new study hall caters to Yamato children, fox kits, Palpebran orphans, child soldiers from the Kingdom of Sand, and children from many other backgrounds.
2:
Nothing could have prepared the man for the chaos caused by the joining of the East and the West. From the lessons he learned after, he sought to raise up a new generation—one that would be prepared for the cultures of other worlds and welcome their peoples.

Thus was the first study hall formed.

1:
A crew of medical personnel in the Endless Blue, led by the doctor Liao. The Fellowship of Floof provides treatment to anyone and everyone, regardless of who they are—even to the pirates who attack them.

Sincerely believing that everyone deserves to be treated equally, they work day and night in an effort to heal all sickness and injury in the seas.
2:
Liao's emotionless expression appears very intimidating to children, which is one reason why he and his crew put on the fluffy ears. Even though it comes at the expense of being ridiculed, all members of the Fellowship of Floof are required to have the ears.

The meowing, on the other hand, is something only Liao does. The rest of the crew is unwilling to commit to that degree.
3:
The crew charges exorbitant fees for any pirates they treat, but charges no fees whatsoever for victims of pirates. Since they also allow for people to work off their debt, the crew is constantly in the red and low on supplies.

Only through support programs funded by philanthropists, including one in Starview, does the crew manage to stay afloat.

1: ホシミノマチノキョジュウルール

Always write your name on the food you put into the fridge. It does not matter who you are or where you are from, you will obey the few rules that there are while you live in Starview Village.

This is for the benefit of all, considering the number of late night snackers hunting for scraps while everywhere else is closed.
コードインディヴィジュアル

Quinvere acts simultaneously as the company's CEO and its star model. She's even gone so far as to repurpose her airship as a massive, floating, hologram-displaying advertisement. 

Her company's vision is to be an advertising agency that refuses to be held back by society. For this reason, Quinvere flies solo—Code Individual belongs neither to Noxis nor to AltMeme.
2:
Incidentally, it's common knowledge that companies which belong to neither Noxis nor AltMeme rarely stick around for long.

Quinvere, however, chose this direction for the company regardless. In what ways will the great Qualia City change as a result of the friction and conflict her organization engenders? And more importantly, what greater "high scores" await? Quinvere can't wait to find out.

1:
A life-sized stuffed toy version of Nimbus, which Sohvi created using the molted fur of her favorite white tiger.

The technology for this invention came about after extensive research was done on various revival concoctions. Essentially, it allows for a spirit to be stored within the vessel, thereby granting the automaton basic speech and movement functions.

Unfortunately, when Sohvi incorrectly assumed that the real Nimbus had grown jealous of this plushy imitation of himself, the mad scientist chose to rip up and burn the doll in a spectacularly violent and terrifying display.
2:
Later on, unbeknownst to Nimbus, Sohvi made yet another life-sized imitation plushy of the white tiger. 

This second generation model—Darling 2.0—boasted great improvements over the original, including enhanced combat capabilities. 

However, due to the influence of the Devourer of Stars, the spirits within the doll were driven to madness, requiring Alk and co. to end the sad, short life of yet another pitiable Nimbus clone.
3:
Sohvi's second Nimbus doll is destroyed before she can realize it—but that's hardly enough to deter her from trying again. This time, she creates a new automaton, which she claims is actually her and Nimbus's child.

Unfortunately, the essence of the Devourer of Stars which was embedded into this "child" proved too weak to hold, and the doll faded out of existence before long. This doll served to help Nimbus make a very important realization in his life.

1:
A fighting troupe from Palpebra. They put on shows where competitors face off against monsters in an arena, all for the enjoyment of eager onlookers.

Their ace is a woman known as Shining Eclair. As beautiful as she is deadly, shows where she makes an appearance require a special "Platinum" ticket for entry. Due to her popularity, these tickets are very hard to get your hands on.
2:
One fair summer, Platinum Legends produced a documentary centered on her titled "Passionate Platinum."

The picture featured an in-depth look at her everyday life, with focus not only on her fighting prowess, but also on the way she spends her precious days off in the sun with her close friends.

1:
The alluring number which drove the princess of a certain country to near madness.

Every time the young royal saw this number, she found herself forced to recall the myriad crazy and unruly events that transpired that one fair summer. The recollection of this never fails to fill the princess with shame and remorse.

Some of her wilder displays in particular make her want to bury her head deep into a pillow and scream.

A former member of the Aegis Squadron. 

In the past, he was a coworker and close friend to Sera. Afterward, he was tasked with carrying out an internal purge on the Administrator's orders. He had his memories erased by none other than Sera.

Prior to losing his memory, he used to be quite the romantic. He had a great interest in flowers and the rich symbolism they held.

After having his memory restored by Sera, he regained his original personality.
2:
Though carefree and uninhibited by nature, he remains thoroughly considerate of others.

A cultured and sophisticated individual, he's the type of person who will visit every sightseeing landmark when on vacation, even if it means packing his schedule to the brim with activities.

Though both he and Sera have gaps in their memories of each other, they do their best to create even better, newer ones together.

1: An almost predestined proclivity to have all sorts of misfortunes with the fairer sex. Two young men in particular seem to have the worst case of this condition—though some would argue their own actions are the cause. You reap what you sow, boys.
ニクキュウシアツノジュツ

An acupuncture technique which is the specialty of Shirano and her fox kits. It makes use of one's natural-born paws to massage all the right pressure points on the body, including the sole, back, shoulders, and waist. Apparently, this technique is immensely satisfying to the receiver, hence its overwhelming popularity.

Stella, after having a taste of this massage, gets absolutely hooked and becomes a repeat customer. Shirano grumbles about the constant requests, but she still obliges them gladly.

The manager of Paradise Isle's Casino Belaqua.

She's said to have contributed in some unknown way to the initial construction of Paradise Isle. Her managerial skill is so great and widely renowned that even veterans balk at her incredible talent.
2:
As part of her job overseeing the den of greed and avarice that every casino inevitably is, Esmeralda employs a myriad of operational strategies.

One of these involves emphasizing the preservation of peace on Paradise Isle. Esmerelda's intense dedication to running an operation with spotless integrity was so well-known that word even got out to the seedy underbelly of society—who then promptly labeled her a "dangerous person" warranting the highest degree of caution.

1:
An organization that focuses on recovering the lost items of adventurers who pass away in the Kaleidoscope. After a representative collects the item, they then return it to the family of the deceased. Currently, Hildegarde is the chief of this guild.

Members of the guild possess the ability to use not only the item itself, but the lingering emotions surrounding it to discern the identity of the original owner.
2:
Given the unfortunate nature of their work, many in the guild are ostracized and seen as practitioners of "dark" magic by the public. Given that their arrival often brings with it the news of a family member's passing, there are few who are happy to see a guild member at their door.

But the fact remains that without them, the families of many deceased adventurers would never know what truly happened to their loved one. Those who have been aided by them realize the importance of—and are thankful for—the difficult work these guild members do.

1: セイレイツカイノブゾク

Tribes of people living in the outskirts of Palpebra who worship various types of "spirits."

Far from being homogenous, there are in fact multiple different clans of these people, each living in their own settlement and having their own unique culture. The laws and customs towards outsiders vary depending on the village.
2:
In the village of the Shaman of Fire, for example, denizens actually serve to help out the people of Palpebra by providing them with orbs of luminance—devices which help the city's lamps stay lit.

Other villages, however, are simply so far away from Palpebra that frequent communication proves to be difficult.
3:
Some villages regard the spirits as the souls of ancient ancestors. In such places, it is said that when a person dies, their flesh is sent to the earth, but their soul flies to the heavens, where a part of them is reborn into the world. 

This unique practice leads some spirit users from these settlements to be frustrated and confused with outsiders who do not abide by the same customs.

1:
The medicine which Sohvi produces includes various components, such as elements and even spirits. Its effectiveness is said to surpass not only that of regular medicine, but of magically-manufactured medicaments as well.

Currently, Sohvi is obsessed with creating a concoction which grows hair on its imbiber, though she has yet to produce one which meets her sky-high expectations.

From the point of view of the laymen, however, her potions do a more than good enough job of doing what they say they would. Because of this, a certain subset of people in Palpebra have even taken to secretly calling her the "Goddess of Hair."
2:
Recently, Sohvi has taken to incorporating alchemical techniques into her medicine brewing.

Deep within her soul, a lone wish lay hidden, defying all attempts to remember it. That wish was her desire to resurrect her dead parents, and it would eventually lead to her uncovering a most peculiar technique. Altering its fundamental form, she would apply it to a new purpose—putting it to use in service to the one she loves more than anything.

After all, everything Sohvi does, she does for love.

1:
A special brand of clothing designed by Lilian, a tailor who runs a shop in Palpebra.

Clothes in this line are all hand-made by Lilian, and are extremely popular to boot. Orders for her brand clothing are constantly flooding in and show no signs of stopping.

The brand has die-hard fans in Starview Village who are eagerly awaiting the next item Lilian puts out.
ミレイアオウコクノヒホウ

The 128 sacred relics which are the pride of the Kingdom of Mirea. It is said that long ago, when the country was in dire straits, these relics disappeared. In reality, however, they were merely sold to pay off the country's debts. Some of these relics have already been retrieved by the nation's first princess, Toria, but due to their sheer number, it will no doubt be quite some time before all of them are back in Mirea's vaults.
2:
But now, there are suddenly 201 relics.

Why? There were only 73 before! I swear the royal family has no idea what they're doing when designating what gets to be a relic. They're just flying by the seat of their pants!

They're not even really considering the value of the things—some of these relics are sold on markets abroad for dirt cheap! 

-Addendum:
The royal family has determined another item worth of being officially recognized. The number of total relics has now increased from 201 to 202.

1:
The second son of House Swes, one of the nine noble houses of the Farlands. Involved in diplomacy and trade, he also happens to be Libram Swes's older brother. He has a reputation for losing his temper, but is said to be even more skilled than his older brother Azrail.

Currently, however, he is suspected of orchestrating an attempt to foment conflict between his two brothers. In addition to that, he's thought to have been involved with House Kwetur, a fact which only serves to make him even more suspicious. In the eyes of many, he is a man who threatens to sow seeds of war and division in the world.
2:
"He's a feckless idealist, that brother of mine. Unable to pursue profit and unwilling to make enemies. He's a coward."

Such were Ziggurat's harsh words against his older brother—and many were aware of his low opinion of his sibling. This difference in popularity between the two brothers grew so stark that many merchants in the realm began to prefer doing business with the far more convivial Azrail instead.

As for what he had to say about his third brother, Libram, Ziggurat curtly dismissed the question: "What is there even to evaluate? He's not worth discussing." Harsh words, no doubt, but a marked difference in tone from how he speaks about Azrail, some have noted.

1:
Shibuya has merged with Palpebra, and chaos and danger reign on its streets.

The sudden change has fundamentally shaken the minds of many residents, leaving them in a state of bewilderment. On the other hand, those who were able to quickly adapt to the situation found themselves awakening to newfound abilities and setting them to use on the path of battle.

The only reason this tinderbox of a situation didn't blow up completely was thanks to the diligent and agile work of the Guild Knights and Dul Kugala, the determination and devotion of Seiji Takamori, the mayor of Shibuya, as well as one odd but highly-skilled red-headed pirate who claimed she was a Japanese citizen.
2:
In the middle of all this chaos, Seiji Takamori was chosen to become mayor of Shibuya. He then went on to establish a treaty between Palpebra and Shibuya.

In the aftermath, many areas of Shibuya fell to ruin and lost any and all leadership. They then joined the remaining ranks of Aegis, a group which demonstrated resistance to Palpebra's presence, and which even underwent internal power struggles. The rate of these incidents was thankfully brought down by the hard work of the Guild Knights and the mayor of Shibuya. Their persistent attempts to curb violence in both cities bore fruit.
3:
Shibuya, a city that appeared to be almost completely in ruin, is now undergoing an elaborate restoration project.

Via a combination of scientific know-how from Shibuya and elemental technologies provided by the Voluntas Arcane Arts Academy, research is underway to find a sustainable means of providing a stable energy source for the city. Though a complete solution is yet to be found, prospects are looking bright.

Thanks to these promising advancements, many people have become eager to do business with Shibuya, and its streets are already graced by the presence of curious blue-skinned visitors, as well as a group thought to be gargans*.
*There is debate regarding the proper nomenclature of this group; some insist that because they have a tail and dog-like cranium, they should be called "beastfolk" and not gargans. This debate falls outside the purview of this entry and has been omitted.
4:
As part of an ongoing effort to unite the peoples of Shibuya and Palpebra, Magia Fest became a joint effort between Voluntas Academy and Shibuyan students.

The Shibuyans who attended were reminded of their despair at losing their home world and nearly lost themselves, but their surrounding Palpebran friends were able to return them to their senses.

For a moment, the gigantic, Shibuya-designed golem towering over the event allowed these two peoples to witness the same dream. The scene gave the Shibuyans renewed hope for a brighter future ahead.

1:
Tooru Sengaku's younger sister, a second-year middle school student. Sporting an embroidered jersey and golden hair, she likes to call her older brother "Toto," which lends to her overall childlike vibe.

She initially lived apart from Tooru, as the former leader of Aegis feared that knowledge of their relation would endanger his little sister's life. After a suggestion from Nao, however, Chika ends up relocating to Starview Village.

She now spends her days in peace, eagerly awaiting the newest entry in the KoiAzu manga series, alongside her friends Nao and Inaho.
2:
The Sengaku family had one additional member: the eldest, Kazuya. Given how their parents were less than ideal at their jobs, Kazuya ended up being the de-facto "dad" of the family, taking care of his younger siblings. At that time, he was still kind to Chika, though he would later go on to steal money from and even use physical violence against her.

Leaving all the bad memories up in flames alongside his bike, Chika says her final goodbyes to the man who was once her brother.

1:
After Tohru Sengaku left the organization, the group fractured and devolved into infighting, all for the lack of a charismatic leader to unite them.

Though there are factions which hope to see Tohru come back as leader, other remnants of the organization are content with just sowing chaos. These remnants of Aegis, who have been joined by various ex-adventurer riff-raff, are consistently a source of headaches for the perpetually-understaffed Guild Knights.
2:
Thanks to the efforts of the Guild to look after those Shibuya residents still in shock, relations have improved. More and more Palpebrans are in favor of a peaceful coexistence with the people of Shibuya—though they don't usually include Aegis members in this new cooperative peace.

Remnants of Aegis are still at large, and among them are many people with awakened abilities. Aegis has become a sort of receptacle for those cast aside by society, who have nowhere else to go.

A comprehensive solution to this necessitates that both Palpebra and Shibuya obtain a deeper understanding of each other. In an effort to do this, the mayor of Shibuya and the Department of Kaleidoscope Exploration Safety have collaborated together and are proposing more opportunities for cultural exchange between the factions.
3:
長らく分裂状態にあった
元エイジスのメンバー達だが
かつてのリーダー・千岳トオルの
帰還を契機に、エイジズ残党は再編された。

結束を取り戻した彼らは
ギルドナイツやベスタ族の精鋭と共闘して
粛清者迎撃の一翼を担うのだった。
4:
エイジス残党の再編は
一筋縄ではいかなかった。

ユウトやケンジを筆頭とした
エイジス出身の風来坊を
メガネ先生やギルドナイツ、さらには
飛翔王子達が絶妙にサポートしていった結果
彼らが奮起の兆候を見せる。

そんなタイミングに
千岳トオルが戻ってきた事で
事態が打開されたのだった。

1:
After Shibuya was transported to the outskirts of Palpebra, this position was created in order to ensure Shibuya had strong leadership going forward. Seiji Takamori is the incumbent mayor.

Technically speaking, the "town" of Shibuya is a new municipality created to designate the area that was transported near Palpebra. Prior to the merge, it was considered not a town, but a special ward of Tokyo city. The mayor's main roles are to run the city, manage relations with the Aegis remnants, and oversee diplomacy with Palpebra. It is by no means an easy job.
2:
Meetings with Palpebra, conflict resolution planning, meetings with citizens, followed by even more conflict resolution planning.

Such is the busy schedule of Seiji Takamori, and yet he always looks composed and in good health. All those after-work drinking parties he once hated have now become a crucial time to decompress and forget about stress.

A recent common occurrence is for Seiji to set up a night out with Zekhel, only to have Regis mysteriously show up and tag along.

1:
A textbook on proper magical incantations. Not only is its structure intuitive and easy to digest, but it also stimulates further learning by inviting readers to question exactly why certain spells work the way they do. Given how this tome makes magical education so fun, it's no surprise that it's garnered such a positive reputation.

Tor Leleni, an instructor at Voluntas Arcane Arts Academy, is a strong proponent of this book's merits, and has chosen to implement it into her beginner class curriculum.

Man-made creations capable of independent movement.

Golems are varied in nature; their appearance, features, and even manner of operation may differ according to their purpose. Some are merely intended as killing machines to ward off invaders, while others are used in performances in various events. Autonomous drones can also be said to be one subset of the broader category "golem."
2:
At Voluntas Arcane Arts Academy, some students take part in the "Golem Club," an extracurricular activity which focuses on golem research and production.

The study of golems at Voluntas is a perilous one, always bringing with it the risk of a creation running wild. Though they take great care to use the most stable technology available, for some reason the creations of the Golem Club have a frequent tendency to run amok.

According to rumors, the blame lies with the club's overzealous and highly curious leader, who is prone to making all sorts of questionable "adjustments" to her final products.

1:
An organization from the Farlands which occupies itself primarily with both the theoretical and practical aspects of magic. It's sometimes referred to as the Bureau of Magic.

They have a deep connection with Voluntas Arcane Arts Academy. Some researchers from the association who are disillusioned with and tired of the importance placed on "tradition" instead look expectantly to Voluntas as a way to perhaps escape this dreary environment. To them, Voluntas is a place where unbridled magical freedom can be enjoyed.
ファーランドキュウテイガクダン

An orchestra which operates at the royal court of the nation of the Farlands. Far from being a solely artistic enterprise, its members are often sent on pseudo-diplomatic deployments to foreign countries. The orchestra's technical abilities are highly praised, and tickets to performances always sell out with startling speed. With great talent, however, come great egos—many people have been reduced to tears by the arrogant attitudes of some of this orchestra's members.

A first-year at Voluntas Arcane Arts Academy. He finds himself squarely at the top of his class grade-wise, but his smug attitude hasn't won him many friends.

Something about Ryuichi Kageoka makes Luik feel extra competitive, and he challenges him to some sort of contest every time they meet. He seems to enjoy dragging Ryuichi around Palpebra.

The various professors of Voluntas Arcane Arts Academy. They occupy themselves with teaching, research, and writing papers and other publications.

When the Academy was first established, its staff consisted entirely of eager researchers, but as magic became more and more common in society, the institution's scale expanded. In recent years, the hiring process has placed more emphasis on the teaching skill of prospective instructors.
2:
Being a teacher is not easy.

In addition to their regular duties, teachers are often asked to handle all manner of tasks: overseeing club activities, preparing for orientation, navigating complaints from parents and guardians, and even thwarting golem uprisings. Every year, they get more and more piled on to their plate. "How is this OUR job, exactly?! Hire someone else to do it!" Exasperated teachers can often be heard in the halls of Voluntas venting their frustrations. At the very least, the poor professors expect (and deserve!) to be paid overtime for their endless troubles.

1: An extra-curricular club at Voluntas Arcane Arts Academy. Instruments in hand, the group performs music outdoors while marching. Their common goal is to improve their respective musical skills, as well as to strengthen their collective bond. The leader of the band is known as a drum major, and is chosen anew every year from a pool of the most dedicated and talented candidates.
2: Recently, purely by being exposed to the band's Drum Major—a girl with incredible talent and drive, Eloise has managed to level up her own skills as well. She even managed to get her group past the preliminary stage of the Palpebran International Music Festival (albeit on a special exception). At the festival, she combined her forces with the Farland Court Orchestra to put on a wonderful performance—which was even covered by the Oculus.

1: ミライヘツムグホシノウタ

The annual Magia Fest this year is held as a joint effort between the students of Voluntas and Shibuya.

While Voluntas Academy's student council president Luciada runs around the festival solving all the issues that arise, she meets Shibuya student Hibiki Suminami. Through the song Binary Planet, the two find a way to bridge the gap between them.
2: The festivities are interrupted when the serpent Il Freed is released through forbidden magic and resonates with the insecurities of the people of Shibuya. As the Shibuyans threaten to slip away from reality, Luciada and friends use Binary Planet to restore hope, with their efforts culminating in the giant golem Amicitia blasting the serpent away and saving the day.

1:
The student council of Voluntas Academy. Luciada Sextan, an exchange student from the Farlands, currently serves as its president.

Holding an equal amount of power as the faculty and parents' association when it comes to academy-wide decisions, their day-to-day activities mostly consist of mundane office work.

When trouble arises, its members often have to bow their heads in apology in addition to solving said problems.
バイナリープラネット

A song that features a synthesized voice as its original singer. It was uploaded to a video site by the user "doyomosu".

During the troubling times in Shibuya, it played throughout the emergency shelter and became a source of comfort for all the weary souls there. Now, it has a found a new, equally-as-passionate fan base among the students of Voluntas.
2:
The song is named Binary Planet, after stars that share an orbital axis. For its significance to the Shibuyans and central motif of two connected worlds, the song was chosen to be performed at Magia Fest.

Due to unforeseen circumstances, the singer Diva Media ended up performing a unique arrangement of the song at the festival.
3:
After the Magia Fest performance, rumors began to circulate that the Shibuyan girl who performed on the keyboard was actually the original composer of the song.

Eyewitnesses also claimed that a certain noble and a certain princess fought over custody of the girl, but those rumors were soon quashed. In an effort to avoid any international misunderstandings, the people who knew the truth were ordered to keep quiet.

1: An annual festival held every year at Voluntas Academy that showcases what the students have been working on. Many visitors from outside the academy come to see their research displays and live demonstrations.
2:
As part of the efforts to integrate the Shibuyan people into Palpebran society, Magia Fest became a joint school festival between Voluntas and the students of Shibuya.

Though the Shibuyans and their powers are an anomaly in regards to established magical theories, most young people and merchants were happy to adapt to this change.

1:
A fifteen-year-old, first-year high school student. She awakened to teleportation powers.

Her hobby is composing music. Back during her days in Japan, she uploaded her music to video sites under the username "doyomosu".

Her song Binary Planet became a source of comfort for the people of Shibuya during trying times.
2:
The day Shibuya was cut off from the rest of the world, Hibiki was among one of the many who disappeared.

After Shota Inori rescued her from the Kaleidoscope, she learned that Shibuya had been transported to another world, and that hers was gone. The other Shibuyans appeared to have accepted their lot in life and offered positive encouragement, but their words only served to alienate her from them.
3:
Through the events at Magia Fes, Hibiki learned that the other Shibuyan people harbored the same worries and insecurities as her, but had just done a better job of hiding them.

After meeting Luciada, Nao, Dia, Toria, and the rest, she resolved to move forward despite her fears, toward a future together with the people of this new world.

1:
Certain magical techniques are used to command and control golems.

For example, some choose to use a technique that writes instructions into what is essentially the golem's brain, while others prefer a completely different method. Deciding on what techniques to use is one of the most important steps of crafting a golem.
2:
More complicated techniques are required for a golem to obey more complicated commands. A single mistake is enough to shut down a golem completely, or have it run wild.

To refine such delicate techniques, researchers are working day in and day out.

1:
Some time after Shibuya connected to the area around Palpebra, people who had gone missing from Shibuya began to appear in the Kaleidoscope.

Some of these people, having missed the initial chaos of joining the new world and the struggles leading up to it, feel alienated from their fellow Shibuyans who experienced every moment of hardship.
トモニアユモウオナジユメヘ

"We'll make our dreams come true together, one step at a time!"

This became the theme of the joint Magia Fest held by Shibuya and Voluntas Academy, thanks to the suggestion of Inaho who appeared as soon as she heard a festival was coming.
2:
In her quest for an answer, one fox princess experienced the joys of falling stars on a holy night, a play between yokai and humans, the adventures of creating an encyclopedia, and the excitement of water guns.

Nobody knows better than her what it takes to break the barrier between worlds, which is why her words became the motto for the festival joining two peoples.

1: Toria's handwritten notes on Magia Fest, ranging from reviews of the food stands to academy secrets that few know. As Toria herself is easily amused and not picky about her food, her notes might not resonate with all readers, but they are undeniably more detailed than the average review column of any paper.

A Star Augur who infiltrated House Sextan as a spy.

Based on his actions during Magia Fest, it can be concluded that he possesses some amount of knowledge on serpents and is capable of using dark, forbidden magic. Currently his whereabouts are unknown, despite the Guild Knights' best efforts to hunt him down.

He appears to harbor a deep respect for the Star Augur Procheon.

A gigantic golem sculpted with a Shibuyan design in mind. With its name meaning friendship in another language, it was meant to serve as both a symbol for Magia Fest and a backdrop for the special concert being held.

Though it is unequipped with any control systems enabling movement, its sheer size speaks volumes of Luciada's capabilities as a mage.
2:
At its feet, there was a sign allowing visitors to leave a message or two while also showcasing the signatures of all involved who made the festival happen.

After the fervent wishes of the awakened temporarily transformed Amicitia and the festival ended, it was carefully dismantled and stored as both a precious sample of the powers of the awakened and a reminder of the power of friendship.
3:
Want to know more about the super duper mecha Amicitia that came to life through the powers of the awakened? Have I got the scoop for you!

Amicitia is reminiscent of the superhero robots that the people of Shibuya used to see back in their original home (popular with children, though also with some adults). Through their shared wish, Amicitia came to life as an actual superhero mecha! By the way, it took only 0.0001 seconds to transform!

Then it blasted away the bad guy and saved the day! Go, go, Amicitia!

Maybe someday we can hope for a repeat performance! Stay tuned!

1:
An extra-curricular club at Voluntas Arcane Arts Academy. As its name implies, the club is centered around all things golem—whether it be their research or manufacture.

The actual scale of the club's operation is not particularly large, but the technology they produce is far more impressive than that of any regular student. Their only real major flaw would be a flagrant over-ambition, as their creations have a tendency of malfunctioning and otherwise going haywire. Most of this is the club leader's fault.

Those who have experienced these golem rampages first hand know well to fear both the creations and the club that brought them forth. Every mention of the club's name draws a quiet "Oh God, not them..." from a nearby victim.
2:
The following is a list of the four (widely known) incidents in which the Golem Club has been involved.

- The "Voluntas on Ice" Incident
- The "Big Trouble for a Little Witch" Incident
- The "White Tiger Cupid" Incident
- The "Magia Fest Clean Up" Incident

These four are likely just the tip of the iceberg—there have been many other incidents. However, they were only witnessed by a small group of people, and remain difficult to clearly identify and provide a record of.
3:
Date: **/**. Weather Conditions: Clear
Performed an initial activation on the target golem using the newly contrived procedure. Subject did not respond well and began to exhibit unintended behavior. Thankfully, a (rather petite) wind-magic using professor was in the vicinity, and the situation was taken care of before any major damage was done. The professors gave me hell for that one. Promising that my next experiment would not end in failure only seemed to make them angrier. Reasons unclear.

Date: **/**. Weather Conditions: Overcast
Another one went haywire—and I even went and used a brand new reactor core this time! Thankfully Cipher's ice magic helped the golem cool down, so to speak. No major damage, though parts of the Academy are still rather... frosty. But, I have great news: this malfunction was NOT caused by the same thing as the last one. Splendid! Well, except for the fact that the professors scolded me to no end. Graaaaaagh.

- Excerpts of a Certain Student's Diary
4:
数々のゴーレム暴走事件の元凶である
ゴーレム部の部長『デイダリア』。

そんな彼女の作るゴーレムは
通常のゴーレム理論から外れがちなために
他の術者から理解を得られない事も多い。
一般向けにと制作したゴーレムであっても
繊細な作りからなるピーキーな性能によって
高い性能と同時にトラブルも起こしている
ようである。

1:
In an effort to help restore the town of Shibuya, its mayor began to promote the recovery and restoration of all sorts of entertainment media, manga being chief among them.

Some of the manga recovered by this initiative has found its way to Palpebra, where it is being distributed and is leading to a noticeable rise in popularity of comic book culture across the city.

As a result, it's hard to deny that a very "meta" atmosphere has been brewing surrounding the Magia Fest. It is, after all, a school festival, and who knows what sorts of appropriately "school festival-like" manga hijinks might unfold during its duration?
2:
In a manga centered on school/academy life, you might typically encounter a culture festival with a haunted house, or perhaps an authentic maid cafe recreated with extreme attention to deal.

Some other archetypical scenarios of this genre include:
- A myth saying that if you confess to the person you like under a legendary tree, you'll be bound together forever.
- Going to the roof at lunch, only to find some delinquents hanging out there.
- Going to the school infirmary, but the teacher isn't there.

Some other examples from a slightly spookier direction might also prove helpful:
- Anatomic models or taxidermized animals suddenly moving on their own.
- Famous historical figures emerging from their portraits on the wall.
- The ghost of a young girl living in the bathroom.

Notably, these situations tend to lean heavy on attempts to psychologically scar readers.
3:
Is it conceivable that all of this "hijinks" could unintentionally be being brought about by those with the power to change reality? At the very least, the possibility can't be ruled out.

"Just, please stop making the anatomic models move. Anything but that."
- Yuki Mishima

1: タピオカメテオヘブン

A famous product from a crepe shop in Shibuya—one delicious enough to stand in line for. This particular variety was conceived specifically for adventurers by using a flavor popular in Palpebra.

This item's hefty, "meteoric" heaping of tapioca makes for a particularly stylish appearance. In terms of taste, it's unspeakably sweet—enough to make your tongue and brain go numb.

The calorie count is not for the faint of heart—or those attempting any sort of diet.

For the purposes of this entry, this refers to the uniforms of students.

Although there are cases where these uniforms are worn by all youth collectively, their original primary use was to distinguish the school institution to which one belonged.

During puberty, many students find themselves trying to develop their own unique identity, leading to some students arranging their uniforms in the most stylish way possible.

Some young people have also chosen to continue wearing these uniforms even when not actively enrolled in school, perhaps as an identifier of their hometown—and of everything they lost.
2:
A famous and skilled Palpebran tailor named Lilian fashioned a new type of uniform based on the one worn by Shibuyan students.

Just by donning this uniform and walking around the Magia Festa, Liam won over the hearts of countless onlookers. With his stylish fashion sense, he became a sort of walking advertisement for the uniform—and Lilian's brand.

Even in Palpebra, the number of people wishing to try out Shibuyan uniforms appears to be on the rise.

1:
The reason why the magic Liam employs is considered so highly taboo. Essentially, it operates by turning life force into energy.

Taken to its extreme, this technique would allow the user to artificially prolong their own life by continuously using the life energy of others.

Theoretically, it also appears possible to utilize the energy of the lingering spirits of the dead for these purposes.
2:
At the Magia Fest cultural exchange festival, Liam converted some of Toria's life force into energy, and noted that it was so vast that it might even endanger the life of an ordinary person.

Toria herself, however, seemed to be in perfectly fine health. She consented to participating in some experiments to help ascertain the nature of the phenomenon, but the only conclusive finding was that she was the bearer of an incredible, unwieldy life force.

1: ドラゴンケンキュウシツ

A research institution belonging to the Voluntas Arcane Arts Academy. The researchers here spend their days studying the ecology and capabilities of the entire dragon species. This includes performing analyses on information brought back by the Dracohazard scouts.
2:
One day, the laboratory's lead researcher on serpents suddenly disappeared, hastily scrawling down only the words "I saw the sleeping dragon in my dreams."

Later on, he was rescued by the Dark Mage of the Kaleidoscope—the two fellow researchers had begun a correspondence.

Afterward, the headmistress herself would go on to issue a formal apology to all those affected. Apparently, what followed the apology was an elaborate recruitment session.

1: エムエスコンサートホール

A concert hall established for the purpose of bringing Shibuya and Mirea together via the magic of music.

The original idea for the hall—and its placement in Shibuya—came from Toria, first princess of the Kingdom of Mirea. Her intention was, apparently, to establish better relations with Shibuya in an effort to help "take down Palpebra."
2:
The help of many Mirean collaborators was enlisted on this project. A tax accountant helped contrive the funds from the guild to help finance the venture, while a merchant helped recruit the royal orchestra of the Farlands to the endeavor. Finally, a renowned architect was tasked with the design of the hall by the princess herself.

The groundwork for the advancement of Mirea was slowly beginning to be laid—though the crown princess herself did little of the actual work.

1:
An artificial intelligence unit that forms the essence of an android. It's stored in the cranial substructure and also sometimes referred to as the "soul."

The device is equipped with a growth function, enabling the gradual development of a consciousness. The male and female units recorded as "parents" to this new unit are also capable of passing down characteristics in the same way genes are in biological entities. Evidently, the goal was to imitate the entirety of human biology—down to its limitations.

For quite a long time, the act of attempting to access the Manabrain was considered highly taboo.
2:
After the death of the Administrator, limiting functions like these were removed, and a vast amount of important information was gleaned on the way the Manabrain functioned. It became possible to draw out even more of the module's latent power.

But this new domain, given its sacrosanct and well-hidden nature in the past, brought with it new challenges. Those who experimented with the technology, or otherwise attempted to brute-force other changes, were sometimes met with an unfortunate fate.

It can therefore be said that research and knowledge regarding the "sacred" realm of the brain, as well as the field of cybernetic implants, lags behind that of Qualia City.

1: ユラグカナタノニューゲート

Far, far from the world of the Kaleidoscope, Special Week and two other Umamusume arrive to Palpebra via a shift.

They are shown around the city by Alk and take in the sights of this delightfully foreign new world. When some Voluntas Academy students spot the Umas and take note of their incredible speed, they challenge the three to a decisive race.
ブルーサニースマイル

On the idyllic shores of Miner's Front, a port city in the coastal waters of Paradise Isle, Primula and her friends happen upon a shy girl named Echo, who has a passion for photography.

Driven by a desire to take a picture of a place from her memories which was subsequently lost to a redevelopment project on the island, Echo sets forth on a summer adventure to realize her humble dream.
2:
Once, her father's oppressive presence kept her down, forcing her to close off her heart. Now, she's given up clinging to memories. Gripping the hands of her newfound friends, she takes a brave step forward toward a new day.

At the end of it all, a glorious smile forms upon her lips, her beaming face as radiant as the sun.

1:
A Float located near Paradise Isle. Originally the island was a mountain of considerably high elevation. After water levels rose in the world, it became the island it is today. Though its environment is far from ideal for habitation, the island is rich in highly-sought-after minerals. This led to man-made installations being created surrounding the island, to facilitate mining operations.

The island was mined dry during the mining industry's boom. Stripped of its natural resources, Miner's Float has been left a desolate husk of its former glory.
2:
Although both this and Paradise Isle (before the land around it was filled in) met the condition of being a mountain protruding from the water, Miner's Front was not chosen as a prime candidate for development, largely due to a myriad of problems, including its elevation and poor soil quality.

After Paradise Isle's massive financial success, sights were set on attempting to develop Miner's Front as well. When this plan was broached, the conglomerate of a man named Pern began to strongly support the project—though their reason for doing this was to facilitate the clandestine smuggling and manufacture of weapons.

1: A woman whom a young Echo greatly admired. She worked as a researcher and activist, focusing on the protection of the environment. She was at Miner's Front for only a brief period of time, primarily to investigate and protest against the endeavors of Pern. Her exuberant and forward-looking way of life made quite the impression on Echo, causing the timid girl to form vivid memories of Narcissa.
2:
"Who needs memories? Best to throw them all away, and move forward instead. Can you do that?"

Discarding all that doesn't suit your interests, seeing everything in the simplest terms possible... To Echo, this way of life that Narcissa demonstrated was exactly what it meant to be "strong."

But was it really? Was it true strength? Perhaps there's no longer any need to find out.

1:
The father of Echo and executive of a particular financial conglomerate.

As the chief overseer of the redevelopment project, he is involved in a wide array of business-related affairs, including administrative policy, budget allocation, planning, scenery development, public relations, maintenance, disaster prevention, and the stymying of protest efforts.
2:
However, in reality, the redevelopment project was little more than a front for an extensive weapon manufacture and smuggling enterprise. The fact that Pern was able to obtain even aerial weapons (which saw little action in the Endless Blue) is evidence of his connections with the other-worldly organization known as the Star Augurs.

Currently, a group of powerful, terrifying figures are manipulating Pern into spying on the Star Augurs on their behalf.

1:
Given the overwhelming demand from droids to be able to experience the senses of taste and smell just like humans, development of this functionality was restarted thanks to the efforts of none other than Rec Register.

By connecting the nervous system and the manabrain, this function allows droids to experience the joys of taste by converting organic matter into energy.
2:
It is said that androids who sought to emulate humans were outfitted with this function from the very start. However, after their planet was engulfed in flames, it became difficult to even obtain the necessary food to activate this function. As such, it became obsolete.

Now that communication with other worlds is possible, and that certain rules once held sacrosanct were broken, it could be said that the wishes of those androids who desired to be human had finally come true.

1:
A special fundoshi device that Zantetsu had custom-made for his summer adventures. It glows and flashes vividly in every color of the rainbow.

Given the highly unique nature of the request, the creator initially refused, stating it was too difficult. However, due to Zantetsu's unshakable perseverance (and a very elaborate and dramatic prostration on the floor), the maker eventually caved.

The final product is one that perfectly reflects the soul and spirit of a ninja samurai. Well, at least according to Zantetsu's interpretation.

An illegal device which Zantetsu had installed in himself.

When the device senses movements akin to the two primary acts of seppuku (the cutting of the stomach and subsequent decapitation), it sends a signal to the abdomen and cervical vertebrae, stimulating a blissful response of "post-puku clarity."

This product is advertised as being a great way to clear one's depressive and gloomy thoughts by simulating the act of seppuku in a safe environment.
2:
At its core, this device functions by forcefully changing the mood of its target, by making direct alterations to their manabrain.

This product was developed by adapting previously forbidden technology, the likes of which even Updaters were unable to easily obtain.

At the time of use, Zantetsu's information processing speed greatly exceeded the parameters of his built-in limiter, producing a sensation wherein he began to experience nigh-hallucinatory visions unlike anything seen in this world. Or so he claims.

1: エスティーエムパリデス

An immensely powerful attack helicopter owned by Pern, the man who was in charge of the weapon smuggling operation on Miner's Front.

In the Endless Blue, aerial weaponry gradually grew to be discarded, largely due to the difficulty of finding usable land in a world whose sea levels had risen. Unstable weather and the high cost of operation were also factors.

However, these weapons were still in high demand in "other" places.

A plan that Shota Inori went all out for during his summer vacation. Despite viewing it as a rite of passage and a way to make memories with his best friend, he put little thought into it beyond trying everything he could think of and seeing what stuck. Secretly, he hoped that at least one attempt would be successful, but in the end, all he managed to do was scar his friend for life.
2:
The operation proceeded in the following manner:

Randomly approaching beastfolk tourists on the beach resulted in complete failure. Operators then assisted a cute local with her cargo, but were rejected when asking her out after. Back on the beach, attempts to piggyback off of Zantetsu's popularity were met with pity and laughter.

Though strategies were penned for exploring the nightlife, the opportunity to employ them never came. 

With zero successes under their belt, operators have postponed their future operation with Nova.

1: The son of a wealthy businessman on Paradise Isle. Initially appearing as nothing more than a shallow youth who bossed around his lackeys John and Gary, his encounter with Marguerite changed him for the better. Through the power of friendship and dreams, he was able to oppose his father's will and forge his own path.
2: After striking out on his own, he focused solely on expanding his beach house business, offering seafood menus that became extremely popular. He has now opened a second beach house, garnering attention from even the denizens of Starview Village.

1: サイカイハツケイカク

A plan to turn Miner's Front, an island which had become little more than an abandoned mine whose contents had been mercilessly extracted, into a beautiful tourist destination the likes of Paradise Isle.

The man in charge of this operation was Pern, though in reality he was using the off-limits "construction" area to hide his illegal weapon smuggling enterprise.

An elegant flower (aka, an idol) that suddenly "bloomed" on Paradise Isle.

"I'm ready to do... whatever you wish!"
Though this was her official catchphrase from the very moment of her debut, it's unclear whether Primula was the one to come up with the slogan.

Rumors circulate frequently that she's planning to take a break from being an idol; no doubt in part due to her highly timid and shy personality. However, she is currently planning a collaboration with Lady Alice, making use of 3D model imagery. 

Recently, she's been observed secretly visiting a certain family restaurant, where a notebook had been placed by her fans for the purposes of communicating with the Princess herself.

The condensed version of the philosophy of one Harlisha, a traditional healer.

In summary, the teachings state that sometimes NOT working hard is just as important as working hard.

Though even that explanation is too vague. It more accurately refers to the act of sprawling out on your bed and lazing the day away while watching the clock tick without a worry in the world, enjoying every moment as it comes.

This philosophy has thoroughly ingrained itself in the residents of Starview Village, and is doubtless one of the best ways of attaining world peace.
2:
There are some among the clergy of the Palpebran church who have adopted this particular philosophy.

"Sometimes it's okay to treat yourself. Especially when you're tired! It's times like those when you should just pat yourself on the head and say 'It's okay. You're allowed to be lazy!'"

Truer words of wisdom are rarely spoken.
3:
ハリシャは、とある薬草師と協力して
その概念を扱った秘密のサロンを
星見の街に開いた。
『普段休めていない頑張り屋さん』が
ターゲット。
香油の効能と施術で心身ともに癒やされて
利用者は『自堕落サイコー』の真髄を
味わう事になるだろう。

1:
Dinah—the pet cat of the proud, noble, (and maybe a bit haughty) Alice.
Lailah—the pet cat of the timid, shy, (and maybe a bit too easily swayed) Primula.

These two felines are often spotted together, and when their keepers are away, the two love to play—namely in the form of going for strolls around Starview. They lounge around, and are often spotted sunbathing in well-lit corners of the village.
2:
According to Nao Nagihara, at one point in time her older brother developed a sudden dislike for cats, averting his gaze when near them.

However, in recent days, Alk has been seen around Starview happily petting the village's two resident cats.

1:
An experienced adventurer who is also known as the Tempest. A source of inspiration for Yuna, this adventurer always extends a hand to those in need.

Sometimes, after a couple of drinks, a somber look would pass through her teacher's eyes, before being wiped away by rowdy cheering.
ボウケンシャノセイカツジジョウ

While some brave adventurers dive deep into the Kaleidoscope searching for a big payout, less skilled adventurers have to take side gigs or part-time jobs to make ends meet.

While some eventually move on to become full-time adventurers, others choose to continue their odd jobs and help others along the way, finding that this life suits them better.
2: Beginner adventurers often start out doing odd jobs, like guarding element mining expeditions, porting goods, waiting tables, and even guiding refugees. Though this type of work is invaluable to Palpebra, many of them still dream of becoming proper adventurers.

1:
A brand-new combat support unit gifted to Bulleta by Love. It boasts a wide range of top-of-the-line functions, including extra-long-range transmission, a hologram display, an in-built solar generator, an independent aviation module, and the ability to unleash large-scale barrages of gunfire on enemies.

Ostensibly, this was gifted to Bulleta so as to allow her to perform highly-precise combat operations in non-usual environments. In reality, however, Love just wanted an excuse to tag along on Bulleta's adventures.

The meaning behind the acronym? 
FREEDOM LOVES YOU.

For those brave enough to look past appearances and foray into the unknown, a world of unexplored, tantalizing flavors await. The initial flavor might take some getting used to, but the delicate undertones of umami peeking through practically make this dish a delicacy. The final touch comes from the pleasant sensation of chewing through the juicy tentacles that make up the dish.

Even the Devourer of Stars' maiden herself gives this soup her seal of approval, along with a glowing recommendation to enjoy it alongside a mug of beer.

Also goes great with a bowl of rice gruel.

(At least two servings must be requested in order to make a reservation, as the ingredients for the dish are difficult to secure.)

The stage name that Alice went by when she participated in a fashion show.

During the finale of the show, the audience was captivated by her inherent cuteness, rather than the Gilles Couture swimsuit she wore. This reception displeased her to no small degree, as she wished to be treated as a mature adult instead of a young child.

When considering fashion, Stella has standards for how exposed an outfit can be. However, she is easily swayed by others' fashion senses and tends to relax her standards when judging friends' outfits (though even she has her limits).

In regards to her own clothing, she is even more strict about coverage, but lately her standards have fallen due to the influence of certain individuals around her...

A winged minority race from Fang Canyon.

Due to their innate flight capabilities, Birdfolk can successfully inhabit mountainous regions that other species struggle to survive in. Their hunter-gatherer lifestyle affords them a peaceful existence, removed from the conflicts of the cat- and dogfolk. 

Despite the preponderance of adept hunters in their society, many of them shun violence and conflict.

A mixed group of dogfolk and catfolk mercenaries including former soldiers, ex-convicts, and outcasts. Each of its members failed to otherwise find a place in society after the war.

Helga, well-known for her combat expertise and experience on the battlefield, occupies a leadership position, ensuring the group does not turn to criminal violence.
2:
After a turbulent series of events, Magnos adopts the role of "mentor," and listens to the concerns and complaints of the group's members. However, in reality, the group's members can often be seen encouraging Magnos in his own troubles.

Some of the members appear to be former members of the Dire Wolves—an organization of dogfolk assassins.
3:
粛清者に急襲された
パルペブラの街が混乱の只中にあった時
援軍として現れた面々の中には
牙の傭兵団の姿もあった。

これはドゥ・ククスとの首脳会議の際に
クロとヘルガの提案によって
少数居住の許可が与えられたためだったが
パルペブラと彼らの橋渡しに尽力したのは
クッキー屋手伝いの元影狼であったという。

1: A group of lupinefolk assassins that served under the beastfolk king. Their ranks were formed from elite fighters trained from a young age to be emotionless killing machines. They were the ones who carried out the assassination of Whitetail.
2: With peace came the disbanding of the Dire Wolves. As for Klaus Fersen, their most elite assassin, many believed he was secretly disposed of... at least until he was spotted handing out polar bear cookies. Though appearing initially suspicious, the cookies were delicious and completely free of any poison.
3:
Following the end of the conflict between the dogfolk and catfolk, the Dire Wolves lost their purpose as an organization of assassins and their skills became dull. However, Helga invited them to join the newly formed Company of the Fang. 

Klaus, a former Dire Wolf, did not join the group, but the polar bear cookies that are regularly brought in seem to be very popular among the group's members.

1: A hidden village created in secret by curse-wielding catfolk to give them even more power. After the passing of Whitetail, they became a cult, working to control both the catfolk and dogfolk through fear. Helga wiped out the entire village on her own.
ネコゾクノジュジュツ

Among the catfolk were curse wielders who secured their position in society by convincing others they had mystical powers of prediction and could perform spells, as well as control sprites. They became tools to control the masses through fear, with many of their harmful curses actually being the skillful use of hidden poisons and other practical effects.

The dogfolk never received mystical powers like the catfolk did, forcing them to take to engineering pursuits. Through the discovery of gunpowder and metalworking, they were able to produce unique arms and develop their society. In this way, they eventually emerged the victor in their long war against the catfolk.

As for why only beastfolk exist in Fang Canyon, supposedly an advanced technique capable of changing a race's qualities was responsible. While some might think this would be a form of gene manipulation, experts in this field from other worlds claim that even the most advanced gene manipulation would not explain all the qualities of the beastfolk.
2: According to the research of a certain catfolk sage, the mermaids of the Endless Blue might also be a predesigned race, but there isn't enough evidence to conclude one way or another. The question then becomes this: how is it that they are able to wield curses? Perhaps an answer will come one day, after the sage delves further research into his research.

1:
Martial artist Shuilong aims for one goal, and one goal only—to transcend established conventions and attain ultimate power. Only one can stand at the top, and she will be the one to tread the path there.

This unshakeable mindset forms the entire basis of her worldview.
2: Yet for all her strength, she was beaten by someone who only fought as a means to an end and cared little for mastering the craft itself. That single moment was enough to shake the foundation of her world—but not enough to convince her to stop.

1:
An enormous float in the Endless Blue. The name is said to mean "nine dragons."

A veritable nest of criminality and lawlessness, the smell of blood and gunpowder pervades the entire area. Ceaseless mafia conflicts help to make this float one of the most dangerous in the entire seas.
2:
Kowloon Float is home to a staggering amount of orphans. Given the amount of daily tragedy that transpires, it's no surprise that many children are abandoned, or simply lose their parents to violence. Groups of orphans form their own communities to help each other survive.

However, educational institutions do exist on this float, with some graduates going on to work in prestigious government positions.

1:
A popular name used to refer to Shota Inori.

People began calling him this for how he tends to fly around freely and without a care when helping the Guild rescue individuals stranded within the Kaleidoscope.

A secret fan club for him has been formed, but within it there is an unspoken rule that Shota must not find out about the club's existence.

As a result, Shota feels that the nickname is merely a way of teasing him.

A tracker secretly attached to Shota Inori by Yukariko Kuguri. Its model number is Znl-83251.

The device is only capable of determining Shota's general proximity via signal strength.

However, Yukariko is somehow able to determine Shota Inori's location with extreme accuracy.
サークルメリーシープ

A club of hobbyists which Meryll participates in frequently. They even create and sell their own books. Since they bankroll their own publishing, however, that means that they can only publish relatively short books. The contents of their books usually deal with the various "activities" and interactions of adventurers. The realistic depictions of the heroes in this group's works were always praised, but their recent output has seemed to improve in quality even further—almost as if they found subjects to base their characters on.
2: In the imprint of recent publications, it was made public that the group had acquired the help of two new, highly-skilled assistants. This has led fans to believe that the pace of publications will increase dramatically, though Meryll herself tried to temper fan expectations by saying that might not be the case.

1: A cybernetics manufacturer under Noxel Group that ships out everything from medical machinery to combat gear. Their name stands for the Innovative Bioengineering Company. At one point, their business was on the decline, but after changing CEOs a few years ago, they made a splendid comeback.
2: Recently, they've made huge improvements to their company image. The idol heroes they produce are particularly popular among the youth, making their brand known to the world and shooting sales through the roof. Currently, they're seeking to expand their arsenal of idol heroes to include boy groups, comedians, street performers, and other types of entertainers.

1: In Qualia City, there are heroes who also serve as idols, ready to help the minute there's trouble while wearing sponsored gear. Aside from their hero activities, they can be spotted promoting merchandise, or giving random performances in the street. More and more companies use them for advertising as of late, due to their growing popularity and social media presence.
2: Although idol heroes may always be shining while beating up the bad guy, actually being one is a lot tougher than it might seem. Many people who try to join their ranks underestimate the physical and mental demands required, eventually quitting to go back to being normal troubleshooters and heroes.

1: Properly named Idols' Fantasy Festival, this event decides who is the top among idols new to the industry. Whoever leaves an impression here usually ends up making it big.
2: The judges of the event are made up of famous people, like critics and former idols. If a judge is perceived poorly by the public, the festival tends to remove them from their position, which keeps fans quite happy. Recently, a beautiful yet strange woman with a cow was added to their ranks. How she will be perceived by the public remains to be seen.

1: The leader of a famous band of thieves, who hunted other thieves in the Kingdom of Sand. He had a habit of picking up feral strays and taking care of them, including Pharah, a thief-hunter who had been making a name for herself. Though he passed away some time ago, his name is still known throughout the land.
A former member of Aegis and Nao Nagihara's classmate. He idolizes Tohru Sengaku almost to the point of obsession.
A former member of Aegis. His childhood friend Mika, whom he values above all else, calls him Kenny-poo. After the dissolution of Aegis, Seiji Takamori asked Kenji to join him in restoring Shibuya.

A former member of Aegis. With dyed hair and a cheerful attitude, not much gets her down except gigantic rats. She has taken a liking to Seiji Takamori and affectionately calls him Teach, but the person she loves most in the world is her Kenny-poo.

A festival held in Palpebra's fifth ward every year during the New Year's holiday season. Organized by the neighborhood association, the affair isn't as grand as they would make it out to seem, but it is a staple part of the ward's annual celebrations. Thanks to Noenne's presence, however, the amount of people attending grows every year.

An independent commando unit serving under the Kingdom of Sand. Formed almost entirely of former civilians and led by the fearsome commander Haridal, they carved out a place for themselves by decimating the Golden Dawn rebels. Despite their allegiance, they wish to reform the kingdom from the inside out, in order to save the borderlands from the kingdom's oppression.
2: After the Golden Dawn was wiped out, Haridal began to work with the Starview crew in secret, exchanging information to advance the agendas of both parties. This also led to him forming working relationships with the Light of the Desert and others from his world. His network of connections has given him an edge over the political opponents trying to control him and his unit.

1:
Vampires are a legendary race spoken of in various legends, said to subsist on their victims' blood.

While vampires are widely known for their immortality and other powerful abilities, very few instances of vampire sightings have been confirmed. Some believe that the handful of vampires spotted in the past only coincidentally possessed such powers, and that their true nature remains shrouded in mystery.

The moniker used for fans of the adventurers in Palpebra's Adventurer's Guild. They sometimes refer to themselves as GMFs.

In recent days, some adventurers have become more active in the public sphere, holding performance, writing books, modeling for gravure magazines, and even holding handshake meet-and-greets. Because of this, the GMFs have grown in size and expanded the scope of their activities. Recently, they've been putting on seasonal events—which were promptly appropriated by local governments to help encourage a livelier community. Needless to say, the GMF's activities are gaining more social recognition.
2:
Some GMFs choose to express their admiration for their faves in the form of creating fan magazines and comics featuring certain adventurers.

It's also explicitly forbidden to show comics of certain conspicuous genres to the adventurer upon whom the character is based on. This rule is ironclad, and arguably makes the creative process even more fun.

One particular piece chronicling the forbidden love between two real-life adventurers is also said to be in circulation.

Comics of this kind are also distributed at expos held in Palpebra.

3:
The sword which the righteous swordswoman Rinoa bears was also revealed to have been a cryptic artifact capable of telepathic communication.

The blade's ethereal properties can be defined thusly: It bestows power to its wielder—an individual with noticeable weaknesses—and thereby bolsters both their physical and mental strength. It is speculated, however, that the artifact was designed in this way specifically to manipulate the wielder's thoughts and actions. Currently, it appears that Riona has managed to get the weapon under control.
1:
The generic term for particularly dangerous objects excavated from the Kaleidoscope.

Though the Guild attempts to keep tabs on all cryptic artifacts, in recent years there has been a surge of illegal trading. The Guild Knights have their hands full trying to expose and stop these illegal dealings.
2:
By Guild law, all items found in the Kaleidoscope must be brought in for inspection by Voluntas Academy. Even if an object is judged to be a cryptic artifact, it can still be taken home so long as it is within acceptable bounds of risk.

Those who fail to comply with this law are subject to strict punishment enforced by the Guild Knights.

1:
九尾の愛娘タマモ・イナホが
妖怪と人間との相互理解を深めるために
発案した妖怪達による演劇。
『曖昧な領域』で開催される事が主であり
劇に招かれた子供達は、夢の中の体験と
認識している場合も多い。

尚、画狂老人Zが原作提供として協力
しており、演目には『恋あず』がある。
2:
事の発端は、ヤマタノオロチ事件を契機に
人々が妖怪達を畏れ遠ざけるように
なってしまった事にある。
これに対し怒れるイナホは苛烈なる
シュプレヒコールと共に妖怪デモを断行。
結局これは逆効果であると反省に至ったが
恋あずを通して妖怪を認知していた子供の
存在を知った事から演劇という閃きを得た。

そしてこの考えは、後の妖怪図鑑の発刊へと
繋がる事となる。
3:
今や妖怪劇（および恋あず）の人気は
ワの国に留まらず、異世界へまで及んでおり
パルペブラでの興行では、渋谷の人々も含め
多くの人間に愛されているようである。

出演者は妖怪に限らず、浪人のソウシロウや
真経津鏡の化身マノカが
演者として活躍する事もあるとか。

1:
船長ゼリミールを中心に、海の世界で
あらゆる悪事を働き恐れられた海賊団。
欲望のままに全てを喰らい尽くすような
ゼリミールの苛烈な指揮は
多くのフロートに大打撃を与えた。
いよいよ陸政府軍に目をつけられると
最後は包囲攻撃によって壊滅した。
2:
陸政府軍に敗れた『暴鯨』だが
船長ゼリミールは行方知れずで
いまだ陸政府は生死さえも掴めていない。
その後、北の海に『暴鯨』を名乗る海賊団が
再度現れたが、彼らを捕らえてもやはり
その中にゼリミールの姿はなかった。

1:
剣、鏡、勾玉の三種からなる神器の総称。

天叢雲剣はムラクモとして
真経津鏡はマノカとして
人の姿で顕現している。
いずれは勾玉も見つかるかもしれない。
2:
西国出身の陰陽師スイゼンは
三種の神器の存在を以前から知っており
その上でこれを『あってはならぬもの』とし
その存在を隠すようにムラクモ達を
星見の街に預けている。
陰陽師がそれ以上を語る事はないだろう。

1: マホウタイケツニヨルフンソウカイケツノトクレイ

Regulation #17 of Voluntas Arcane Art's Academy's school code. It stipulates that, in the event of a dispute between peers, said dispute may be resolved via a magic-based duel. This regulation is as old as the school itself, and has often not only failed to end conflict, but brought about more of it. As a result, its existence is a topic of debate.

A certain group of conservative-leaning teachers and bloodthirsty students are very adamant about not abolishing the rule—much to the dissatisfaction and concern of members of the Morality Preservation Committee.
2:
Below are the four duel commandments:
- Non-magical attacks are prohibited
- No surprise attacks or cheap shots
- No involving those unrelated to the dispute at hand
- No destruction of academy property

A long time ago, a large-scale duel between the Magical Device Research Council and the Art Club broke out, and many of the above rules were broken. It was thought that both parties received suspensions for this incident, but in reality they were let off with merely a scolding. It is said that the reason for this lenient punishment was because the head of the Academy was impressed by the students' abilities. This rumor remains difficult to substantiate.

1: パルペブラノショウカイ

A union of various merchants and traders that operate in Palpebra. The majority of them amassed their wealth after the appearance of the Kaleidoscope, which they used to trade in off-world goods.

In recent years, a certain subset of these companies have begun to make use of their enormous funds to increase their influence over the upper echelon of the Adventurer's Guild.
2: These companies make use of a highly effective information network. Among these are House Magento and House Rahl, both of whom have acquired tidbits of information about Starview Village—namely that it contains a group of armed individuals who have tended to be involved in a wide array of recent incidents. While others may be wary of the Starview gang, the more enterprising merchant houses of Palpebra see this instead as an entrepreneurial opportunity to raise their profits.

1:
遂に姿を現しはじめた粛清者達。
被害の拡大を防ぐためノヴァは
『星の宮』で上位者を討つ事を提案した。

決断を迫られる一行に
迷宮から一通の招待状が届く。
2:
粛清の時は来た。

パルペブラは火に包まれ
『ランカ・ウォルンタス』が
崩れ落ちていく。

それでも、人々は抗い戦い続ける。
自由への意志『コード・ウォルンタス』が
2人の壊れた女神を導き
ついに『星の宮』へと道は開いた。

そして、決戦が始まる。

1: ギンノモリノレンゴウ

エステルリエル率いるエルフ。
エデュケウス率いる魔族。
そしてリリスが率いる、多くの獣人も含めた
人間達で構成される連合軍を指す。

粛清に備え、防衛力を高める必要のあった
パルペブラにリリスが戦力提供を約束し
引き換えにリリスはパルペブラにおける
小規模な居住地を獲得している。
2:
連合軍の協力によって得た居住地は
本来必要とする規模には遠く及ばなかったが
深淵の拡大と、それに伴う移住問題は
森の世界を新天地とする事で解決が見えた。
リリスがここで求めたのはパルペブラとの
経済関係と技術共有だったのである。

勇者の世界では移住計画に対し情報統制が
行われており、それがリリスの悩みの種と
なっていたが、ここにきて状況は大きく
前進したと言えるだろう。

1:
ノヴァ曰く
上位者が住まうとされている
星見の街の上位のレイヤーに位置する場所。

自動的に粛清者を
派兵するシステムがあるようだが
星の逆槍を使えば
その制御権を奪えるそうだ。

しかし、世界を監視する目であるステラと
星を滅ぼす剣である勇者を失った上位者が
未だ沈黙を守る理由は、不明のままである。
ニルヤーナ・ウォルンタス
ニルヤーナウォルンタス

ウォルンタス魔法学院の創立者であり
現学院長でもある、偉大なる魔女。

光魔法と闇魔法を同時に行使できる
所謂天才と呼ばれる傑物である。

しかし、教職として生徒達に
魔法原理を教える立場にありながら
実際は『6属性など存在しない』という
立場からも世界を俯瞰している人物であり
魔法原理を無視して世界を変革する
能力者に大いに興味を持っている。
2:
50年前のファーランドにて
魔導研究者だった頃の彼女を知る人物曰く
当時から全く容姿が変わっていないらしく
その素性の大部分は謎に包まれている。

一方、容姿は変わらぬが趣味や振る舞いは
よく変わるとも言われており
これは学院に通う生徒達の影響も
多分にあるらしい。
その珍妙な口調も、とある商家の女生徒から
大きな影響を受けた結果だとか……。

1: リュウミャクリュウノミチ

陰陽師達が使う陰陽道や風水術で
用いられる思想の一つであり
地の深き底に存在するとされている
星が生成する気が流れる道の事。

封印されたヤマタノオロチは
この龍脈から噴出するように現れたが
スイゼンによる『龍天の陣』により
龍脈を通り、あまねく東国の地に
その魂が解放される事となった。
2:
古龍が死した際に通る転生路や
古龍が世界を渡る際に使用する道は
この龍脈と同一のものであるらしく
ワの国だけの思想ではなく
各世界にこの概念は存在しているらしい。

1:
かつてニルヤーナとグラムが
ファーランドにて研究を行っていた際に
命題として掲げていた研究テーマ。

魔導の根源は6つの属性などではなく
『虚無』であり、その中で術師達が
自らの世界を見出し、術理として
認識しているだけだという考えであり
この原理によれば、あらゆる人間は
みな等しく『能力者』であるとも言える。
2:
しかし、ファーランドの魔法局を
始めとした魔法研究機関からは
眉唾物であると見做され続けており
魔法原理や原則が存在している事から
実例や証拠が不明瞭であると長年に渡って
虚言とされてきたが、シブヤの転移により
魔法原理を無視した力を行使する
超能力者が大量に登場した事で
再び議論の題目として討論されている。

1: ランカ・ウォルンタス

揺らぎの迷宮の大穴の上に建造された
ウォルンタス魔法学院の英知と
多くの協力者による尽力の果てに
生み出された究極の現実改変儀式機構。
その本質は、星の逆槍の権能を
拡大する事にあり、モデルとなったのは
魔界に存在し、天を貫こうとした塔
『破槍根』である。
2:
粛清者に対する結界増強機能。
地上から迷宮の底まで届く
深淵の修復機能。
上位者が座する『星の宮』まで
軍隊規模の人員と空中戦艇までも送り届ける
輸送機能が期待されたものであり
正に決戦を左右する
要となるものであった。
3:
この施設の建設にはギルドも関わっており
施設の利権をギルドにも
分譲する事によって協力を引き出し
ギルド側のドゥ・ククス
学院側のニルヤーナが中心となって
施設の建設を主導していたようである。

1:
パルペブラと融合した後に
渋谷で営業再開された
アルクが学生時代に通い詰めたカレー屋。

店長の計らいにより
行くあてのない子供達が
よく集う受け入れの場となっており
かつては日中のみの営業だったが
深夜の営業もしている。

初心者はポークがオススメ。
他にも野菜、キーマ、チキンが揃う。
2:
お手頃価格で高クオリティがモットー。
たっぷりの具材を丁寧に仕込んで
香り高いスパイスを効かせたカレーは
アルク曰く『至高』の一言。

このカレーの信奉者であるアルクにとって
具なしカレーは
あんまりな食べ物なのだそうだ。

1: オオクノテヲモツモノ

深淵の向こう側に存在するとされる
大いなる力を持つ異形の存在。

迷宮に潜む龍の力を求めており
そのための触媒としてドラゴンを歪め
『廃竜』を生み出している存在だと
グラムに推測されている。

この存在に完全浸食された粛清者には
龍の身体と共に、無数の『触手』が
発生した事が確認されている。
コード・ウォルンタス

ニルヤーナが長い時をかけて編み出し
グラムと協力する事で発動した秘儀。

世界のあらゆる事象を光と闇で
構成されていると解釈する事で
世界を書き換える力である超能力に
比類する領域までに達した
術理の最奥に位置する究極の術式である。

火薬と金属を混ぜたものに点火して
発生する音、色、形などを楽しむもの。

パルペブラにおいては
もともと花火自体は存在していたものの
ワの国から漂流してきた花火師の影響で
デザインなどのバリエーションが急増。
文化も促進されていった。
2:
パルペブラに漂流した渋谷の人々にとって
花火は楽しくも懐かしいものであった。
ハロウィンやマギア・フェスタで
打ち上げられた色とりどりの花火に
かつての故郷を想い涙する者も
少なくなかっただろう。

そんな人々の姿を見た現渋谷町長は
ワの国の花火師達と協力して
鎮魂・平和・安全祈願などの意図を込めた
大きな花火大会を検討しているようだ。

1:
美しい赤髪が自慢の少女。

元は窃盗を繰り返す不良だったが
救いと憧れをきっかけに
ギルドナイツになる事を目指しはじめた。
その焦がれる想いは
たった一人の女性に向けられている。
2:
自身と似た境遇である少年少女達との
交流が多く、その繋がりは
渋谷の子供達にも広がっている。
彼女ならではの人脈や情報網を駆使して
憧れの人を懸命に手伝う姿も。

最近はギルドナイツ入隊試験に向けての
勉強を続けているが、ケイトやミカとは
好きな人の話でつい白熱してしまうとか。

1: ギルドナイツジュンタイイン

ギルドナイツ隊員が、捜査協力者に対し
一時的に任命する特別役職。
任命された者は、与えられた職務においては
他のギルドナイツ隊員と同様に活動できる。
一方、期間は限定されており
また隊員の指示には絶対服従で
職務以外の仕事はできないなどの
制限もある。

冒険者ギルドに申請する事で
パルペブラ市民の身分を保証される制度。
漂流者など、経済的・社会的基盤のない者が
安全に生活するため必須の手続きである。

ギルドナイツ上層部の決定で
ベスタ族が派兵対象となった際
審議中も市民と同等の権利を得られる事から
フィンの提案により先んじて申請する事が
検討されていた。
2:
渋谷融合によって現れた漂流者・帰還者には
パルペブラの市民登録以外にも
渋谷側の保護を受ける道が用意された。

いずれかに身を寄せる事により
魔物や犯罪から保護対象として守られる。

一方、エイジスの残党や分派など
どちらにも所属していない者もおり
彼らの安全保障は一部で問題となっている。

1:
一般的には、夜空に浮かぶ輝く光。
天文知識的には、真空の宇宙に浮かぶ
多くの場合は、恒星。
多元世界を認識している者達には
一つの世界を指す場合もある。

魔法詠唱の文脈においては
火・水・風・雷・光・闇のどれとも異なる
大いなるものの呼びかけであり
自身の世界観を象徴するものとして
高位の術者に使われる言葉である。
2:
ある者にとって、星とは希望である。
ある者にとって、星とは抑圧の象徴である。
ある者にとって、星とは友の名である。

対象を己の内的宇宙観により観測し
その形を定め、命じる。
魔法詠唱の本質は、己の世界観の表明と
押し付けであり、その本質に迫るならば
6の属性に囚われる必要はない。
ただ、己の星に問え――

～ニルヤーナ・ウォルンタス著～

1:
ファーランドのソロン家に
伝わる剣の流派。

『二の太刀要らず』即ち、初撃をもって
敵を討つ事を至上とした流儀であり
王を狙う刺客に一切の猶予を与えぬという
近衛を務めるソロン家ならではの思想である。
故に、ソロンにおいて一の太刀を使えぬ者は
劣等の烙印を押される事になるという。
2:
このため、ソロンの中では認められなかった
ヴェロンではあったが、彼曰く

パルペブラには、一の太刀の使い手がいる。
ソロンとは縁もゆかりもない筈の昼行燈。
それがソロンの誰よりも鋭い一撃を放つ。
盗みやがったんだ！じじい共が地団駄踏むぜ！

と、愉快な酒を飲めているようである。

1:
ファーランドのサーディア家に
伝わる剣の流派。

軍を担い、ファーランドの武力の象徴を
求められるサーディア家は『最強』の座を
義務付けられた存在とも言え
騎士達にも同じものが求められる。

無論、長い歴史の中では他家の中に
強き者が現れる事も必然としてあったが
それでもサーディアはあらゆる手段をもって
『負けない事』を堅持したのである。
2:
そうしたサーディア家に現れた
歴史上においても比類無き才能は
しかし、可憐なる女子であった。

この事実は、サーディアのみならず
最強という名目と幻想を必要とした
全ての騎士達を脅かすものだった。
こうして彼女は事実上、放逐の身となったが
星の騎士を名乗る剣風の正体がなんなのかは
現サーディア当主を中心に、半ば伝説のように
語り継がれているようである。

1:
ファーランドのナインズ家に
伝わる剣の流派。

多彩なる剣術と、剣だけにも囚われない
体術や魔法をも組み込んだ流儀であり
これは警察機関として機能するナインズ家が
事態解決のためになんでも使う実践主義を
採用しているためである。
2:
ナインズ家は軍と警察機能を別つために
サーディア家から分派した家である。
そのため、九剣の源流もサーディアにあるが
実践主義を得たそれは原型を留めておらず
サーディアは『邪道』と称し
一方のナインズは『錆びた伝統』と返すという
やや険悪な関係にある。

もっともこれは『ファーランドの中では』
という注釈がつくものであり
真の意味で『なんでもあり』の集団から見れば
正に伝統的で正統的な剣だと言えるだろう。
3:
ユーウェルの使った『ナインブレイド』は
己は九剣には未だ至らず、と考えた彼が
リーブラムの使う『勝手に動く剣』をヒントに
魔法やクオリア・シティの技術も盛り込んだ
『意のままに操れる空飛ぶ剣』である。

ナインズの騎士から見ても『邪道』に外ならぬ
剣士の範疇を越えた力とも言えるが
空間を支配する事で敵を圧倒するその思想は
九剣の在り方を
さらに進化させたものでもある。

1: ファーランド魔物災害
ファーランドマモノサイガイ

ファーランド国内において大量発生した
魔物による被害を指す言葉。

この被害にあたり、当時のファーランドは
不可解なまでに対応が遅れており
これに業を煮やした若者達が自警団組織
『飛燕自由騎士団』を結成するに至ったが
紆余曲折を経て、この一団はほぼ壊滅に近い
形で解散する事ともなった。

一方『全ての元凶は揺らぎの迷宮にある』と
ファーランドはパルペブラに賠償を求め
結果として迷宮産の技術提供を受ける事となり
その後は迅速に事態を収束させている。

エイトラン家の次男にして
高位神官だが、同時に酒や女で
借金をこしらえる破戒僧。

本家と星詠みの関係について
ヴァーレインらにリークする事で
エイトランとその宗家フォーラーとの間の
因縁にまで踏み込もうとした。
オウイケイショウケン

ファーランド王国における
王位を継ぐ資格を有する者達と
その順位を指す言葉。

王族・ゼロノア家である事を必須条件に
主に血縁の近さで順位付けがされているが
順位自体は絶対のものではなく
実際の継承・戴冠にあたっては
議会の合意も必要とされている。

このため、騎士家の力は無視できる
ものではなく、王位を目指す者は
有力騎士家の後ろ盾を得て、密接な
関係を結ぶ事が常となっている。
2:
王位継承権一位は、現王の兄であり
かなりの高齢。

二位は、フォーラー家を後ろ盾に持つ
王の実子ローナイト。

三位は、先代王の弟で最も高齢であり
継承権の自主放棄が噂されている。

四位は、トゥワイサ家を後ろ盾に持つ
ローナイトの異母兄弟アースラム。

五位が、現王の弟（継承権は放棄）の
息子にあたるヴァーレインだった。

今回の魔物再来騒動を経て
フォーラー家の立場が弱体化した事を受け
ローナイトの実質順位が低下し
かたやヴァーレインの実質順位は上昇した。
3:
継承権は女性（女王）に付与される事も
認められているが、優先順位は常に低く
実質的にはほぼ無いに等しい。

しかし、その女性継承者よりも
順位が低いのが十四位のラーゼルトである。
これは彼の出生が、王の『不始末』に
よるものだからに他ならない。

とはいえ王の実子である事から
余計な野心を芽生えさせぬよう
或いは政治利用されぬよう、とある王子の
手引きにより、国外に放逐同然の身であり
諸国漫遊の旅が続いている。

1:
本名、ウィリアム。
ユーウェルの旧友にして
飛燕自由騎士団の元メンバー。

同騎士団の解散後
『今さら故郷には帰れない』として
パルペブラに居残り、八百屋を営む日々の中
ユーウェルとの再会を果たした。

異なる道を歩む事となった2人だったが
第二の人生を歩むウィルの姿は
ユーウェルに己の道を行く勇気を
確かに与える事となった。
2:
自由騎士団が再始動した後も
ウィルが再び剣を取る事はなかったが
支援物資を送るなど
陰日向からユーウェルと騎士団を
サポートし続けている。

かたや、同じ旧騎士団出身で
一度はパルペブラの商人に転身したものの
新騎士団への合流を表明した者に
肉屋のマックスやエリザらがいる。

1: シンヒエンジユウキシダン

かつてファーランド危機に際して立ち
しかし理想の中で潰えた自由騎士団
『飛燕自由騎士団』が再結成されたもの。

サーディアとナインズが手を取り合うにあたり
『主体はどちらでもなく善意の第三者である』
というお膳立てのために作られた組織である。
が、ヘクシズの資金と後ろ盾により集まった
義勇兵はパルペブラの冒険者達が主であり
星見の街の戦力もそこには含まれているため
戦力としては非常に大きなものとなった。

このため、事件解決後は即時解散となったが
星詠みの真相を追うため、ファーランドと
パルペブラの両国で、多くの協力者が
情報共有を続けているようである。

ナインズの騎士団長として
同家の軍を取りまとめている精悍な武人。
ユーウェル・ナインズの実兄にあたり
意識の高さに翻弄されがちな弟の事を
口にはしないが気にかけていた。

だが、成長した姿でファーランドに
帰還した弟の提言を受け入れ
サーディアとの連携を容認すると同時に
新飛燕自由騎士団への支援も確約した。
ヴェロンゴバンショウブ

星見の街で突発的に開催されたイベント。

ヴェロンが酒場のツケを
溜めすぎた事が発端の
アルク・プレゼンツおしおき祭り。
まさに盛りだくさんの演目だった。
2:
5番勝負の内訳は以下の通り。

1番勝負は力比べで
トーリアとのお相撲勝負。
見た目は少女のトーリアを舐めてかかった
ヴェロンはその怪力の餌食となった。

2番勝負の駆け比べは
滑空する鳥人オロウルとのスピード勝負。
全力疾走が余儀なくされる大レースだった。

3番勝負の射的比べは
バレッタ、ケイロス、メルスールら
射撃手三者との早撃ち勝負。
この戦いはヴェロンの神経を削った。

4番勝負の飲み比べは
セルジールとの酒豪対決である。
テンポよくガンガン飲んでいく酒飲み勝負は
ヴェロンがベロンベロンになるまで続いた。

そして心身ともに満身創痍になった
ヴェロンを待ち受けていた最終勝負は
シルティーとの手合わせだった。
3:
5番勝負の評判は上々で
ヴェロンのツケが溜まった折に
また開催されるかもしれない。

少し調子に乗りすぎたか
と反省に及んだアルクであったが
ヴェロンの顔を見るなり、またやってもいいと
考え直したようである。

1:
ファーランド王位継承権第二位の王子。
王の実子であり、ラーゼルトとアースラムとは
異母兄弟の関係にある。

現王と同じく
九騎士のフォーラー家が後ろ盾であるが
フォーラーの悪事が一部で知られた今では
彼らの存在が枷のようになっている。

それは公然の事実のため、一部では
ローナイトを味方として取り込もうという
動きもあるらしい。

ファーランド王位継承権第四位の王子。
トゥワイサ家を後ろ盾に持つ。

王の実子であり、ローナイトやラーゼルトとは
異母兄弟の関係にある。
ラーゼルトを兄と慕うが
王位継承権は遥かに高い。

純真無垢を絵に描いたような好人物であるが
実際、絵に描いたものに過ぎないとは
本人の弁。
