遥かな王道、継承の騎士道
ハルカナオウドウケイショウノキシドウ

母国ファーランドに、再び魔物が現れた――
報せを聞いたユーウェル・ナインズは
取り零した過去に直面せざるを得なかった。

理想を掲げ現実に負けた、飛燕自由騎士団。
また同じ事しか自分はできないのか？
それでも――と彼は剣を取り立ち上がる。
かつては無かった力と、仲間達と共に。
2:
ファーランドに再来した魔物災害は
再結成された新飛燕自由騎士団と
騎士家の活躍により終息を迎えた。

生まれや育ち、目的も違えど協力して
災害に立ち向かう人々の姿に
理想を見出した王子は
自身の憧れる飛燕の騎士と共に一歩ずつ
ゆっくりと自身の理想とする王を
目指して歩み続けるのだった。

1: シュクセイシャトウバツセン

希望を天に送り出し、残された者達は
自分達の居場所を守るべく
迫り来る粛清に一丸となって立ち向かう。

その果てに待つのは希望か絶望か。
2:
天を埋め尽くす、粛清の光。
その絶望を打ち破ったのは
大罪を負った不死王、レシタールと
真なる精霊、チャルア・チャルワ。
そして凪原ナオの、星を掴む意志の力だった。

転生を封じられた粛清者達は
もはや無限の軍にあらず。
立ち向かうは不屈の戦士達。
勝利への道が、剣撃と共に開かれていく。

1:
二度に渡ったファーランドの魔物災害において
魔物達を狂わせた元凶と思わしき存在。

魔物に寄生する触手といった形状だったが
マーデンの声に呼応したそれは、寄り合わさり
一つになっておぞましき怪物となった。

マーデンはこれを『星喰い』と呼称している。
2:
マーデンの証言によれば、星喰いという名は
オーガス・エイトランと関係の深かった
星詠みの男『プロキオ』が以前から強い関心を
示していた存在だったという。

プロキオの活動を洗う事で、エイトランと
フォーラーを追いつめる情報を得ようとした
マーデンだったが、星喰いが寄生対象に
強い力を与えるといった性質調査以上の情報は
結局得られなかったようである。

1:
ある獣人トレジャーハンターが
クリスマスの時期にサンタに扮したもの。
集めた宝を子供達に配ったり
宝探しイベントを開催したりした結果
遂には迷える者達を、救いの地に
導く事にまで至ってしまった。

図らずも『導き手』の伝説を
なぞらえてしまった彼女は
それでもこう言うだろう。

『ミアはトレジャーサンタですっ！』
2:
サンタという祝福の化身は
不毛の地、魔界には存在していなかった。
しかし――

『サンタ？知ってるよ！
赤い服を着て、モフモフの身体に
虎耳が生えてるんだよね！』

今や魔族達の間には、伝説が産まれつつある。
その姿形は、我々が知るものとは
ほんの少しだけ異なっている。

1:
東国の花街でかつて繁盛していた大見世。
建物前には二本の古い桜が植えられていた。

多くの遊女が働いており
花魁のキクノは美貌や教養も然る事ながら
なによりもその人柄で人気を集めていた。
しかし、西国との融合により
各地で発生した『神隠し』の影響で
一部の瓦礫を残し、人も建物も
全て消息不明になってしまった。
2:
長らく行方不明だったが
渋谷とパルペブラの融合から間もなく
揺らぎの迷宮内で突如発見された。

その後、内儀の判断によって
白雲楼は正式に閉店と相成った。
現在はキクノが『二代目白雲楼』の
開業に向けて動き出しているが
これには褐色の踊り子と、女達を護る
美しい戦士も協力を名乗り出ているらしい。

1:
イナホがサンタになった時に使用する
空飛ぶソリ。
聖夜の空に美しい光を走らせる姿は
地上からは彗星のように見える。
その正体は子狐達が変化した姿であり
他に天狗の団扇、火車の車輪
あかなめの舐めた板など
妖怪達の叡智と能力を結集して作られた。
2:
ある花魁が改造を施した。
新たな名は『百鬼ナインテイル号』。
鮮やかな塗装と
花を象った華美な装飾が人々の目を引く。

ワの国で『神隠し』に遭った人達が
これに乗って帰ってきた事もあり
今ではめでたいものとして扱われている。

1:
滋養強壮剤『エナジードリンク』の略。
一時的に疲れを吹き飛ばす効果があるが
飲みすぎには副作用もあるので注意が必要。

ある薬草師がエナドリを模して調合した薬が
パルペブラの一部で秘密の強壮剤として
出回っている。
効果が強すぎて破棄されたはずだが
どこからかレシピが流出したらしい。

ファーランド地方に住まう竜。
閃空竜とも呼ばれており
かつて絶大な力を誇っていた。

ファーランドのサーディア家とは
深く長い因縁があり
それは伝説として語り継がれている。
2:
サーディア家の家宝エンリルは
古の時代に同家の騎士が
閃空竜エンリルを撃退した際に
牙を奪って研ぎ鍛えたものである。

しかしその後、閃空竜エンリルは
雪辱を果たすために同家に挑み
家宝エンリルとなった我が牙を取り返した。

故にエンリルを再び手に入れる事は
サーディアにおける悲願だったのである。
3:
逸話が伝説になるほど時を経た現世にて
この悲願を叶えたのは、自身の力を
証明するために現れたサーディアの剣鬼
シルティー・サーディアだった。

更に同家次期当主シエルもこれに続き
エンリルは連続して二度の敗北を喫し
双牙を奪われてしまったのである。

文字通り牙を抜かれた閃空竜エンリルは
巣穴を引っ越して人里離れた山奥で
静かに引き籠もっているという。

1:
今はもう討滅された竜。
邪竜と呼ばれた凶悪な存在。

頭脳明晰で純粋に力も強く
人類を滅ぼさん勢いで猛威を振るい
眷属と共に村々を蹂躙して回った。

だがパルペブラが発展した事で
力をつけた冒険者達が討伐を成功させる。
その最期はかつて村を滅ぼされた
竜殺しの戦士の手によって命を散らした。
2:
滅ぼされる間際に邪竜は子種を残した。
その邪竜の子は殺処分される運命にあった。

だがニルヤーナらの思惑によって
冒険者ギルドで引き取られて育てられた。
今や邪竜の子は
冒険者ギルドのマスコットになっている。

1:
A mysterious robot that Couette met in a dream. With the help of Couette and her friends, he returned to the lab he escaped from to see Capella, the scientist who let him go. There, he learned that he was a cryptic artifact meant to seal away the ancient dragon Armadeus and prevent his rebirth.

In the end, Rooma by his own will chose to be reborn as Armadeus and disappeared into the light.
2: Under the command of the Star Augurs, Qualia City scientists created Rooma as the core of a machine that extracted and absorbed dragon energy. However, aside from Capella, none of them knew that an ancient dragon was sealed within Rooma. They were only told that a sample of a powerful dragon rested inside.
3:
Originally nothing more than a piece of equipment, Rooma was given intelligence and a personality when Capella loaded an AI unit into him.

Capella claimed that she needed Rooma to possess the ability of imagination, which only comes from having intelligence and a personality. In doing so, Rooma would be able to connect the pieces of memory that had become broken and scattered across many Curse Crystals.

None of this information is confirmed, as Capella was the only one privy to the details involving this procedure, as she alone performed it behind closed doors.

1: メイリュウアルマデウス

The ancient dragon of Darkness. Records show that he was known as the betrayer of the heavens who sided with evil and was subjugated countless times by various Champions.

He obtained a way to inherit the memories of his previous life every time he was reborn. But with every rebirth, the memories became a curse that nursed the hatred within him, turning him into a monstrous beast over time.
2:
He retained his memories by absorbing the lingering thoughts and emotions he left inside a Curse Crystal. It was a process not unlike the way the next Lord of Shadow was chosen, or how the power of the curse turned others into daemons.

At some point, the Lord of Shadow Oghir crushed his Curse Crystal into many pieces and scattered them. Capella sought to reconstruct Armadeus by gathering the shattered pieces.
3:
Armadeus, more than any other dragon, loved people. That was why, when the people of Pandemonium suffered from their barren lands and malevolence, he offered his own blood and flesh.

Not long after, the people of Pandemonium began to grow wings and horns, and their skin turned a permanent shade of blue.

1:
A Star Augur who worked as a scientist in Qualia City. Though it initially appeared that she was a good person who defied the other scientists and set Rooma free, her true goal was Armadeus' revival.

After the Dragon Eater was destroyed, she vanished.
2:
During her meeting with the Wicked Witch of the Rift, Capella called Belsidia "Luceltia" and referred to her as her sister, while Belsidia called Capella "Edea."

"Goodbye, Sister. Be wary of the curse of the sword."
3:
After investigating the biological tissue Capella left behind, the Starview crew learned that her real name was Maiko Warren. She was a professional gamer who had no history of being interested in biomechanics or research into other worlds.

Guild Knight Finn suggested that Maiko might have been fitted with a cryptic artifact that allowed the Grand Creator to control her.
4:
The man that attacked Stella was the Grand Creator. Despite being in a different body, the man was undoubtedly also Capella.

It seemed that cryptic artifacts allowed Capella to occupy different minds. Perhaps it wouldn't even be a stretch to say that Capella's existence was comprised of cryptic artifacts.

Breaking the cryptic artifact on a possessed person erases all memory of their time under Capella's control.

1: A crystal often seen in Pandemonium. Originally nothing more than a curious mineral that changed structure in response to people's thoughts and emotions, someone discovered that carving the curse into them would allow them to be used for other purposes.
2: Armadeus carved a crystal with his own curse, leaving his memories behind so that he could retrieve them after every rebirth.

1:
A machine used to seal something away.

Capella explained that Rooma was one such device, meant to seal away Armadeus, the dragon of darkness.
2: However, Capella's explanation was a lie. Rooma's true function was that of a container, given intelligence and a personality in order to revive Armadeus.

1: Dragon genes carry with them the power of dragons. According to Capella, different samples have differing concentration of said genes, though the exact details are unclear.
An evil power that the fiends wield, at least according to Light.
2:
In reality, the curse is made up of the lingering negative thoughts and emotions of the dead.

It served as the source of Lord Oghir's immortality, as the Lord of Shadow can use his connection to the underworld to limitlessly draw power from the curse.
3: The curse also served as a source of nourishment for the fiends. In the malevolence-filled world of Pandemonium, they had no other choice but to feed on the dead in order to survive.

1:
Among Lilith's many ancestors, one Edea Stratos in particular was hailed as a great and wise king.

Devoted to gathering knowledge, this king contributed greatly to the development of conference magic and other magical techniques. However, in the later years of their life, a certain madness colored their actions as they began to seek a way to obtain eternal life.
2: The Library of Luceltia, a building that still stands today, was founded by King Edea. According to historical records, this library was named after King Edea's elder sister, who was a brilliant witch that unfortunately passed away in her youth.

1: ルセルティアノショコ

An enormous library founded by King Edea. It has an entire section devoted to legends of the Champions.

Few have visited this library, due to the ravages of the long war. Lilith herself only recently stepped foot in its halls.

A mysterious curse that Capella spoke of, but never elaborated on.

During the events inside the lab, Capella instructed Alk to kill Rooma with the sword in his possession.

A secret code that the Crimson Blade pirates have sworn amongst themselves. The code itself contains over a thousand pledges.

The one cited the most is "treat the captain as our leader and not as our woman." Without this pledge, many of these pirates would be unable to control their emotions.

Occasionally, their resolve cracks, and some will approach their captain seeking marriage, testing the limits of the code... but in the end, the code is absolute.
2:
"Keep your heart steady when you accidentally meet the captain's eyes."

"Sharing a glass with the captain is just that—sharing a glass and nothing else."

"If the captain gets a little touchy, remember your mama back home and calm yourself down."

"Everyone stans the captain differently. Let them."

These are a few such pledges in the code. Some are too obscene to be written down.
3:
Until the code was formed, many unfortunate incidents happened—some of which are still whispered about to this day.

"I heard the first mate lost his mind and tried to hog Marina to himself, so he ditched all the other crew members on an island and sailed away with her."

"I heard some of the crew fought over Marina for three days straight. Almost did the Crimson Blades in, they did."

Regardless of how absurd each story sounds, the truth of the matter is the code keeps the pirates safe from both themselves and their fellow crewmates.
4:
Through sweat and tears, the code was created so that all crew members could enjoy a fair and equal standing with their captain.

However, the code might not last much longer if their captain keeps putting on swimsuits and sci-fi skintight suits...

1: ブリョクシュウダンホシミノマチシュウ

A group of elite combat specialists from Starview, handpicked by Marina for an especially tough mission.

They are capable of fighting at both close and long range, utilizing anything from magic to their bare hands. Anyone who tries to stand in their way won't be standing for long.
2:
Marina claimed that she chose members based on how "down they looked to commit a crime." Put another way, she chose people based on how likely they would be to solve a problem through force.

When thinking of powerful people, the first ones that came to mind were a certain Palpebran maid and a one-eyed sniper, but the list eventually expanded from there. The assembled team would be able to take control of any battlefield in an instant.

Obviously, gathering such a large military force was going to cause a few issues. However, as merely the gatherer of the chess pieces, Marina never intended to take responsibility for any of it.
3:
"I'm the only one qualified to be captain of a crew as rowdy as this one," Marina decisively stated.

Suizen and Alk were there for support, while Keira and Quade facilitated matters.

The infiltration team was comprised of Amelia, Hayz, and Cipher. They were the liveliest of the bunch.

"No foe is a match for me, the Magnificent Witch!" - Cipher
4:
For extra suppressing power, Marina put Selgir and Marianne on a team together. They embodied the phrase, "professionals get the job done."

"Locked and loaded. Time to get to work." - Selgir

For the last team, Marina had Asukirimaru, Alice, Zantetsu, and Mia (for some reason) do the raiding.

"Why am I on a team full of weirdos?!" - Mia

1: コウソクキドウセンテイシュルト

A flying ship that uses the ancient dragon Schult as its core. Constructed with the best technology that Qualia City has to offer, its power transmission is a combination of magic and wind power.

The Starview Village Squad traveled through the skies on the Sky Destroyer Schult.
2:
Though Love was initially reluctant to take on this order, she eventually relented and ordered the ship to be built.

"Well, I want it to fly and be big enough to live on. Oh, and it's gotta be strong. And capable of space travel."

When concerns over the engine's output arose, the ancient dragon Schult was more than happy to offer his assistance and escape the monotony of his daily life. The ship is also equipped with the ultimate antiaircraft weapon—Rams Euphoria.

Unfortunately, it isn't capable of space travel.

1:
Capella's homemade, mechanical imitation of a Champion. It functions similarly to a Champion in that it can absorb the power of ancient dragons and unleash Meteor Breaks.

"Stars above. Turn your cold countenances. Upon the creatures below. Who beg scraps. Of your heavenly light. Fall! Together! With this world!"
ヒカリノユウシャデンセツ

A collection of books passed down in the Home of the Champions that detail the conquests of the Champions of Light. The collection is so large that only a custom-made bookshelf is large enough to hold them all.

Each Champion's struggles against the fiends is recorded in fine detail. However, very little is written about their lives after they departed the battlefield.
コイオオキルフレクス

A famous author from the Home of the Champions who made a name for himself by penning everything from picture books to stage plays. He wrote mostly of romance. Lilith read many of his books as a child.

His name is suspiciously close to that of Champion Claire, who left a record of his adventures in Starview's library.

Just as his title implies, Clarence had a number of lovers, resulting in many disputes and illegitimate children. It's said that he passed away with a smile on his face, having lived a full life.
2:
His debut work, "The Adventures of Claire," is about a young man who falls in love with a fairy princess incapable of smiling. Claire receives a sword from the princess, but he is able to make her wish come true without using it.

Unlike Clarence's later works, this story ends on a bittersweet note, with Claire returning home without confessing his love.

1:
The empty space outside Shibuya.

Alk and friends had come into contact with it through the Rift before. But to Seiji Takamori, simply looking at it was enough to send him into a state of panic.

When Nao Nagihara was sucked into it, she began to lose her sense of self and started to melt away.
2:
Separated from the rest of the world, Shibuya was nothing more than floating debris in the Void.

Time passed differently there. Three months in Shibuya was equivalent to 10,000 years in another world.

People who are caught in a shift in the Kaleidoscope and make it back home recount experiencing a similar sort of time compression phenomenon.
3:
According to some magical theorists (especially those who utilize the ever unpopular Dark element magic), worlds are formed above the Void.

The Church of Farlana heavily denies this theory, as it goes against the tenets of their faith.

1:
A mysterious figure who lurks in the shadows and somehow possesses the knowledge of cryptic artifact creation.

Both their true identity and activities are shrouded in mystery. Rumor has it that they teach others how to create cryptic artifacts, as well as put their creations on the black market for sale. What their true aim is, no one can say.
2:
Many of the Grand Creator's supposed creations tend to mentally affect those that possess them. Among such creations are a gun that uses hatred as ammunition, a knife that gathers the lingering thoughts of the dead, a talking shield that analyzes the battlefield, and a sentient suit of armor that bestows great power to its wearer.

However, there are many artifacts that are mere imitations of the Grand Creator's works, so it is difficult to tell what is and isn't a genuine article.
3:
The true identity of the Grand Creator was revealed to be Capella, a scientist and a Star Augur.

Utilizing special cryptic artifacts, Capella can leech onto another person's body and control their actions. If caught, the artifact can self-destruct, freeing the host from Capella's control and allowing Capella to escape without ever revealing their true identity or giving out more information.

Capella's latest victim, a man without memory of his time under control, was left with a strange tattoo on his arm when his cryptic artifact broke.

1: An Umamusume from a faraway world. Seen as a prodigy who's always ahead of the pack, both figuratively and literally, she gets caught in her thoughts easily, coming off as distant, but dedicated. Shy as she is, Suzuka's been warming up to her roommate, Special Week.

A bright and energetic Umamusume who came from a distant world. She left her hometown and transferred to Tracen Academy with dreams of becoming Japan's top racer. While she is frequently met with disappointment in chasing her dream, she is naturally courageous and never stops running toward her goal!

A wildcard with pranks for every occasion. Her infectious humor will have complete strangers feeling like they've known her forever, but... once she's gone, you can't help but wonder: were the antics just an act, or is she ALWAYS like that?

As wielder of the freezing power of the Oculus, a visiting researcher and instructor at Voluntas Academy, and the most desired dance partner for the Academy's holiday party among the female students. With such accolades, Reylas is certainly no longer alone.

A beastfolk girl who once belonged to a special forces unit of the Gaean Navy. Though raised to be a tool of the military, she becomes familiar with love after Alk and the others welcome her into Starview Village. Wanting to bring smiles to children, Fluffy decides to take on the role of Santa Claus.

A mischievous fiend jester who plays around with the fine line between fact and fiction. As part of one of her pranks, she dons a festive outfit for the holidays. A certain young man in search of answers, however, continues to glare daggers at her.

Many years ago, a young boy quivered at the thought of hurting others, quietly nursing the injuries all over his body. But now he no longer fears the strength of his claws and fangs. He resolves to become even stronger, so that no one else will suffer like he had.
2:
Thanks to two skilled martial artists, Nimbus awakened a new power within himself—only to lose the majority of it within days. However, having grasped the power once, he knew he could find it again.

The martial artists admonished him for many hours, but agreed to help him build his strength again, if only so they could fight him for their own training.

In the end, this new power was enough to fell even the might of a dragon.

1: Once feared as the "Ice Queen" and the "Scourge of the Seas," everything changed when Cipher was recognized for her talent by Voluntas Arcane Arts Academy and invited to be a guest mage at the school. Obtaining a new outfit from the Academy, she has now added the moniker of "Magnificent Witch" to her ever growing list of titles.
2:
After treasure hunting with the Crimson Blades, confronting a protective dragon, and struggling against the evil lurking in the shadows of Qualia City, her life as the "Scourge of the Seas" is nothing but an old memory. The Magnificent Witch Cipher now walks a new path.

If only she could have shown a certain someone the way she shined during that whole adventure.

"A special assignment? From Professor Leleni? Due today?! I... need your help, Rei..."

"You're helpless, Ciph. You know that?"

1: A beastfolk lady that joined the Fellowship of Floof as a nurse. Though she's a little naive, her heart is always in the right place. She spends her days constantly trying to improve, in order to become a nurse capable of helping anyone in need.

An informant who lurks in the shadows of Palpebra. Afflicted by a curse, he can now hear the lingering thoughts and emotions of the dead. However, being as calculating and cunning as he is, he has somehow turned this curse into profit.
2:
"Nah... It's just... What are you doing here?"

How mean. And to think this boy was kind enough to deliver a letter for 100G.

He's surrounded by powerful people who aren't drunk on power, but instead use it to accomplish their goals. He doesn't hate their straightforward honesty... He's even grown to value their company.

But now that his job's done, he should leave before that shady spy comes—

"You've certainly gotten worse at hiding since we last met."

Oh, this is just the worst! Or... perhaps this could be a business opportunity? Regret comes quickly as he looks to his allies for help.

1: Once a citizen of Shinjuku, this woman was transported to a land of water and became a pirate. Out of all the treasures she's set her sights on, two shine especially bright—And in order to stay by their sides, she needs more power.
2:
As she declares their ship's next destination is space, her crew groans and asks why they aren't looking for her hometown. She laughs before insisting they can do that anytime.

But unfortunately, she knows the truth. The Shinjuku she knows is gone.

But that's fine. Her future now contains nothing but the stars above. However, before she takes off, she's gotta help her two treasures take down the gods. And she's already taking steps to make that happen.

1: A catfolk girl with unusual talent among mages. She has recently joined the Diviners' Commission in order to get a better handle on her ever-increasing powers. She enjoys her studies.
2:
This girl studies day after day. She learns about the nature of her own power, the fundamental laws of the stars and the universe itself, and how to walk alone in the darkness. Couette still struggles to express herself, much to the amusement of others. Ever-curious and in good spirits, she walks along in life taking whatever detour pleases her fancy.

Couette is determined to be the best mage there ever was, and to reunite with a dear friend from her dreams once more—and, of course, to see the look on their face.

1: For a long time, this girl simply observed all the worlds from a distance, but everything changed the day the stars fell and she gained a heart. From learning the gentle warmth of the sun and receiving advice from a blade stained crimson, her various experiences have since taught her what it is to dream of a wish her heart makes.
A violinist who has fully remembered her love of music and is highly anticipating her first Halloween. With Carol and her new friends, this girl plays music with deep joy in her heart.

The former CEO of DayAndNight, a company tied to the larger Noxel Group. She gave up the seat of absolute authority in order to better understand herself and the world around her. During a research trip into Palpebra, she puts on a stylishly dark reaper outfit.

A shy spearwoman who was trained by a formidable master. Though she used to be unable to look others in the eye, she has since overcome that obstacle. For Halloween, she puts on a costume and takes on a job to patrol the streets.

After passing his exam and becoming a sublieutenant of the Gaean Navy, Rain is now doing his best to climb the ranks. Determined to put his heart into everything he does, Rain naturally charms everyone around him.

A fifteen-year-old third-year middle school student and Alk's little sister.

When she touched the Void, she began to disappear, but luckily, she was able to reconstruct herself, gaining powers in the process.

She may seem more naive and reckless than her brother, but according to Nimbus, the two are practically twins in terms of personality.
2:
笑顔を絶やさないと、それだけを考えて
泣く事を許さなかった日々があった。
それなのに、あの時から私は泣いてばかりだ。

悔しい。
思い返すと、あれもこれも、全部全部悔しい。
泣けない私のそばにずっと居てくれた
空気の読めない某先輩。
別によくない？と笑ってくれた憧れの人。
二人が倒れて、それでも、私は泣いてるだけ？

だから決めたのだ。私も戦う。もう泣かない。
自分の願いを、自分で掴み取るんだと！

見てろよ！！凪原アユムとかいうやつ！！！

1: Seventeen-year-old Yuki Mishima was a second-year high school student when her town became trapped and she gained powers. Though others see her as an aloof beauty, her two closest friends know what she looks like when she smiles without a care in the world.
2:
Both in the past and present, she can often be seen hanging out with Ayumu and Shota.

However, there was a time when she thought the three of them would never be reunited, so she sought to be more open going forward. In the end, Ayumu returned and the trio's friendship was restored. However, she still intends on being more honest with her friends. She never wants to leave anything unsaid again, especially her gratitude.

1: A sixteen-year-old second-year high school student who has yet to realize his own strengths. He fears the changes to the world and people around him.
2:
As Shota zoomed up the side of the building, the two things he felt were adrenaline... and fear.

What should he say? How will they respond? No matter how much he prepares, the words that come out of his mouth are always clumsy. Yet even as harsh words tumbled out of his mouth, Alk was able to see past that and confirm his true desire—to fight alongside him.

1: A fifteen-year-old third-year middle school student and former member of Aegis. Her ability to control others through words matches her sharp tongue. She has a particularly strong dislike of a certain pretty girl from Shibuya.
2:
Another boring talk with cringey loners she doesn't even like. They're the absolute worst, but what else can she do? Everywhere else is the same.

But even without a place to call home, the world continues on... Which means she still has to deal with the world's most annoying heroine!

1: A thirty-four-year-old middle school teacher who closed off his heart to his students, even when their eyes pleaded for his aid. It took the world ending for him to realize the extent of the excuses he gave himself.
2:
While it would be nice to say that his resolve was what brought about the change in him, that would be a lie.

As the sky distorted and the clouds parted ways, his legs couldn't help but tremble at the sight of a giant eye staring back at him. But when he saw Shota, the shaking stopped. It was time to make things right.

1: A young boy Alk met at a park back when he was still Ayumu. His pale skin, silver hair, and starry eyes greatly resemble those of Stella, Leve, and Nova.
2:
Proclaimed a miracle by the Starsayers, he was the first person in Shibuya to gain powers. Compared to the others that came later, his powers were rather weak, but they were more than enough to twist his fate.

After wishing to see a world where he doesn't exist, this tragic child disappeared into the light.

1: The leader of the Starsayers. She possesses the power of clairvoyance. Though she does her best to guide the lost souls who seek her aid, on the inside, she knows it is all for naught. As she continues to dirty her hands to provide others with false hope, her own soul cries out in despair.
2:
As a child, Sakuya Shizutani was forced to be Mikoto Hoshino's playmate as a way to appease him. Her lack of agency over her own fate, especially in the face of her devout Starsayer father, caused Mikoto to pity her and bestow her with power.

However, this power became a new source of despair for her when it made clear the end of the world.

1: Alk's identity before losing his memories. When he was young, he was skilled at talking with others and making friends, but once he hit middle school, he became discontent with himself and his surroundings. These feelings were only exacerbated by a fateful encounter at a park one night.
2: The shining light that finally broke through the gloom hanging over Ayumu's head was an awkward boy who couldn't read the room if he tried. As he continued on into high school, Ayumu eventually remembered how to smile, but deep in his heart, he never forgot that night in the park.
3: One day, Shibuya was enveloped in light and cut off from the rest of the world. That same day, Ayumu Nagihara was carried off by the torrent of light and dissolved into the Rift. His shadow lingered for a time, drifting around the city, before a large piece broke free. This piece, guided by a strange voice, soon found itself falling from the sky toward its new home.

1: A twenty-year-old who sought to lead a good, honest life in order to protect his sister. His plans came crumbling down when the city fell into chaos and his brother's accursed legacy forced him down a similar path. His wish, however, remains unchanged, and he will do whatever it takes to make it happen.
2:
Even with all the resources at his hands, Tohru knew making his wish come true wasn't going to be easy. However, he never expected to lose to such a naive group.

In the end, however, his wish did come true, although not in the way he expected. Now he just needs to settle his affairs and leave his sister to live her life... So why can't he get those naive losers off his mind?

1: A young boy who wields a magic rifle and has the ability to understand animals. He comes to Palpebra in search of clues regarding those who killed his beloved dog Rufo.
A naval officer in the Gaean Navy and captain of the battleship Blaue Fraxis. Pirates across the Endless Blue quake in fear at the mere mention of her ship. She also claims to be Marina's rival.

A seventeen-year-old second-year high school student and former member of Aegis. His powers allow him to control shadowy dragonlings. While he tends to look down on others, this does nothing to get rid of his own sense of inferiority.
2:
It should have been an easy victory. Yet that tiger—that uncultured, uneducated tiger—still managed to beat Ryuichi with a sneer on his face.

"Dragonlings, envelop."

Even now, Ryuichi boils with rage. In order to make sure no one ever laughs at him again, he declares he will grow stronger.

1: A mysterious boy who alights in Starview Village. He has no memory of his past or the world he is from, and he is eager for new knowledge. He is cheery and, oddly enough, a marvelous chef.
2: His real name is Ayumu Nagihara, and he was a normal second-year high school student before Shibuya was separated from the rest of the world and swallowed up by the Rift. It was then that he lost his memories and arrived in Starview Village.
3: Even now, he is unsure whether he is a fragment of Ayumu or simply a shadow of who he was. But in reclaiming his memories, he has learned one definitive truth—he is Nao Nagihara's brother, and nothing will change that.

1: A rugged tiger from a world with no other beastfolk. All he had to trust were his own two fists—until he befriended a young lord named Rolan.
A dragon who has lived for many lives of humans and speaks the tongues of many creatures. He bears little respect for mortals—save for a champion named Light, who once engaged him in deadly combat.
The pirate captain of the Crimson Blades. Some may see her as crass and arrogant, but her carefree lifestyle and personality have stolen the hearts of many a seafarer.
2: This pirate freely sails the seas. She didn't have time to say goodbye to her old world, but somehow she doesn't miss it either. She took her first step on a new journey alongside a boy, a girl, and two young men.

1: Although the blood of the founders of alchemy course through her veins, all this happy-go-lucky alchemist wants to do is forget about her problems and have a good time.
A young woman who works at the Maids' Parlor. Capable of handling everything from cleaning to combat, Marianne finds herself dressing up for a special mission this time around.

A powerful vocalist, Noenne formed a group with Catherine, a ghost, and Kapipi, a capybara, to represent Littleton in the world idol competition. Though they lost, she vowed to make a comeback and now travels with Alk and company on a new journey.
Once an entertainer in the Hanamachi district of Yamato. Years ago, her home vanished—she's been wandering in search of it ever since.
The greatest and most fearsome knight of the Canid kingdom. He fights by decree of the dog king, achieving many feats of valor for the crown.

Taking a vacation with Alk and friends to beautiful beaches and blue waters, Mia keeps her ears on the ground and leaps at any chance to go treasure hunting, whether it be at the bottom of the ocean or on top of a ghost ship.
2: She insists she's just a treasure hunter, but this time she stole genome quartz and attacked pirate ships exactly like a thief. She's still unwilling to accept being called such, however.

1: A young kunoichi with a love of fireworks and explosives. In order to fulfill a certain promise, she's willing to don a dress and even transcend worlds.
2: Dealing with troublesome dragons, teaching a lesson to their leader, and helping out a lost girl in need, Hanabi's efforts all paid off as she fulfilled a promise to a friend at the festival.

1: A somewhat domineering summoner who has a strong dislike for kids and the holidays. Due to popular demand, she is tasked with handing out presents as Santa—and learns a bit more about herself in the process.
The first princess of a small nation that lies between Palpebra and the Farlands. Immensely powerful, but somewhat lacking in common sense, she has come to conquer Palpebra.

Captain of the Fellowship of Floof, a crew of physicians that sails the seas giving aid to everyone, regardless of who they are. He works tirelessly to make his ideal world—one free from pain and suffering—a reality.

During a trip to Palpebra, the diviner prodigy puts on a snazzy new outfit for White Fest. Though his customer service smile may seem plastered on, behind it lies a sincere desire to repay those who have treated him kindly.

A young spy with strong ties to the Guild High Council and the Guild Knights Captain. Though highly talented, he has a reckless side—even having his true identity uncovered by his enemy doesn't faze him.

A spear user from another world who belongs to an organization known as the Society. Boisterous and sharp-tongued, she stands by her friends through thick and thin. Her Spear of Arvess grows more powerful in proportion to the level of emotion she feels.
Heir to the Felders, a line of neutral arbiters who keep the Endless Blue in order. She tries to put on a tough front but worries if she's really got what it takes.

The undefeated champion of Palpebra's Platinum Legends. 

Whether she's at her home coliseum or on vacation at an otherworldly beach, her star power shines bright.
A dancer from a traveling troupe. All who behold Sonia are swept away by her grace and beauty. She journeys in pursuit of a dream, which once she shared with a childhood friend.
The prodigious chair of the Diviners' Commission. He's proven himself a solid strategist despite his young age, commanding both respect and fear.
2: Suizen let out a laugh in his room early one morning without anyone there to hear it. Without leaving any evidence behind, Suizen had broken the seal on his world. Rough times awaited him, a situation too difficult to handle alone. But now, to his delight, there was no need to do it all by himself.

1: A spunky adventurer determined to conquer the Kaleidoscope in record time. Inspired by her new Yamato get-up, she vows to spread its traditional culture to Palpebra.
A mysterious witch with the ability to manipulate space and time with her icy magic. Feared by pirates all across the ocean, she is known by some as the "Ice Queen" or the "Scourge of the Seas".
Colonel of Gaea, which rules what little land is left in Endless Blue. Widely admired for her wit and backbone.
A spear-fighter whom family tradition designated Guardian of the Dragons. He is an incorrigible Casanova, but there is no one in any world he loves more than his sister.

A wayfarer who traverses the desert's borderlands, Rakisha wields an ancient brush that can direct the course of water. She is troubled by the portent of war between the borderlands and royal family, and rues that her powers alone are not enough to stem the flood of violence.
A prince of the Farlands who's recently taken up surfing to train his body and further bolster his ability to protect the citizenry. He uses his beloved shield, Lord's Aegis, to ride the waves.
2: Valiantly gambled all of his money away at the casino on Paradise Isle. Afterward, he used the power of Lord's Aegis to prove himself capable of protecting Alice, at the expense of his own buoyancy.

1: A member of Franchouchou, the idol group comprised of zombies hailing from Saga. She's got talent, but her journey to becoming a top idol is often impeded by unlucky situations. Still, no matter how bad things get, she always finds a way to overcome every challenge.
A young man who bears the Glacial Oculus, a magical eye capable of freezing anything. The power in his left eye, however, has been stolen, and he arrives in Palpebra in pursuit of the culprit.

A young half elf with gorgeous silver hair. Due to her kindhearted nature, she is unable to leave those in trouble alone, which led her to helping Subaru after he was suddenly transported to the Kingdom of Lugunica. The two have since developed a close relationship.

A girl who works as a maid with her older twin sister Ram in the Kingdom of Lugunica. Despite her dainty appearance, she is an extremely capable fighter due to her demon powers. She loves Subaru with all her heart, and will prioritize him over all else.

This martial artist has chosen to discard her humanity in pursuit of ultimate power, determined to transcend her mortal limits. Only the contracts she forms with her employers, usually criminals of the underworld, still bind her to the rules of society.
A commander in the Kingdom of Sand's military with a talent for swords. He may seem cold and emotionless at a glance, but in his heart, he works to uphold an oath he swore to a dear friend.
2: "Nothing is borne without sacrifice." It was for the sake of their ideals that they went their separate ways. Haridal carries on, his friend living on in him as he upholds their new oath.

1: In the deep, dark depths of the northern seas sleeps a treasure that surpasses all human knowledge... That treasure is snatched up by this little mermaid, who uses it to grow a pair of legs and lead her friends to new horizons!
A healer in charge of a Float in the Endless Blue. Her warm, loving nature endears her to all, and her former pupils now serve in many high-ranking positions, making her a true mother of the seas.
For centuries, mortals feared the nine-tailed queen of yokai. Her daughter Inaho, on the other hand, is known as a friendly goofball who likes snacks and girly manga.
2: Inaho once said that sharing your dreams with others is not such a difficult task. But is this really true? What dream was she even talking about? This fox struggles with these questions and wonders what it was that she was so worried about. She hasn't forgotten, however, and the answer to her question lies a little further in her future.

1: The founder of alchemy, born many eras ago and many worlds away. Cagliostro acts (and is) quite full of herself, but she still cares deeply for her friends.
A lordless samurai who runs a study hall on the outskirts of town. Inspired by Palpebra's spirit of giving, Soushiro strives to make all the little ones' season bright.
A famed adventurer who enjoys the finer things in life, pursuing a life of extravagance from one adventure to the next.
A brawler who made a name for himself in the Endless Blue. Though he fights to become ever stronger, rumors about his otherworldly origins overshadow his lofty ambitions.

An android who is the First Commander of the Aegis Squadron, a group styling themselves to be guardians of law and order. Her human-like body is said to have been a gift from the Administrator herself.
A pyrotechnician from Yamato with a workshop deep in the mountains. She travels all across the world seeking to create a spectacular fireworks display the likes of which no one has seen before!

To blue waters and sunny beaches she goes, ready to make the most of her vacation. But, forever an entertainer at heart, she finds herself casting a few illusions to make sure everyone else is having fun too.
2: Even on Paradise Isle, her magic proved to be immensely helpful. Using her illusions at the casino to cheat at the slots, and later using them to dispel the effects of an elemental grenade, her powers are as versatile as they are powerful.

1: A witch who possesses the extraordinary power of leaping to different worlds. Once a villain and distrusted by Light to this day, even she can feel the sting of loneliness from being left behind...
2: Her world-hopping powers were key in aiding Alk and the others during their time on Paradise Isle. After a timely rescue, Belsidia pursued Adala to unleash a punishing heap of magic on her, showing what happens to those who mess with her Alky-Walky.

1: A gentlebot who has donned a brand-new outfit for the festivities in Palpebra. Underneath that pristine white tuxedo, he's no doubt up to something sinister—or is he?

Representing her home country of Oxton in the BRASS, Beaucy is a gravure idol contracted with Cosmic Beast Cacow. Filled with strong opinions about idols, she isn't afraid to speak her mind about them. She finds herself in Starview Village after pursuing Noenne.

A young girl who is protected by a mysterious entity from the depths of the ocean—which also eerily resembles a stuffed toy given to her by her dad. Never letting the toy leave her side, she has the tendency to talk to it as if it were a real person.
A combat specialist working full-time for 3MM Security. Chief of the Special Equipment Defense Force at only seventeen, she spends her days cheerfully getting work done with her three subordinates.

An eccentric android who styles himself as a ninja samurai—and warrior of justice. Though his real name is Code Cracker, he goes by the alias Zantetsu. He vows to eliminate evil—all while maintaining his elaborate ninja samurai performance.
A thrill-seeking treasure hunter from the Endless Blue. Other treasure hunters and pirates know him as the "Thrill Seeker."

Though she can no longer return to the place she called home, the former commander of the Aegis Squadron rescued her dear friend. Now, she finds herself confronting a new task: how to partake in a "vacation" with Stella and her friends.

A troubleshooter who lives life on her own terms. While she appears to be a loose cannon at first glance, she is actually a brilliant ex-engineer whose destructive impulses are guided by precise calculations.

The young leader of the Vesta—a people possessing the power to communicate thoughts and read minds with their Spirit Horns. Before, their nomadic lifestyle and uneasy relationship with humans were all they knew, but everything changed when the stars fell from the sky.
2:
To the Vesta, a person's Oudo tells them far more than words or expressions ever could, but it doesn't come without its risks. Fully utilizing one's Spirit Horns to read another's Oudo risks permanently changing oneself.

When the stars fell from the sky, Memram felt an Oudo filled with kindness, strength, and sorrow. These emotions seeped deeply into her, changing her from her core.

1: A shield-maiden born with the strength of a god. She likes nothing more than a friendly joust, but to her dismay, even allies will flee before her sword.
An oracle who emerges shaken from the World Flipper, as if pursued by some great evil. She is a great sorceress of the wind but possesses a bleeding heart.
The spirit of an ancient blade swallowed by Orochi. After escaping the serpent's belly, he slowly pieces together fragmented memories of the person who last wielded him.
A seasoned veteran of the Kaleidoscope, whose reputation as an adventurer precedes him. Only a few have explored the depths as he has and have lived to tell the tale.
A priestess from a faraway tribe that follows the teachings of the sprites. As the daughter of the chief, she has come to Palpebra in search of a husband.

An adventurer who serves as a diplomat for the Adventurer's Guild and receives orders from its top brass. With his magical teapot, he flies from place to place to fulfill the essential duties entrusted to him.
A young elf who hails from a faraway world. She is a member of the Gourmet Guild, and proudly serves as a guide to her lord.

A great wind dragon feared by commonfolk. Though he was once known as the Gale of Calamity, he has proved to have a gentle heart, saving the lives of sacrifices offered in his name. He is said to hail from another world.

Leader of Franchouchou, the idol group comprised of zombies hailing from Saga. She was once the legendary biker boss and founder of Dorami, an all-ladies group that aimed to take over Kyushu. Though she's a bit on the rough side, her compassion is second to none, and she would never abandon a friend in need.
One of the high elves—a race possessing eternal life and myriad powers, unlike regular elves. Despite being only 13 years old, she has complete control over the Silver Woods, with none to oppose her.
2:
What makes a king? Is it to make the world your kingdom and bend all to your ideals? Or does that simply make you a warrior like any other, fighting for what you believe in? Whatever your answer, it matters not, for it is your strength of spirit that I adore.

King of Man. You are weak, and one day you will be frail with age. But until the day you fade away, I shall remain at your side.

1: A prodigy so skilled with the blade that she puts other knights to shame, or so some have claimed. Whereas her smile once concealed a hidden sadness, the winds of change have brought her a renewed sense of purpose.
2:
No longer the cold, heartless girl attempting to hone herself into the perfect weapon, she cut through the skies like the wind and kept the people of Palpebra safe from harm.

"Now then, Sir Alk! Care to spar with me?"

1: In order to keep a low profile and hide from her pursuers, Suzuka dons a disguise to attend a New Year's celebration, even if her "disguise" is just a kimono. Despite her glamorous new look, she's still the same old disaster on the inside.

A beastfolk girl who once belonged to a special forces unit in the Gaean Royal Navy. While a genius at close combat, she's only ever known life as a soldier, so many of her days are filled with confusion.
No matter where she goes, all who behold this dancer are blown away by her beauty and grace. She returns to the Kingdom of Sand, grappling with the feelings she has for her childhood friend.
2: This dancer chooses to forge onward. Even if she sees those in love being torn apart or her closest friend refuses to acknowledge that day on the stage, Sonia will keep moving her feet to the rhythm of her heart.

1: A catfolk sage known as the Sharp-Eyed Sage. After foreseeing a bleak future, she called for the end of the war between dogfolk and catfolk, but the people rejected her. She chose to retreat from the world after that.
On a whim, the elf princess dons a mortal outfit and visits a field of sunflowers. Despite her smile, her gaze remains sharp as she takes in newfound experiences.
A tengu who lives on a sacred mountain in Yamato. Feared for his tremendous power and mercilessness, he is kind only to his disciple. He loves drinking sake of all kinds.
A devout priestess of the sprites. Wishing to marry Alk because of a prophecy, she spends this vacation scheming to grow closer to him.
2: The choice made by unwavering conviction brought change and color to her world. Bewildered by newfound feelings, she pushed past her uncertainty and took her first flight through new skies on impassioned wings.

1:
An exceptionally talented adventurer from Palpebra. 

Taking a well-deserved break from adventuring in the Kaleidoscope, he arrives in Yamato and dons a festive yukata.
Great ruins lie half-sunken in sand; within, a girl wakes from a long slumber. She is master of the Alter Device and commands enough power to destroy all creation.

A prince of the Farlands. He has journeyed far afield to learn about the world, bringing only an old retainer. Though the blood of kings runs in his veins, he is quite far down in the line of succession. Admittedly, he loves himself a little too much, but he loves his people more.
A colliseum fighter known throughout Palpebra as "Shining Eclair." Respected by fans and rivals alike for her artful swordsmanship.
A yokai princess from Yamato, all set to be the star of the holiday season—even if her "understanding" of it hinges on trends and magazine date tips.
The best troubleshooter in the world, or so he claims. He's actually quite skilled and makes good money, but all his paychecks are spent covering the destruction he's caused.
A bionic troubleshooter who dreams of freedom and the wide-open skies. She joins Alk and company in the hopes of seeing a real sky.
2:
She fulfilled her promised to show Love, her partner like no other, a real sky and made amends. Now their relationship is even stronger than before.

Their next plan: to have a picnic together.

1: Third son of the Swes family, one of the Farlands' Nine Houses, which presides over commerce and diplomacy. A merchant with a keen eye for steel, Libram has amassed an arsenal of the finest weapons unearthed from the Kaleidoscope. When deprived of his purse and weapons, however, he's rather pathetic.
Nephtim is an ancient, deadly weapon from the Kingdom of Sand... who has been scouted to perform at the Kaleidoscope's 50th Anniversary memorial event.
A vivacious swordswoman from a far-off world who founded the Gourmet Guild. Having a reputation as an extraordinary foodie, she tends to go hungry rather easily.

A famous violinist from Palpebra who moonlights as a solo adventurer. Her unique 'neo'-violin, which she found deep in the Kaleidoscope, is imbued with magical properties—in addition to sounding beautiful when played.

A young priestess from the Farlands who loves loafing around. She also happens to be a canonized saint in the Church of Farlana's Palpebran branch. Unfortunately, her position is entirely ceremonial, leaving her with little authority of her own.
The famed guide of the Kaleidoscope, who appears alongside floating lamps to bring all lost adventurers to safety.

A member of Franchouchou, the idol group comprised of zombies hailing from Saga. She was once a child prodigy actor featured all over TV. Though young, she is a dedicated professional and always works hard to be as cute as possible. She loves her supportive father more than anything.

A young oracle who fled the battlefield due to her own weakness and kind heart. Upon her escape, she discovered a dream worth protecting, and with the help of the Champion and her loyal knight, she continues to hone her newfound power.
2:
"We're free to choose... It's our life!"

That blue-skinned girl carried the same light within her. Once she realized this, the light in Phiria's heart took form. Procheon should have rejoiced, for Phiria had finally been shaped into the weapon he desired—except now, her blade pointed at him and not his foes.

1: A young adventurer with bold ambitions to clear the Kaleidoscope. Always vigilant, her charismatic personality draws the attention of many suitors—unfortunately, she's totally helpless when it comes to love.
A fighter with a crystalizing body. He travels the world searching for a way to undo the curse and find the monster who did this to him.

A swordswoman who dedicates her life to the Spirit Hunt, a tradition predicated on exterminating yokai. Supremely skilled, she fights with paper talismans and sword alike. Though serious about her job, she also likes to have fun and indulge herself.

After being tricked by a cunning elf, the last princess of the Stratos royal bloodline ends up on a beach in a faraway land. Despite her apprehension, her passion as a leader burns bright, and she takes the opportunity to learn more about the vibrant, sunny world around her.

When the daughter of the Nine-tailed Fox catches her friend with downturned eyes, 

she acts before she thinks and drags her friends all on vacation. 

Actions, after all, speak louder than words.

A purehearted girl from the Kingdom of Sand that just happens to be an ancient superweapon. 

Her travels with Alk and the others have led to many things, including the discovery of her sister, but this time, she simply wishes to enjoy summer.

The captain of the Guild Knights, rumored to be impossible to find on account of his constant slacking off. Some say he was once a secret agent, while others insist he was a Farlands soldier or disgraced noble. Never denying these rumors, he instead enjoys helping them spread.
2:
Alk and Stella. Nimbus and Light. These names, of course, he knew. He wasn't there to conduct a proper investigation, but he couldn't help but wonder the best way to blend in and get along with Alk and the others. Hopefully they'd be easy to handle.

"They're a real handful."

"You seem happy, though."

"Is that right?"

Perhaps he was getting softer with age.

1: A witch clad in black, who has long dwelt in the dimensional rift. She was once enemy to the champion Light, but her heart is now smitten by love for Alk and Stella.
A veteran monster hunter with a past shrouded in darkness. Although he can be brash and careless with his words at times, his battle prowess is anything but.

A half-elf with a human father. Mormia was banished from her homeland as a young girl, for the fair folk of the Elven Woods are forbidden to contact the outside world. As she roamed, she slipped through an interdimensional rift and arrived in Palpebra, where she honed her prowess with an enchanted blade.
A strange girl who traded half of her life force to the snake demon Cob in exchange for power. Reckless, she spends her days gleefully finding life-threatening trouble.
A fallen angel—one chosen by the Ark of Calamity—who holds the key to the new world she so desperately seeks.
A magic-wielding beastgirl from a distant world who belongs to the Gourmet Guild. Her bad mouth and thorny attitude rub people the wrong way, but deep down she has a warm and caring heart.
No longer adrift in the Endless Blue alone, Alice is ready to hit the beach with her new-found family and show off her new Gilles Couture swimsuit while she's at it.
2: While Gerard carried Alice upon his shoulders, the two came upon a fainted Luca on the beach. That was how their next adventure began—one to reclaim the Genome Quartz that Luca's father left to him.

1: A member of Franchouchou, the idol group comprised of zombies hailing from Saga. A famous idol from the Showa era, she helped popularize and pioneer idols. Possessing the best singing voice of all Franchouchou members, she remains humble and always tries earnestly to improve herself.
An android diva from another world who has dressed herself up as a Lil Devil for Halloween—though, admittedly, she's not 100% sure about the name.
2:
As long as she can reach people with her voice, this diva will do whatever she can to keep on singing.

Even if it means letting someone as terrifying as Renoir tinker with her.

1: A young, sea-faring salvager who—despite being 20 years old—indulges in elaborate fantasies others consider childish. These fantasies become reality, however, when a mysterious presence at the bottom of the sea grants her immeasurable power.
The leader of the moderate faction among the fiends. Though many of his people are short-lived, he somehow appears not to have aged a day in the past 50 years.
2:
The curse faded away with the morning sun. The mark of undeath in Adjudicus' left eye should have also disappeared, and yet, the power remained within him. Was it a new curse altogether, left behind by his uncle?

No. Adjudicus assured himself that he would decide things his own way from now on. Realizing that the words he encouraged himself with were much like that of some bright-eyed young boy, Adjudicus laughed.

1: A young fiend with the power to manipulate her dark shadow. She's really feeling the holiday joy in the costume her sister bought her! Wanting to become Santa herself, she races around town, handing out presents to everyone she meets.

A young girl who lived a normal life on a peaceful Float, until one day a mysterious power suddenly awoke within her. After a fateful encounter with a woman she met in her dream, she departs on a journey in search of knowledge and growth.
A woman who once hid her immense powers from others by living at the bottom of the ocean. Her proficiency in alchemy is due to her quest to understand her own mysterious powers.

A young girl who travels the sea, unrepentantly refusing to act her age. This time, in preparation for a desert adventure, she sports a new outfit which she claims "devours the light of the sun." The outfit is, of course, black.
2: Reading the room and keeping quiet for a bit, she finally broke her silence when it came time to face the unfathomable power of the Titan. Borrowing the power of her Lord, she gave Nimbus and the others the boost they needed before collapsing after a job well done.

1: A swordsman who found herself in another world while chasing primal beasts. She wields her partner Embrasque, a special sword capable of defeating primal beasts, and can read the blade's thoughts and feelings.
A skilled, one-eyed gunner who was once a Gaean Defense Captain. Now he's a handyman on a float in the middle of nowhere, but a part of him still worries about the comrades he once served with.

A young girl who lived in the forest around Palpebra. 

Her power to drain the life force from others has caused people to fear her. However, the black flowers that bloom from her magic are truly awe-inspiring.
A fugitive ninja who has come to Starview Village in search of a certain someone. Wielding dual blades that contain the essence of Orochi, he's a force to be reckoned with.
A stone-faced knight bearing the title Dragon Slayer. Though a worthy adventurer, his obsession with the beasts has led some to call him Dragon's Swain.

A summoner who has tamed beasts and monsters to do her bidding. Although she cares deeply for them, her possessive personality and apparent obsession with making others her "pets" can be off-putting for some.
Ninjas keep to a strict code—which Hanabi isn't having. Allegedly snuck into Starview long before Stella found her, and loves all things explosive.
A half-demon who became a demon hunter after losing his human mother. His supernatural heritage allows him to control fiery prosthetic limbs called "Ashmakers."

A veteran born to a house of mercenaries, but who chose the path of an adventurer. He bears a cursed shield that speaks and cannot be removed. Though Clyde is often irritated by boorish buckler, there's no denying the two make a fearsome pair in battle.
This spunky young adventurer discovered a pair of otherworldly handguns in the Kaleidoscope and hasn't looked back since. She tends to get flustered whenever she's treated like a "lady."
A journalist writing for a magazine called the Oculus. She's currently obsessed with introducing calligraphy to the people of Palpebra.

Levy's not your average Kaleidoscope trawler. She's got class and style, which has earned her a large following of swooning fangirls. Currently torn between being a glamorous diva and a sweaty, unbathed adventurer.
A somewhat skittish, gun-toting young girl hailing from the Endless Blue. Her natural talent for firearms and steady eye see to it that her shots never miss their mark.
A Crimson Blade pirate who wields twin pistols as his signature weapon. He is head over heels in love with Marina and will do anything for her.

A timid young girl from Palpebra with an incredible knack for fighting. However, due to her crippling shyness, she is unable to look other people in the eyes. She wears her current outfit at the orders of her master.
A broadsword-wielding girl who lives on the run in a desert town. Deep beneath her fearful eyes lie blazing anger and resentment.
A young swordsman with a pure heart and a strong sense of justice. Though he rushes in headfirst to help anyone in danger, he also sees all yokai as evil and shows them no mercy.

A member of Franchouchou, the idol group comprised of zombies hailing from Saga. Once upon a time, she was the legendary courtesan rumored to be behind numerous incidents during the Meiji Restoration. Nowadays, she uses her skills to give her fellow idols a guiding hand. Despite her competence in various areas, she tends to slap first and ask questions later, so she isn't without her faults.
A renowned professor of magic at Voluntas Academy. Despite her impressive teaching methods and dedication, she often botches experiments behind the curtain.
This former navy lieutenant once lost her crew to the cold depths of the sea. Nowadays, however, she can be seen helping out around the Guild for the holidays while dressed for the occasion.

Despite growing up in a family of shamans who erected a barrier to protect their village from yokai, this young girl actually loves them. This sheltered shaman is currently broadening her horizons in order to make her unspoken dream a reality.
A stalwart warrior known far and wide as a dragon slayer. Trading in his battle-worn armor for a pair of swim trunks, his appearance may have changed, but his desire to help others remains the same.
The young, amnesiac boy who was first to end up in Starview Village. His new cooking apron brings out his true character—reserved, dependable, and kind.
A knight of the Farlands, a kingdom lying countless leagues from Palpebra. He renounced the idle life of his aristocratic family and took up the sword, swearing fealty to the common people.
A selfless cleric who wanders the Kaleidoscope healing weary adventurers. Her charity earned her the nickname Angel of the Kaleidoscope.
This mermaid princess just wants to have fun! Although she despises studying, her fascination with humans and their relation to mermaids has no bounds.
2:
Claiming to not be delicious, this mermaid princess could only laugh at her predicament. A serious girl smacked her water tank with a barrel, before someone else unsheathed a shining blade!
It was a fun adventure, but Amelia noticed that all she did was get saved. Still, that wouldn't stop her from seeking out some more fun.

1: A lost child—er, lady—looking for her place in the world. Despite her juvenile appearance, a life of adversity has hardened her to be a bona fide survivor more than capable of fending for herself.

Staff at a borderlands guild. As Sharon's guild receives more errands than missions—searching for lost pets, picking up groceries—she worries that excitement-seeking adventurers will one day stop coming.
A mage that commands both water and poison. He is neither human nor merfolk, and devotes much of his time seeking out his own origins.

A desert-dweller who goes after gold like a dying man after water. He grew up poor and scrounged up whatever he could to make ends meet, so don't be surprised if he takes on work that isn't aboveboard.
A young diviner learning to convert the curse of a water snake into power. Utterly devoted to Suizen, Chair of the Diviners' Commission and, in her eyes, the hero who saved her life.

A sprite user who once spent all her time developing a concoction to raise the dead, only to have a fateful encounter send her life in another direction. The concept of ethics, however, has yet to cross her mind.

A mysterious masked knight who never reveals his true appearance. Equipped with a special trident for aquatic combat, his trusty helm, and a multipurpose flotation device, this knight vows to adhere to his strict code—even while on vacation.
2: While it was discovered in battle that he isn't the real Gerard, his path of chivalry remains unchanged. Towed on the ocean at a blistering speed before launching a charge, he was the first to board the pirate ship.

1: An adventurer residing in Palpebra. Extremely shy of her surroundings, she has the uncanny ability to sneak up behind people.
An adventurer possessed of incredible analytical skills and knowledge. Wearing her elegant blue kimono—and a parasol in place of a sword—she sets out to explore the land of Yamato.
A stylish mage who is only interested in the latest trends—whether it be fashion or magic. She carries around a massive tome that she uses to cast powerful magic spells.

A bounty hunter licensed by the Gaean government. 

She nearly drowned when she was a child, but was saved by a mermaid, whom she hopes to repay one day.
As servant of the yokai queen and Princess Inaho's governess, Shirano is a motherly figure loved by all. The summer sun casts her in a different light, however...

A student currently studying at the Gaean Royal Navy Academy. Despite his serious nature and dedication to becoming a full-fledged sailor, his handsome traits have made him a popular idol of sorts among the other students.
The famous, slightly crude captain of the Crimson Blades—now in summer-appropriate attire. She's here to expose lies, defy tyranny, and have a great time at the beach!

A weapon of the ancients, discovered within an old ruin in the Kingdom of Sand. Designed to resemble a person, her role was once to serve as the key to powering an artificial god. Now she travels new worlds to fulfill the new mission entrusted to her—to understand what it is that makes people so resilient.

A hero initially created as a commercial opportunity for Paradigm Break Company. While she may look like a shining paragon of justice, she still struggles with the darkness within herself. Nevertheless, she fights to protect the spark of light that lives in everyone.
A thunder dragon awoken from slumber atop Palpebra's lofty peaks. She speaks about her past only reluctantly, but it seems she was once a resident of a different world.
A brilliant scientist who has dedicated her life to the pursuit of science. Leave personal hygiene and socializing on the back burner for now—there's research to be done!

An android who thinks himself the most charming manager on the planet. Once, humans lived in his world, and he is fascinated by their culture. They have influenced everything about him, from his affectations to his physical framework.
2:
Regis was surprised that things went as well as they did.

When the masked girl first approached him, he knew not to trust her sly smile. Still, he was prepared to sell his soul in order to take back what was lost.

He had never intended to get Dia involved, and yet, she had saved them all. He owed her and their new friends a great debt—one he would repay even if it took the rest of his life to do so.

His methods may be questionable, but never let it be said his heart isn't in the right place.

1: An bladeswoman, whose command of lightning earned her the title Starflame. For an elf, she is rather bellicose and often makes forays into the dark places of the woods.
An elderly feline who beats to his own drum. While his self-proclaimed title of sage is disputable, his shamanistic abilities are the real deal.
A girl found lost in the Kaleidoscope. She was once feared by the Guild due to her violent rampages. Since meeting Alk, however, she has gained a measure of self-control.
It's the holiday season, and delivery requests are piling up. But there's nothing Aureo can't do with the help of his bird buddy, Baloosh.

The adopted son of a wealthy family. Unable to find it in his heart to trust others, Adonis stole money and a magical weapon from his foster parents before striking out on his own. He's a talented Kaleidoscope trawler.

An android created by the Administrator. After a failed rebellion that she and Regis led, she was turned into a bug. Eventually, Regis found Rudy roaming the world as a hollow, and restored her to her original form.
Summer vacation means an outfit change for the seafaring gambler. But a trip to the beach is not complete without a side of thrills and games, even when she's dressed to frolic in the water.
2: She somehow managed to win 16 times in a row at the slots! After that, she took on Bellaqua Casino's signature attraction—the Money Muncher.

1: A sword for hire who only accepts requests from upstanding citizens. She has a tendency to disregard danger, but always manages to pull her jobs off with a smile.

A member of Franchouchou, the idol group comprised of zombies hailing from Saga. Formerly the lead singer of an extremely popular idol group known as Iron Frill, she doesn't fear failure and has an inexorable drive to work hard until she gets to the top!
This brilliant yet seedy scientist originally hails from the floating settlements of Gaea. She'll dress up for a Halloween party, but really she's just here for specimen collecting.
2: This Halloween gave Renoir plenty of opportunities for research, from collecting data of lingering emotions, purifying said emotions, and even modifying an android. On the lookout for even more, she continues her quest of knowledge.

1: A young adventurer with devilishly good looks and an equally devilish personality. On a request from the Guild, he's chosen to wear some more festive clothing.
A Sheephird who teaches at Voluntas Arcane Arts Academy. Due to her young appearance, she worries that her students don't take her seriously enough.
An adventurer whose popularity in Palpebra is growing day by day. Her vivid fashion sense and big mouth have garnered her a following of very intense fans.
A young girl from Palpebra. Her body stores electricity, which she then discharges. A trusting individual, her naivety sometimes gets her into trouble.
An adventurer very passionate about collecting cryptic artifacts in the Kaleidoscope. Normally a calm individual, she gets very excited when talking about her beloved hobby.
A yokai from Yamato known as a zashiki warashi. She has a youthful appearance, but is in fact far older than any human. A resident zashiki warashi is said to bring good fortune to a household.

The descendant of a secret weapon left behind by a fallen kingdom, this tomboyish princess commands dolls and creation magic. She tears through every obstacle in sight, ready to enjoy life in a new world.
A perky, plucky tigress with an appetite for treasure. Often mistaken for a tomb raider, but insists she's no thief.

Fang Canyon's birdfolk pride themselves on their hunting prowess—and their best warrior, Aurore. He's free-spirited and always has his head in the clouds, but trusts the winds to guide him where they will.
A charming samurai who runs a small study hall on the outskirts of town. Though Soushiro speaks little of his past, he's said to have served a feudal domain—until its fall.
2:
"Thank you, Iori."

Putting his palms together before his deceased wife's memorial tablet, Soushiro thanked her. Though the living could not do much for the dead, he felt the need to express his gratitude nonetheless. For he believed it was her presence living within him that allowed him to protect others.

1: An elvish archer, come from the woods to do battle with the Lord of Shadow. She has a placid disposition, but can make swift decisions and take great risks at need. She is currently searching for her friend.
A staff-wielding canid soldier with a nose for danger. She spent so long on the battlefield that she's not entirely sure how to live off of it.

Rebecca lacks the confidence and refinement of other mages, but this New Year's she takes a stab at wearing traditional Yamato clothing. The unfamiliar fabrics, however, cause her to continuously trip and fall.
A bright and adventurous young canid that somehow ended up in another world for one reason or another.
A ninja who somehow retained a heart of gold even after a harsh upbringing and accidentally attaining the rank of commander. Her proper name is Suzukaze.
A bold and boisterous human girl raised by a tengu. She's trying to learn how to fit in with city slickin' girls her age.
The Garden of Sprites' only known human inhabitant. While Hao can fend for himself, he's kind at heart, and cares for the departed spirits traveling on the winds.

A girl who works as a maid with her younger twin sister Rem in the Kingdom of Lugunica. She was once a powerful demon, but lost most of her power when her horn was broken off. Though her prideful attitude and harsh words may imply otherwise, she is truly kind at heart and good at looking after others.
A young brawler whose father is a renowned pugilist. Though an incredibly talented fighter, he has grown tired of constantly obeying his father, and wishes to live life on his own terms.
The young star of Qualia City's hottest sport, ActFast. Her earnest desire to win matches fair and square makes her a favorite amongst the fans.
A little witch all alone in the big city. Due to her days spent struggling for every meal, she has foresight well beyond her years, especially when it comes to making a living.

An adventurer and hunter from Palpebra. 

With his winged companion Kaiser at his side, he never fails to track down his prey.

A young elf from a faraway world. To save her dearest friend, she set off on a journey that would take her across worlds, but never did she imagine a place like Starview Village would be in her cards.

A young diviner who has the power to bring art to life. Separated from her parents during the unification of the East and the West, she was taken in by a small village. Her life there ended when she lost control of her power, inadvertently destroying her new home.
A tiger who ended up stranded alone in a desert world. Once, he had everything taken from him. Now, he has so much, he's giving some of it away for the holidays!
An android diva, whose perfectly harmonized high-grade vocal coils resonate loud and proud for her fans on any stage—word has it she's still looking for a partner to form a unit with!
2:
Sigma Sector: A song echoes through the Diva Hall. Many were able to reclaim themselves. It may nearly be time for this diva to set out on her own adventure.

She wants to see Stella and the others right away, and yet, a part of her hesitates. Perhaps she'll go and just not tell Regis?

Oops. Looks like her manager noticed that little laugh she let out. Laughing more quietly this time, the diva is determined to outwit him moving forward.

1: A rather odd knight who is never seen without his helm. One might call him quixotic and obsessed with chivalry, but he's an honest fellow, well-trusted by his comrades.
An up-and-coming adventurer wunderkind with a knack for the arcane arts. Currently, she's gunning to conquer the Kaleidoscope and make a name for herself within just a year's time.
For this Guild Knight of Palpebra, the safety of its citizens comes first. His knightly devotion to maintaining law and order have made him a worthy second-in-command for the organization.
A proud member of the Guild Knights, an organization that patrols the city of Palpebra. Through her enduring dedication to her work, she has established an effectiveness and popularity in Palpebra.
A young eco-hunter who spends her time looking into the changing ecology around Palpebra. Her professor always sends her on odd jobs that he should be doing himself.
A Bionic troubleshooter from Qualia City, he's a good problem solver who can take on a wide variety of jobs. Just try not to mind his habit of being swept up in the latest trends.
As an illusionist, she casts light magic to charm and beguile. She left a good home behind to pursue her dreams.
A mercenary who works for the navy and protects Oceanus. Born in a small village on a northern island, she left her hometown to find a place where she could truly belong.
A kind, young cleric who has earned herself the name "Angel of the Kaleidoscope". Swimsuit at the ready, she goes on a tropical getaway, where she endeavors to help everyone with her healing powers.
2: After boarding the pirate ship with Nimbus and the others, Liesel quickly tended to the wounds of the defeated pirates, making sure everyone could make it back home after the dust settled. Even her foes were captivated by her kindness.

1: A young girl working as a lockpick in Palpebra. Using a mysterious bell she picked up in the Kaleidoscope, she can open any lock she finds, no matter how strong.
The last of the Stratos royal lineage, a family tasked with supporting the Champion and receiving oracles. Shakari, the Witch of Burning Blood, raised her since she was 4 years old.
2:
How was she able to believe in the flames once more? Did she truly understand the voices in the darkness?

She was only certain of one thing—that the young man was powerless, just like she was, and yet he chose to fight with all his being.

Refusing to be left behind, she kindled the flame in her heart and marched forward.

1: Full name: Medic Maintainer. An outlaw android doctor who will treat anyone in need. His curiosity knows no bounds, and while he means no harm, he always has the overwhelming urge to dissect the organic life-forms around him.
A soldier who disappeared into the fog in pursuit of the oracle created as a weapon. Though she has declared her intent never to return, she still struggles with her new freedom.
2:
The knight watched the light of her charge shine bright. She had grown strong—and she no longer needed anyone to guide her by the hand.

As the nearby fiend struggled with the growth of her younger sister, the knight found herself grappling with a similar feeling. She should be proud that her charge could stand on her own, and yet a strange sadness was mixed in with the pride.

1: An arena fighter who lives on a Float in the Endless Blue and makes her living fishing. Her flashy fighting style has garnered her a fervent following among the arena's patrons.

A mercenary and former member of the Crimson Blades pirates. After finding out about the Valentine's Fest and connecting it to a similar event in her hometown, she decides to make treats for those she cares about.
A young dogfolk girl searching for her missing parents. Coupled with her easy-going personality, her mysterious powers allow her to help others doze off into dreamland.
A priestess with distant claim to the Kingdom of Sand's throne. Her fight for borderlanders' equality has made her a symbol of hope—the Light of the Desert.

One of the few Monster Chefs you'd ever have the fortune (or misfortune) to meet. Her food tastes delicious, but the grotesque ingredients and gruesome presentation prove too high a hurdle for many would-be diners.

A witch doctor in love with Nimbus. In order to capture his heart, she spends her days devising concoctions to grow fur all over her body. Previously, she used sprites for her mixes, but she's since turned to other materials. The ears atop her head are of her own creation.
Fiend, master of cursed shadows, and lover of sweets. Her sister helped her escape from what may have been an army facility, but they were separated during the flight.
2:
She discovered that she didn't need to hurt anyone to eat cookies. She could even give cookies away if she wished. Everything would be her choice, including going wherever she wanted, whenever she wanted!

Perhaps she was going a little far with her freedom, but no one had the heart to deny her her fun.

1: A maid with military experience cleaning out enemy bases. She's got a strong sense of respect and discipline, and puts her all into her maid work.
